loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is 61 years old and lives with a live-in partner. He resides in Brgy. Villaba, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Currently, he is earning an income from a charcoal business. 

Claudio is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). He is applying for 50,000 PHP to pay for housing materials for house building. 

He is trusting PMPC as he has joined the institution and is obtaining loan.

loans.use: to pay for housing materials for house building

loans.name: Adelicio

texts.es:
Adelicio tiene 28 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su esposa tiene tres hijos a su cargo, viven el El Caserío El Frayle una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro criollo, tiene cultivado 2 has. en su terreno de su propiedad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Adelicio is 28 years old. He has a stable home alongside his wife and their three children. They live in  El Caserío El Frayle, a rural area in the Santo Tomás district. The local population work at farming, sales, and cattle ranching. It is located in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region, in the high planes of Peru.

Adelicio himself is a farmer, particularly of hardy hybrid yellow corn. He has two hectares of his own that he cultivates. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles, which he will use to pay for labor costs for the maintenance of his corn crop. That way, he'll have an optimal harvest to offer his customers and greater income for his family.

loans.use: pay for the labor to maintain his corn crop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 40 and lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with fourteen children and all attend school. He has a wholesale and retail textile shop.  He started his business in 2003.  His vision is to educate all his children, buy more land and build them good houses.  His challenge is price fluctuations of his products.
Julius is acquiring credit to buy fishing nets, clothes, salt and children's wear to sell.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, clothes, salt and children's wear to sell.

loans.name: Dilcia Elubina

texts.es:
Hace un tiempo atrás con un pequeño ahorro Dilcia adquirió un molino artesanal, de esa  forma logró  crear su propia fuente de trabajo en su hogar con el apoyo de su hermano mayor. Todos los días recibe con una enorme sonrisa y amabilidad a los clientes que necesitan el molino  para  triturar cacao, maíz, café y otros productos. Este negocio  poco a poco  le ha facilitado ingresos que han mejorado su calidad de vida. 
Sin embargo, el proceso del molino  con el que cuenta actualmente es manual, por lo tanto, es más lento, por lo que Dilcia solicita un financiamiento en KIVA  MiCrédito,  para la compra de un motor para molino que haga el proceso de trituración de los granos mas rápidamente.  Así  los clientes no tendrían que esperar mucho tiempo para recibir los productos procesados.  En un futuro  planea  contar con otro molino en un sector diferente, para ampliar su negocio y al mismo tiempo seguir mejorando  su estilo de vida.
texts.en: Some time ago, with a little savings, Dilcia acquired an artisanal mill.  With it she was able, with the help of her older brother, to create a job for herself in her home.  Every day she receives customers, who need the mill to grind cacao, corn, coffee, and other products, with cordiality and a huge smile.  This business has gradually been providing her with an income with which to improve her quality of life.  However, the mill she currently has is manual which makes it slow.  Dilcia requests a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to buy a motor for her mill which would grind the grain more quickly.  This way her customers wouldn't have to wait very long for their processed products.  In the future, Dilcia plans to get another mill in a different area to expand her business and in doing so continue to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her mill so she can grind grain more quickly

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, el negocio lo tiene en su residencia, ella aprendió esté oficio de su esposo, de quien actualmente está separada, es madre de dos hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad, los cuales la apoyan en su negocio, viven en casa propia.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de dos vaquillas, para fortalecer el negocio, tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar el ganado y la producción de lácteos, con los que mejorará la alimentación de su familia y al comercializarla tendrá ingresos extras.
Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para brindar un hogar más seguro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is in the business of raising and selling cattle, a business she runs from her residence. She learned this trade from her husband, from whom she is currently separated. She is the mother of two children, ages 19 and 16, who help her with her business. They live in their own home.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of two cows. This will strengthen her business, give her the possibility of expanding her cattle herd and the production of milk, which will both improve her family's nutrition and bring in extra income through its sales.

Her dream is to improve her house's infrastructure and provide a more secure home for her children.

loans.use: buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana, es madre trabajadora que lucha a diario para mantener a sus hijos siendo ahora madre soltera, su empleo es el de conserje en una casa particular. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y continuar levantando el muro lateral de su casa el cual va realizando paulatinamente de acuerdo a la capacidad de sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is a working mother who strives daily to support her kids now that she is a single mom.  She works providing domestic services in a private house.  She requests a loan to buy construction materials to continue raising the side wall of her house.  She has been building it gradually as her income allows.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, and gravel

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 50 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. 

For the past 12 years, Augustine has been working hard to manage his produce business which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, he has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce and will help Augustine to generate greater profits and add stock. Augustine hopes that in the future he will be able to increase profits. 

He is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Augustine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya  est un regroupement de femmes de Medina-Coura qui   vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Pagnes, Fruits  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. 
Mariam  est un membre du groupe Danaya,  deuxième personne debout de  la gauche vers la droite, vend de Pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de pagnes de toutes qualités qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ces pagnes au grand marché et dans les grandes boutiques de Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mariam compte réaliser  205 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group  of women from Medina-Coura who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. The women average 32 years of age and have at least four children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), fruits, and general merchandise. To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their sixth group loan. 

Mariam is a member of the group Danaya. She is the second person standing from the left in the photo, and she sells ‘pagne’ cloth. She intends to use her loan to purchase lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth of any quality that she sells retail to a diverse customer base. She procures this cloth at the big market and at the big shops of Koutiala. 

While the other members of the group Danaya plan on making an average profit of 190,000 francs CFA each over the course of the loan cycle, Mariam plans on making 205,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the women use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their capital. They would like to see this Soro Yiriwaso partnership stronger, so as to avoid inventory shortages.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Elvia Marina

texts.es: Marina es una señora viuda, tiene 66 años de edad, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, Marina vive sola debido a que sus 7 hijos ya son independientes, Mariana  siembra a medias con uno de sus hijos y pagan a otras personas para que les ayuden a realizar el trabajo que necesiten las plantas, con este nuevo crédito ella va a sembrar sola, y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y pagar mano de obra, comenta que en esta actividad de  cultivo de papas en algunas ocasiones   no le va tan bien porque el precio baja, pero ella es una señora perseverante y piensa positivamente y dice que en esta siembra va a tener buena ganancia, aspira incrementar su negocio  y seguir luchando hasta que Dios le de fuerzas.
texts.en: Marina, 66, is a widow.  She makes her living farming and raising small production animals.  Marina lives alone because her seven children are now independent.  She splits the planting with one of her children and they pay other people to help them with the work the plants need.  With this new loan she will plant alone, and she will spend it on fertilizer and labor.  She says that growing potatoes has on some occasions not gone so well for her because the price goes down, but she is a persevering woman and thinks positively.  She says that with this planting she is going to make a good profit.  She hopes to grow her business and keep striving as long as God gives her strength.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Reynante

texts.en:
Reynante is 36 years old, married, and living in Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

He earns an income from a business buying and reselling crustaceans. 

He became member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in 2013. Reynante is taking advantage of the project loan program of the said institution and obtaining 2,000 PHP for financing the crustaceans business. 

He is enthusiastic to improve his living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to finance his business buying and reselling crustaceans.

location.town: Tangub-Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en:
Ireen lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 33 years old and deals in produce buying and selling. She has four children, and all of them attend school.

She dreams of expanding her business to a well-stocked produce store serving people in and outside Hoima. Scarcity and seasonality of products like maize hinder her business.

Ireen intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the southern hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flow of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to sell their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Janet is married and has seven children. She runs a small business while her husband works as a chef. 

Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 10 years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, green grams, and sunflowers on their farm. Janet is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project for her to undertake, and it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Janet’s first loan with Honey Care Africa, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Janet’s hope for the future is to expand her beekeeping project and earn more income from it to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts for her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura. Elles font le petit commerce, d’habillement et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ére cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mah    (1ére  femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits dans le quartier  Sido Sonikoura et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de pagnes wax  pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mah  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  15.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Benkadi all live in nuclear families, and they average 33 years of age and six children each, all living in the Sido Sonikoura district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the Sido Sonikoura district. They have small-scale businesses involving clothing and condiments. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mah (the woman standing first from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of clothing in and around the Sido Sonikoura district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 pieces of clothing made of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in order to satisfy customer demand. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Mah is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used for meeting the various need of her children and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' clothing

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Yiriwa vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Siguila de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village Siguila. Elles font le petit commerce, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  12éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Bintou  (1ére  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galettes dans le village Siguila et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mil  pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente des galettes se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Bintou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Yiriwa all live in traditional families, and they average 45 years of age and five children each, all living in the village of Siguila de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village of Siguila. They have small-scale businesses involving food service and selling grains. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 12th solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Bintou (the woman sitting first from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of galettes in and around the village of Siguila. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of millet in order to satisfy customer demand. Her sales of galettes are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Bintou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used for helping out her husband and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase millet

loans.name: Rogelio Antonio

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Rogelio con su credikiva, pues con él logró comprar mercancías varias como ropa, calzado, útiles escolares, electrodomésticos menores etc.  Con su credikiva se incrementaron los inventarios que le permiten cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes, Sus condiciones habitacionales mejoraran  y así mismo el incremento de sus compradores. En su mensaje de agradecimiento Rogelio pide a los financiadores de Kiva que sigan acompañando a los microempresarios para que logren sus metas.  En la actualidad Rogelio está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará mercancías variadas como electrodomésticos menores, para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes en el presente y en el futuro.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Rogelio with his Kiva loan, with it he was able to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes, school supplies, small appliances, etc.  With his Kiva loan inventory grew which allowed him to cover his clients' needs.  His living conditions improved and his clientele increased.  In his thank you note Rogelio asks Kiva lenders to "continue supporting micro-entrepreneurs so that they can achieve their goals".  Rogelio is now requesting a Kiva loan to buy items for the home such as small appliances to cover his present and future customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy items for the home such as small appliances

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Sabali  vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Douga wêrê de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village Douga wêrê. Elles font le petit commerce, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  11éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sétou   (3éme  femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de lait dans le village Douga wêrê et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de litres de lait  pour satisfaire de plus  en plus la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Sétou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Sabali all live in traditional families, and they average 44 years of age and six children each, all living in the village of Douga Wêrê of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village of Douga Wêrê. They have small-scale businesses involving food service and selling grains. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eleventh solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sétou (the woman standing third from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of milk in and around the village of Douga Wêrê. She intends to use her loan to purchase many liters of milk in order to satisfy the burgeoning customer demand. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Sétou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for supporting part of the family and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase fresh milk

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es:
Marta, tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su nuera y una nieta, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales Herbalife, lo aprendió de un amigo, ella alquila un local en el que tiene su negocio, su ventaja es la zona en la que está ubicada.
Comprará tés, vitaminas, polvos para licuados, cremas, jabones, etc., que le ayuden a tener un mejor inventario para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, espera aumentar la afluencia de sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
Su visión es continuar trabajando para salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 57 and lives with her daughter-in-law and a granddaughter.  She sells Herbalife natural products, which she learned to do from a friend.  She rents a locale where she has her business.  The advantage of it is the location.  Marta will buy teas, vitamins, smoothie mixes, lotions, soaps, etc.  This will help her to have a better inventory so she can provide a good service for her customers.  She hopes to increase the number of customers she gets and improve her sales and income.  Her vision is to continue working so she and her family can get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy teas, vitamins, smoothie mixes, lotions, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 38 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail shop selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cowpeas, bread, sodas, juice and other items. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cowpeas, bread, sodas, juice and other items. It will help Juliet to generate greater profits and improve her business. Juliet hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, cowpeas, bread, sodas, and juice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts for his motorized taxi

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. Neither of the children is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Twaha has been working hard to manage his electronics shop, which sells electronic items. 

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronic items, and will help Twaha to generate greater profits and increase his investments. Twaha hopes that in the future, he will be able to have more businesses. 

Twaha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Twaha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more electronic items

loans.name: Mutwawbi

texts.en:
Mutwawbi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Mutwawbi has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells basins, slippers, baking flour, sweets and soap. 

To help expand his business, Mutwawbi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more   basins, slippers, baking flour, sweets, and soap, and will help Mutwawbi to generate greater profits and expand his business. Mutwawbi hopes that in the future, he will be able to construct a rental house. 

Mutwawbi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mutwawbi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more basins, slippers, baking flour, sweets, and soap

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Sewa  vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Hamdallaye. Elles font le petit commerce, de condiment, d’habillement et de savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam (femme assise devant dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le quartier Hamdallaye et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grand quantité suffisante de condiments de tout  genre pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  65 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Sewa all live in nuclear families, and they average 40 years of age and five children each, all living in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the Hamdallaye district. They have small-scale businesses involving condiments, clothing, and soap. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariam (the woman sitting in front in the photo) is a major vendor of condiments of all kinds in and around the Hamdallaye district. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of all kinds of condiments sufficient for satisfying the burgeoning customer demand. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Mariam is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used for supporting part of the family and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Sabougnouman  vivent toutes dans des familles nucleaires. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Sido sonikoura. Elles font le petit commerce, de restauration, d’habillement et de riz. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ére cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Zenabou (2éme  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pâté et de farine sucrée dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grand quantité suffisante de farine pour satisfaire de plus  en plus la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Zenabou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Sabougnouman  vivent toutes dans des familles nucleaires. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura. Elles font le petit commerce, de restauration, d’habillement et de riz. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ére cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Zenabou (2éme  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pâté et de farine sucrée dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grand quantité suffisante de farine pour satisfaire de plus  en plus la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Zenabou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Sabougnouman all live in nuclear families, and they average 40 years of age and five children each, all living in the Sido Sonikoura district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the Sido Sonikoura district. They have small-scale businesses involving food service, clothing, and rice. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Zenabou (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of pâté and sweetened flour in and around the Sido Sonikoura district. She intends to use her loan to purchase large quantity of flour sufficient for satisfying the burgeoning customer demand. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Zenabou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for supporting part of the family and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase flour for her restaurant

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: Juana de 38 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Juana es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, está dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Juana is 38 and lives with her husband and children.  She has a store where she sells basic items.  Recently she has gained a lot of customers because she always has what people need:  products of excellent quality at truly accessible prices and incomparable service.  Juana is an enterprising woman with a lot of drive to get ahead in life.  She wants to feel like a winner and her biggest secrets to success are constancy and dedication.  She is prepared to grow her business so she requests a loan from Apoyo Integral to buy basic grains and pulses, instant products, cold cuts, snacks, drinks, etc.  She is confident that with dedication she will be able to give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and pulses, instant foods, cold cuts, snacks, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucleaires. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Hamdallaye. Elles font le petit commerce, de la restauration, d’habillements et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  7éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Adiaratou (2éme  femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le quartier Hamdallaye et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grand quantité suffisante de condiment de tout genre  pour satisfaire de plus  en plus la demande de sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Adiaratou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  67 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé aider pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Benkadi all live in nuclear families, and they average 33 years of age and five children each, all living in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the Hamdallaye district. They have small-scale businesses involving food service, clothing, and grains. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their seventh solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Adiaratou (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of condiments of all kinds in and around the Hamdallaye district. She intends to use her loan to purchase large quantity of all kinds of condiments sufficient for satisfying the burgeoning customer demand. Her sales are made to a customer base mostly of women paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Adiaratou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 67,000 francs CFA that will be used for helping out her husband and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para empezar a limpiar el terreno de la maleza y sembrar sin problemas, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes y pago de mozos para realizar los trabajos.
Con el capital anterior tuvo los insumos agrícolas necesarios para mejorar su cosecha, tener mejores ingresos y cancelar en su momento la deuda. Dentro de su familia han celebrado el triunfo de su hija, pues ha culminado sus estudios de enfermería y les brinda un poco de apoyo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Maria decided to get a new loan to begin cleaning weeds from the land and planting without any problems. She will invest in buying compost, insecticides, and fertilizers and pay for men to do the work.

With the previous loan, she had the agricultural supplies necessary to improve her harvest, have better income, and pay the debt in due course. 

Within her family, they have celebrated the triumph of her daughter, since she has finished her nursing studies and offers them a little support with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and fertilizers and pay men to do the work

location.town: Canton San Francisco, San Simon, Morazan.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 28 years old and deals in produce like rice, groundnuts and maize. She has three children and two of them attend school. She dreams of expanding her business into new market areas, thus increasing her sales and profits. Scarcity of products like maize and seasonal changes hinder her business.

She is acquiring credit to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, con la ayuda del crédito anterior pudo mantener su negocio surtido de la materia prima, sus ventas aumentaron y con las nuevas ganancias ha mejorado su vivienda.
Con el crédito que solicita comprara una cocina nueva, maíz y gas propano, para aumentar la producción de tortillas y tener más ingresos con los cuales continuara mejorando el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Paulina, with the help of the previous loan, was able to maintain her business with a range of raw materials. Sales have increased and with the profits she has improved her accommodation.

With the loan requested, she will buy a new stove, corn and propane gas, to increase production of tortillas and have more income with which to continue improving her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a new stove, corn and propane gas.

loans.name: Betty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Betty de 45 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es agricultor.

A la edad de 12 años ayudaba a su padre en la agricultura, hoy conoce muy bien esta actividad. Por lo cual siembra en una área de 6,000 mts la cual es trabajada junto con su esposo quien le ayuda con las diferentes actividades a realizar mediante se vaya dando el ciclo productivo. Ademas, Betty no solo depende de la agricultura, si no también tiene ingresos por realizar oficios domésticos donde una vecina.

Con el crédito se estará ayudando a Betty para que pueda invertir en la agricultura, comprara semilla, abonos, pesticidas y herbicidas. De esta forma aportara para los gastos del hogar.

Betty desea gozar de muy buena salud, ya que solo así podrá tener fuerzas para continuar trabajando y logrando sus objetivos. Le gustaría tener ganado y aprender a leer y escribir de muy buena forma.
texts.en:
Betty is 45 years old and did not have the opportunity to attend school. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.

At the age of 12, Betty helped her father with the farming duties and now she is very knowledgeable about this type of work. She is planting an area that measures 6,000 square meters with her husband, who helps with the various activities that are conducted throughout the production cycle. Betty is not solely dependent on agriculture. She also earns income from performing household chores for a neighbor.

This loan will help Betty invest in her farming. She will buy seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides. This will allow her to cover her household expenses. Betty wants to experience good health. She has the strength to continue working and accomplishing her goals. In addition, she enjoys tending to livestock and learning how to read and write well.

loans.use: buy seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme MARIAM debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes BENKADI, fait la vente des  pagnes wax réal. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son pret  5 pièces de pagne wax réal au grand marché  et  revend en détail sur place et à SANOUBOUGOU II à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the group BENKADI are married women, who average 31 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in SANOUBOUGOU II, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they are on their first solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Ms. MARIAM, standing second from the left in the photo, is the one who sells clothing made of Wax Réal ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in this women’s group BENKADI. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 pieces of Wax Réal ‘pagne’ clothing at the big market. She sells retail to men and women customers paying with cash or credit  locally and in SANOUBOUGOU II.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for paying back the loan with interest, and the other, for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase Wax Réal 'pagne' clothing

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe   KOTOGNOGONTALA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme KADIA debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  KOTOGNOGONTALA, fait la vente des  bois. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 chargements de charrettes en bois dans les villages environnant de la ville de SIKASSO et revend en détail sur place à SANOUBOUGOU II à une clientèle composée des femmes de ménage au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in SANOUBOUGOU II, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they are on their first solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. KADIA, standing second from the right in the photo, is the one in this women’s group KOTOGNOGONTALA who sells firewood. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 cart loads of wood in the villages around Sikasso City. She sells at the retail level to a customer base composed of housekeepers paying with cash or credit locally and in SANOUBOUGOU II.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for paying back the loan with interest, and the other, for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Tileneya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe TILENEYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme ABI debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes TILENEYA, fait la vente des  poissons fumés. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  15 kg de poisson fumé au grand marché pour la revendre en détail  sur place et à  OUAYERMA I à une clientèle composée des femmes de ménage au comptant et à crédit  dont elle est beaucoup sollicitée sa clientéle par la qualité de ses marchandises.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group TILENEYA are married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in OUAYERMA I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they are on their seventh solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. ABI, standing second from the left in the photo, is the one in this women’s group TILENEYA who sells smoked fish. She intends to use her loan to purchase 15 kg of smoked fish at the big market. She sells retail to a customer base composed of housekeepers paying with cash or credit locally and in OUAYERMA I.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 18,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for paying back the loan with interest, and the other, for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’habits et de tasses à l’image de MAÏMOUNA qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 8 pièces de pagnes et 40 tasses avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of four married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the MASSABLACOURA district of Bougouni City. And they know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity, so as to have better businesses, they joined the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth loan with it. The four previous loans were correctly paid back. 

This group of women does commerce in clothing and basins, as does MAÏMOUNA, who is the first woman sitting from the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 9 pieces of clothing made of ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and 40 basins from wholesalers from Bamako. She makes her sales at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at her home. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business  and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and basins

loans.name: Blanca Eveli

texts.es: Blanca tiene  67 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace muco tiempo. Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable quien es muy conocida en su comunidad como una mujer luchadora. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su vivienda dado que no cuenta con el servicio.
texts.en: Blanca is 67 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has worked in housekeeping services since a short time ago. Blanca is a very hardworking and responsible woman who is known in her community as someone who strives to get ahead. With the desire to improve her living conditions, she has decided to apply for this loan with FUSAI to invest in the installation of electric energy in her home since they do not currently have this service.

loans.use: to invest in the installation of electric energy in her home.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week so that she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Maria Leonza

texts.es:
María, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo financiero y la facilidad de pago que se le brinda, con los créditos ha tenido a su disposición los materiales necesarios para hacer crecer su negocio y tener una situación económica favorable.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de agujas, hilos en diferentes colores y grosor, para elaborar las hamacas, de esa manera se mantendrá en el mercado.
texts.en: María is grateful for the institution and the financial support and payment ease they have afforded her. With the loans, she has had the necessary materials on hand to grow her business and have a favorable financial situation. With this opportunity, she is applying for a new loan to invest in the purchase of needles, and thread in various colors and thickness to make hammocks. This way she can support herself in the market.

loans.use: to buy needles, and thread in various colors and thickness.

loans.name: Amada Pastora

texts.es:
Hace 21 años, doña Amada cumplió con el sueño de establecer su propia pulpería. Sin haber tenido la oportunidad de haber ido a la universidad, su actitud de comerciante lo llevaba en la sangre, pues a sus 59 años ya es un pequeña empresaria que lucha día a día con las temporadas bajas que algunas veces son provocadas por la falta de productos en venta que algunas veces tiene por problemas económicos. 
Amada anteriormente había prestado en MiCrédito-KIVA, lo que le permitió hacer crecer su negocio gracias a que pudo comprar granos básicos y golosinas para variar los productos. Ahora, necesita de otro préstamo para seguir creciendo como comerciante, pues desea invertir de nuevo en la compra de arroz, frijoles, golosinas y gaseosas, ya que es lo que la permite seguir en pie. Amada junto a su esposo que todo el tiempo la ha apoyado en su negocio, sueñan con seguir invirtiendo para lograr tener una pulpería más grande que le ayudará obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos de ella y su familia.
texts.en: 21 years ago, Amanda fulfilled her dream to establish her own convenience store.  Without having the opportunity to go to university, her merchant aptitude ran through her blood, at 59 years old she is a small entrepreneur that fights daily with slow season, sometimes caused by low of merchandise, due to financial problems.  Amanda had a previous Kiva loan, which allowed her to make her business grow as she was able to buy basic grains and snacks to have a variety of products.  She is requesting a new loan to continue growing as a retailer, he wants to invest his momney in buying rice, beans, snacks and soda, which allows her to keep going.  Amanda and her supporting husband dream to continue investing to be able to have a bigger store that help her earn more income to cover her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, snacks and soda.

loans.name: Erick Otoniel

texts.es:
Erick de 25 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está soltero, no tiene hijos, de él depende su madre,  y su padre ya que solo con ellos vive, es empleado tiene tres años de trabajar en una ferretería, a parte de ser empleado se dedica a criar ganado. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ladrillo y teja para mejorar su casa y ampliarla un poquito más, desea que su casa se encuentre en mejor estado y poco a poco irla mejorando y que en un futuro vivir en mejor condición.
texts.en:
Erick is 25 years old and studied until the third year of high school. He is single and does not have children. His mother and father depend on him because he is the only one that lives with them. He has been working as an employee at a hardware store for three years. Part of his job is dedicated to raising livestock. 

He will use this loan to buy brick and tile to improve his house and expand it a bit more. He wants his house to be in a better state. Little by little he is improving it and in the future it will be in better condition.

loans.use: to buy brick and tile to improve his house and expand it a bit more.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAÏDOU est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce   d’habits à l’image de MARIAM qui est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 balle et demi de friperie  avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group consists of four married women who on average are 33 years old with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the  Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the institution Soro Yiriwaso where they are on their fifth loan. The previous four loans were repaid in full. 

This group of women trades clothing like Mariam, who is the second woman sitting in the photo from left to right. She intends to use the loan to buy one and a half bales of used clothing from wholesalers in Bamako. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 35,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto soltero mayor de edad con cuatros hijos todos mayores de edad originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, Juan es un microempresario el cual se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de productos de medicina natural para todo tipo de enfermedades curativas y preventivas como:limpia colon, laurel, pomadas, vitaminas, miel de palo, edraelix, bololo, gordolobo, pomada de la vaca, entre otros productos mas, ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus compras las realiza en el campo y otros los encarga o viaja a otros países, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, también entrega a farmacias en otros departamentos, su demanda ha crecido debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y son accesibles para sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar mas su capital de trabajo.El objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo en al compra de materia prima de elaboración de medicina natural, como: miel de palo, vasos plásticos, inyecciones, diferentes pomadas, vitaminas entre otros mas, Juan Alberto agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is a single man with five adult children. He comes from a municipality in Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. He is known for being a hardworking and responsible man with a strong desire to better himself. Juan is a micro-entrepreneur working on the production and commercialization of healing and preventive natural medicines for all types of illnesses. His natural medicines include colon cleansing products, laurel, pomades, vitamins, honeycomb, ivy and mullein, among many others. 

His business is located in one of the rooms in his house. He buys some of his products in the country side and others he orders or buys in other countries. His sales are paid in cash or through credit and he has regular and occasional customers. He also sells to pharmacies in other regions. Demand for his products has increased due to the quality of the products he offers and because they are easily accessible to his customers. One of his dreams is to be able to increase his working capital. This loan is for working capital to be used in the purchase of raw materials to produce natural medicines, such as honeycomb, plastic cups, injections, different pomades and vitamins, among others. Juan Alberto thanks the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production of different types of natural medicines.

loans.name: Santiago Isabel

texts.es: Doña Santiago de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien es agricultor, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tamales de elotes, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Doña Santiago está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como: elotes por mayor, leche, azúcar, etc. para poder seguir elaborando mas tamales y si obtener mejores ingresos para que ella y su esposo puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Santiago is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her husband who is a farmer. She works selling and preparing sweetcorn tamales. Her business is located in the municipal market located near her residence. She has many customers due to good prices and her friendliness.

Ms. Santiago is applying for a loan to buy necessary ingredients such as wholesale sweetcorn, milk, sugar, etc. This will allow her to continue making more tamales and increase her income so that she and her husband can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweetcorn, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ella vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo. Maria solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal  para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and works selling tortillas in her home. For many years, she has worked Monday through Sunday. She has many customers because she is a hardworking and kind person. With her profits and the help of her husband, they are able to cover their living expenses. She lives in her own home with her two children and husband. 

Maria is applying for a loan to buy corn in bulk and lime powder to continue preparing tortillas. This way she can increase her earnings to have a better financial foundation for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime powder.

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 29ans, mr koami a pour femme une revendeuse et ils ont 01 enfant de 03ans en charge. Koami quant à lui est revendeur de chaussures dans un marché de la place depuis 2000. Pour mieux satisfaire ses nombreux clients, il fait son quatriéme crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Son souhait est de rendre pérenne son activité tout en assurant un meilleur avenir à sa famille.
texts.en: A young, 29-year-old man, Koami is married to a reseller and the couple are raising one 3-year-old child. Koami has been a shoe-seller at a local market since 2000. He is requesting his fourth loan from WAGES so that he can buy merchandise and better satisfy his numerous customers. His wish is to make his business sustainable whilst also ensuring a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es:
El señor José Santiago  de 58  años de edad,   no tiene  hijos   que dependen  de él, vive con su conyugue en su casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad de el Rosario, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta maíz, su venta es de lunes a domingo sus clientes son los dueños de pulperías y personas que se dedica a vender tortillas.
Don Santiago está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de 30 cargas de maíz  ya que necesita el préstamo para mejorar su negocio, ya que tiene varias ofertas de personas que le venden este producto más barato y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad de comprar el maíz a mejor precio.
Don Santiago su sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Sr. José Santiago is 58 years old and has no dependent children. He and his spouse live in their own home, which is located in the community of El Rosario in southern Honduras. For the past three years, José Santiago has been in the business of selling corn. He sells Monday through Sunday and his customers consist of grocery store owners and people who sell tortillas.

Don Santiago is requesting a loan in order to buy 30 loads of corn. He needs this loan so that he can improve his business. Santiago has already received several offers from people who sell this product at a cheaper price, so he wants to take advantage of this opportunity to buy corn at the best price.

Don Santiago dreams of improving his home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2014

loans.use: to buy 30 loads of corn that he can sell in his business.

loans.name: Katherine Marchella

texts.es:
Durante los 5 años como estudiante de la Carrera de Farmacia, Katherine ha caminado lentamente, pero con pasos seguros para poder cumplir el sueño de tener su título universitario. Gracias al apoyo moral y económico de su hermana y de su tío, quien la mira como su hija y que desde Costa Rica le manda dinero, producto de su trabajo en la siembra de café, para que nunca deje sus estudios. 
Katherine a sus 24 años tiene sus metas ordenadas, pues se siente apasionada en su carrera, ya que sabe es importante el tema de la salud. Hace más de un año, empezó a trabajar como despachadora de farmacia, sin dejar a un lado sus estudios. Por esta razón es que necesita del préstamo para poder pagar su curso de titulación, que le permitirá tener un mejor trabajo y convertirse en una experta en farmacia y así cumplir su meta de poder establecer su propia farmacia.
texts.en:
Katherine has worked slowly but steadily towards her dream of having a college degree during her 5 years as a pharmacy major. She has never had to abandon her studies thanks to the moral and financial support of her sister, and her uncle, who sees Katherine as his daughter, and who from Costa Rica has sent money and products from his job planting coffee.

Katherine has had her goals organized since she was 24 because of the passion she has for her career and her understanding of the importance of health issues. Over a year ago, she began working as a dispatcher at a pharmacy without having to stop her studies. For this reason, she needs the loan to pay for a class to help receive her qualification; this will allow her to have a better job and become an expert in the pharmacy field. In this way, she will fulfill her goal of establishing her own pharmacy.

loans.use: to pay for a class to help receive her qualification

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta soltero y no tiene hijos.  Es agricultor de toda su vida, empezó a trabajar junto con su padre, ahora cultiva 7,000 mts de  cultivo de maíz y frijol, el cual esta a 1 km de su casa. Trabaja de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar semilla de maiz y frijol, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, para producir 7,000 mts de maíz y frijol.

Su deseo es tener una familia con quienes pueda compartir su vida. También espera tener una buena producción, ya que de esta forma podrá generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin studied through the third grade. He is single and has no children. Edwin has been a farmer his entire life. He began working with his father and now he cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. This plot of land is located one kilometer from his house. Edwin works from 6:00 A.M. to 12:00 noon.

His loan will be used to buy corn and bean seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides so that he can produce 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. His wish is to have a family with whom he can share his life. He also hopes to have good production so that he can generate income.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana de 32 años de edad, es licenciada en administración de empresas, está acompañada, su compañero de vida es taxista, con ella vive su compañero de vida y su hijo, de ella depende su hijo.
Ana  administra una tienda desde el 2012, vende productos de belleza por catálogo, la motivo su hermana a la venta de productos de belleza, la tienda la tiene en su casa.  El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en la tienda, pues quiere tenerla más surtida, comprar, verduras, aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, detergentes, refrescos, etc  desea que su tienda crezca y que su familia  tenga más ingresos y una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old, has a degree in business administration. She has a partner who is a taxi driver.  She lives with her ​​partner and their child.  The child depends on her.

Ana has been managing a store since 2012, selling beauty products from catalogs.  She was inspired to sell beauty products by her sister and the store is in her house.

The loan will be used to invest in the store because she wants to have more variety, buying vegetables, oil, rice, beans, sugar, detergents, soft drinks, etc. She wants the shop to grow and her family to have more income and better conditions in life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, oil, rice, beans, sugar, detergents, soft drinks, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a plot of land where he will farm and to improve his home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Elizabeth siempre con su afán de terminar su casita y mejorarla lo más que pueda, este crédito que está solicitando lo requiere para la compra de Perlines, Cemento, Bloques y un Inodoro, ya que ella está utilizando por el momento una letrina y quiere mejorar sus condiciones, Agradece la confianza y apoyo que ha recibo de Kiva y Afodenic con este crédito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth has always had the desire to finish her house and make it as nice possible.

The loan that she is requesting is needed to purchase purlins (beams), cement, concrete blocks and a toilet.  She is currently using a latrine and wants to improve conditions. 

She appreciates the confidence and support she has received from Kiva and Afodenic for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 55 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 9 años  de edad. Marina es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de tamales y tortillas desde hace nueve años. Marina solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea instalar el servicio de energía eléctrica en su vivienda puesto que no cuenta con el servicio y desea dar mejores condiciones de vida y de desarrollo a su familia. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la instalación lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old and lives in her own home along with her life partner and 9-year-old daughter. Marina is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked in the business of selling tamales and tortillas for nine years. 

Marina is applying for a loan with FUSAI because she wants to install electric energy service in her home. She does not currently have this service and she wants to improve her living conditions and better family development. She is counting on the financing so that she can begin the installation as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in the installation of electric energy in her home.

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es: Vilma de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Vilma es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha tomado la  decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y así darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Vilma is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She considers herself to be an honest and hardworking woman. Above all else, she is very entrepreneurial. Several years ago, she started a small store in her home. Thanks to God and her hard work and dedication, the business is well-recognized in the area so she has many customers. 

For Vilma, it is very important to maintain this business as it is her primary source of income. She has decided to apply for a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of store merchandise such as eggs, candies, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread and other items that might be attractive to customers. This way she hopes to realize her dream of maintaining an active business and giving her family a stable financial foundation.

loans.use: to buy eggs, candies, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet breads, and more items.

loans.name: Mariela Floralba

texts.es: Doña Mariela  tiene 42 años, ella vive con su esposo, 2 hijos y un ñieto, ya que su hija de 17 años ya es madrede un bebe,  Mariela es una persona luchadora y que aunque su esposo tambien trabaja, ella a optado por salir adelante  con el proposito de mejorar su  calidad de vida y la de ellos ,se ha dedicado 7 años a la ganaderia y desde entonces esta actividad se ha venido formando como un sustento mas en la familia, ella se ha caracterizado como una persona muy responsable y con el nuevo credito ella pretente comprar una vacona y asi poder incrementar sus ingresos, el anehelo mas grande de ella es poder ver a sus hijos
texts.en:
Doña Mariela is 42 years old and lives with her husband, two children, and a grandson. Her 17-year-old daughter is already a mother with a baby.

Mariela is a determined individual. Even though her husband works, she chose to move forward with the intention of improving her quality of life and that of her loved ones. Mariela has been raising livestock for seven years. Since then, this activity has become the main source of income for her family.

Mariela is known for being a very responsible person. With this new loan, she intends to buy a cow so that she can increase her earnings. Her greatest wish is being able to see her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Osman Gabriel

texts.es: El joven Osman es de profesión bar tender, tiene su responsabilidad de hogar como esposo, por lo que ha formado un pequeño negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación para equilibrar sus gastos principales. Osman solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y poder realizar un segundo cuarto y mejorar el techo de una parte de su vivienda, gracias al financiamiento comprara bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, laminas de zinc y perlines.
texts.en: The young Osman is a professional bartender. As a husband, he is responsible for the home. He has formed a small general store business in his home to balance out his principle expenses. Osman is applying for a loan to buy construction materials to be able to complete a second room, and improve the roof on one part of his home. Thanks to the loan, he will buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, zinc siding, and rafters.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, zinc siding, and rafters.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’alimentation générale dans une boutique, Akossiwa vit avec son conjoint professeur et leurs enfants à Lomé. Elle exerce cette activité pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer. Démarré l'activité il y a un moment, elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son quatrième crédit lui permettra d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale pour mieux satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle espère agrandir son activité et aider ses enfants à mieux s’épanouir.
texts.en:
A retailer in a grocery store, Akossiwa lives with her husband, a teacher, and their children in Lomé. She runs this business to help her husband cover household expenses.

Having started her business some time ago, she gets her supplies in Lomé. Her fourth loan will enable her to purchase grocery items in order to further satisfy customers' needs. She hopes to expand her business and help her children do better in their development.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr: Madame Liliane est née en 1955. Elle a pour mari un retraité et mère de 02 enfants en âge adulte. Depuis 1989, elle revend au marché des tissus coupons et s'approvisionne au marché de Hédzranawoé. N'arrivant plus à satisfaire les clients à cause de manque de marchandises, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. Elle espère avec le profit, réinvestir dans l'activité et assurer l'auto suffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliane was born in 1955. Her husband is retired and she is the mother of two adult children. Since 1989, she has been reselling fabric swatches at a local market which she buys at the Hédzranawoé market.

Unable to satisfy customers because of the lack of goods, she is requesting a second credit loan from WAGES to achieve her objective. She hopes to reinvest profits in the business and ensure the family's nutritional self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy fabric swatches

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de 03 enfants scolarisés, Akossiwa a pour conjoint un enseignant. Elle revend depuis 2010 des produits alimentaires(riz, oignons,œufs, tomates...) à domicile. Le premier crédit sollicité de WAGES lui servira à augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Madame Akossiwa à l'avenir, espère avoir sa propre boutique et aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mother of three children attending school, Akossiwa is married to a teacher. Since 2010 she has been selling food products (rice, onions, eggs, tomatoes, ...) from her home.

This first loan requested from WAGES will serve to increase her stock supply so she can satisfy customer needs. In the future Mrs. Akossiwa hopes to have her own shop and help her husband with family expenses.

loans.use: Buy general food products
