loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of quality used clothes to sell. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to have her own stall so she no longer has to rent. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her study of the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 25 years old and sells new clothes (gents wear), a business she started in 2010. She dreams of expanding her business and transforming it into a renown boutique in town serving men, women and children. Seasonality, which causes customers to turn up in big numbers on big days like Easter and Christmas, affects her business.

Christine will use the loan to buy more shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and trousers to sell

loans.name: Monjon Group

texts.es:
Juana (es la segunda de derecha a izquierda que se encuentra en la fotografía) es una señorita soltera 22 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. 
Juana es una señorita que le gusta apoyar a su familia. Ella comenta que cuando era niña su madre se encargo de enseñarle como elaborar ropa típica y ahora puede desenvolverse en esta actividad, que ha sido bastante productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias ya que lo comercializa en su comunidad.
Ahora ella cuenta con varios años de experiencia, por lo que ha decidido formar un grupo, con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus compañeras a través de sus negocios. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, para poder elaborar estas prendas típicas.
Ella comenta que uno de sus sueños es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad para exponer su producto y así incrementar sus ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is the second woman from right to left in the photograph. She is a single, 22-year-old woman and lives with her parents and siblings in the department of Suchitepequez. 

Juana is a young woman who likes to support her family. She says that when she was a child her mother was in charge of teaching her how to make traditional clothing. Now she can support herself with this work as it has been very productive in generating revenue and profits since she sells in her community. 

She now has several years of experience and has decided to form a group with the objective of improving the living conditions of her partners through their businesses. This loan will be used to buy threads in various types and colors in order to make traditional garments. 

She says that one of her dreams is to have her own store in the community market to expose her product and therefore increase her revenue and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy various types and colors of thread to be able to make these traditional garments.

loans.name: Mutegeki

texts.en:
Mutegeki is a married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 42 years old and a father of four children. His business is selling clothes and textiles. He faces the challenge of changes in tastes and preferences of his customers and weather changes, especially rain, since he operates in an open market without stalls. He hopes to buy a mobile van that can enable him to move his business to different markets.

Mutegeki is requesting a loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sangwe I Group

texts.fr:
David  fait partie du groupe  Sangwe I  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 45 ans  et est marié à Espérance, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  dont 3 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce de  manioc   depuis 5 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de manioc  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
David is part of the Sangwe I group and lives in Gitega. He is 45 years old and is married to Hope, a farmer. Together they have six children of whom three are in school. 

He has been trading cassava for the past five years.

This is his first credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he will increase his working capital and buy many kilos of cassava for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many kilos of cassava for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Kazoza Group

texts.fr:
Virginie fait partie du groupe  Kazoza  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 40 et est mariée à Ezéchiel, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants qui  étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce des tourteaux  depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à  son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de  tourteaux   à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Virginia is part of the Kazoza group and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and is married to Ezekiel, a merchant. Together they have two children, both in school. 

She has been trading cattle-cakes for the past four years. 

This is her first credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of cattle-cakes for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large amount of cattle-cakes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Nicolás Ambrosio

texts.es:
Nicolás de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado, esta casado y no tiene hijos y solo vive con su esposa quien es agricultura.


Desde la edad de los  12 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre y sus hermanos, también a la edad de 18 años trabajo como ayudante de albañilería. Ahora es un buen albañil y ayuda a su esposa en la siembra de maíz.


El crédito sera utilizado para invertir en una tienda, comprara detergentes, aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, etc con lo cual podrá tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Nicolás es tener hijos, y a la vez le gustaría estudiar en la nocturna para formarse academicamente.
texts.en:
Nicolás is 59 years old and studied through the third grade. He is married and has no children. Nicolás only lives with his wife, who is a farmer.

At the age of 12, Nicolás began farming with his father and brothers. When he turned 18, he worked as masonry assistant. He is now a skilled bricklayer and also helps his wife with planting corn.

This loan will be invested in his store. Nicolás will buy detergents, oil, rice, beans, sugar, salt and other products so that he can have income to cover his household expenses. He dreams of having children and would also like to study at night so that he can develop academically.

loans.use: to buy detergents, oil, rice, beans, sugar, salt and other products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Mère d'un enfant de 10ans scolarisé, Afiwavi pour subvenir à leurs besoins revend du maïs au marché depuis 2006. Elle s'approvisionne généralement dans les villes de l'intérieur et avec son troisième crédit de WAGES, madame Afiwavi va stocker d'énormes sacs de maïs afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. A l'avenir, elle souhaite louer une boutique pour son activité et mieux prendre soin de sa famille. Âgée de 33ans, elle a démarré l'activité en 2006.
texts.en:
The mother of a 10-year-old child attending school, Afiwavi has been selling corn at the market since 2006 to meet their needs. She usually resupplies in towns of the interior. 

With her third loan from WAGES, Ms. Afiwavi will store huge bags of corn to meet customers' needs.

In the future, she wants to rent a shop for her business and take better care of her family. She is 33 years old, and started the business in 2006.

loans.use: buy grain cereals

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 29 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando su cosecha y esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. la clienta tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
This borrower is 29 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She cultivates corn and beans and has worked in agriculture for several years. As a result, she has gained a great deal of experience which has allowed her to obtain better harvests. Whenever her crops are harvested, she stores the output in granaries (like the one shown in the photograph) so that it can be sold at a later time.

The borrower already has many customers because of the quality of her products, the good prices she offers, and most of all, the good service she provides. She needs to invest, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, and other supplies.

The borrower has good references from her acquaintances who say that she is very responsible. She is confident that she can repay this debt within the established time period and at the same time achieve financial security for her household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able buy the ingredients needed in her food stall. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her cooked food business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norma hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her cooked food business.

loans.name: Inyenyeriyomubuseruko Group

texts.fr:
Désiré fait partie du groupe  Inyenyeriyomubuseruko  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans  et est marié à Jeanine, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 8 mois  à  10 ans dont 3 étudient.  

Il  vend des limonades et des glaçons  depuis 5 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de limonade   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait travailler dans le secteur de transport des personnes et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Désiré belongs to the Inyenyeriyomubuseruko group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and is married to Jeanine, a shopkeeper. Together they have four children aged from 8 months to 10 years, of whom three attend school. 

He has been selling soft drinks and ice cubes for the past five years. 

This is his first credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he will increase his working capital and buy a lot of cases of lemonade for resale, to earn more. 

In coming years, he would like to work in the passenger transportation sector and see his children further their studies.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many cases of lemonade for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 54 and has a retail shop. She has seven children, two of whom attend school. She dreams of constructing rentals. Bad debtors and limited capital are the challenges she faces.

Josephine is acquiring credit to buy exercise books, matchboxes, soap and sugar for selling.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, matchboxes, soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Tiessiri est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Kokokoro de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que des fruits et légumes, des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures,  des habits, des produits alimentaires et des articles divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Djene  assise au milieu, est une vendeuse de fruits (mangues) et d’arachide. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en mangues  et des sacs d’arachides qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Tiessiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djene  compte réaliser  100 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Tiessiri is a group of women from the Kokokoro neighborhood of the city of Koutiala, who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 28 years old with four children.

This group of women are retail traders of various items such as fruits and vegetables, cosmetics, shoes, clothes, food and various articles. To expand their activities, members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their second group loan.

Djene, who is sitting in the middle, is a retailer of fruit (mangoes) and groundnuts. She intends to use her loan to buy cartloads of mangoes and bags of groundnuts she will retail to a diverse clientele. She resupplies at the main market.

While other members of the Tiessiri group expect to achieve an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs each over this loan cycle, Ms. Djene expects to achieve 100,000 CFA  francs.

In addition to repaying the loans, they use part of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their stock-in-trade. They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to make sure that their stocks are not depleted.

loans.use: buy mangoes and groundnuts

loans.name: Moises Armando

texts.es: Moises de 31 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Moises solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Moises, age 31, is friendly and hardworking. He lives with his wife and three children. Moises works very hard on his own land where he grows corn and beans. His products are of very good quality. When his crops are harvested, the output is stored in sacks (like those shown in the photograph) and eventually sold at different markets located near his home.

Moises is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can have the necessary funds for investing in the purchase of farming supplies such as pest controls, fertilizers, compost, seeds, and other items for his crops. He is eager to increase his sales so that he can generate more income and provide better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy pest controls, fertilizers, compost, seeds, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 27-year-old woman who is a mother with three children. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Nasreen’s husband has run a barber shop for the past three years and wants to increase his business.

She is requesting a loan to help her husband buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories. Nasreen loan will help her husband provide better services to his customers and earn the maximum profit to fulfill the needs of their business and family. Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy creams, hair brushes, and accessories for his barber shop

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is the age of 28; she is mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a  general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. Earlier he was selling bakery items in large quantity but according to the customer’s demand he wants to offer rice, sugar, flour etc. He does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy the sacks of rice, sugar and flour for general store. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her husband will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventories for General Store.

loans.name: Ann Islamia Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support Salma. She is the president of “Ann Islamia SHG" self-help group, and is pictured here as the lady seated with her hand raised. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India. 

With her portion of the loan, Salma will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. Her husband works as a florist in the village, and they both support their one child together. After this loan, Salma will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. 

Salma is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm. All the members of this group are belong to same community. The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn from expanding their businesses to buy a food processing machine, which they can all use to make spices and pickle vegetables together.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Kumushhan

texts.ru: Кумушхан 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Кумушхан - среднее образование, на протяжении 22 лет она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Кумушхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются 2 дойные коровы, также Кумушхан  с семьей занимаются пчеловодством, есть 10 улей. Кумушхан занимается реализацией меда и молочной продукцию на местном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кумушхан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Увеличение поголовья скота позволит увеличить капитал семьи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на постройку отдельного дома для сына.
texts.en:
Kumyshhan is 40 years old, married and raising three children. Kumyshhan has secondary education. She has worked with livestock breeding for a period of 22 years. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, her farm currently has two dairy cows. Kumyshhan and her family also work with beekeeping, they have 10 hives. Kumyshhan sells the honey and dairy products at the local market. The monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Kumyshhan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows. Increasing the number of livestock will allow her to increase the family's capital. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and would also like to save money for building a separate house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is a 38-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a printing shop and he wants to increase his printing shop business.
 
Humaira's husband needs to buy different types of printing materials and other accessories for his printing press, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. 

Therefore, Humaira has applied for a Kiva loan , This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her husbands business purpose, so that her husband can provide better services to his customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Humaira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband's printing business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 25 year old single lady. She stays with her mother in Mwenezi District. She volunteers as a Camfed leaner guide teaching life skills education in local schools. She have been successfully operating her poultry business for a year and half now .Her wish is to transform her project into  a big well established business. She also wants to increase her scale of production so that the monthly sales go up. 
With the loan she intends on purchasing more chicks, chick feeds and extends her fowl run. This would enable her to get funds for payment of fees for her part-time studies.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and currently lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. 

As a Camfed Learner Guide, she gives back to her community by volunteering to teach life skills to local students. To provide an income for herself and her family, Elizabeth runs a business selling poultry. For over 19 months she has managed to increase production from an initial batch of 90 to over 180 chickens. 

Elizabeth would very much like to become a poultry supplier to major supermarkets. To achieve this dream, she will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. Elizabeth hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Priviledge

texts.en:
Priviledge is a 21-year-old, single woman with one child. She resides in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. 

Priviledge is a seasoned Camfed Learner Guide, offering life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students within her community by improving the skills and widening their skills and knowledge. Priviledge is doing gardening and supplying vegetables and tomatoes at her local school. She has been running this business since last year and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Priviledge intends to purchase more seedlings for her business expansion. 

She supports orphans at her nearest school. Her dream is to grow the business and open her own shop where she sells her products at wholesale prices. This will expand her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs and upkeep. She also wants to provide a good education to her one child.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings for her business expansion.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing her money was short. Therefore, she has requested a loan for him so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings.  

Sumaira is a 27-year-old woman, living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because now he has proper source of income. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 22-year-old single woman living in Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering at schools in her community. She is actively involved in the home visits of the old aged in her community, assisting them to do chores at their houses. Over the last 11 months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity–producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2013 because she wanted to have a sustainable income generating project.  

She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Margaret would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. With the requested loan, Margret intends to increase volumes of her purchases i.e. chicks, starter mash, chicks chemicals so as to boost her sales volume and profits. She hopes to create more employment in her community and provide support for her family. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. She employs one person who assists her with daily business transactions but she aspires to grow and create sustainable employment for people in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and stock feed

loans.name: Luis Edison

texts.es: Luis es un joven trabajador, que siendo soltero tiene 4 hijos de los cuales si  hace responsable de la mantención y la educación,  tres hijos son hombres y una chica, comenta que a sus hijos les gusta jugar futbol. Luis se dedica 15 años a comprar vacas sea para venderlas en seguida o para tenerlas y vender la leche de estas vacas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vacona ya que dice que es un buen negocio, lo que Luis espera es que con sus ingresos pueda cubrir los gastos de educación y poder apoyar a sus hijos a que sigan practicando el deporte del futbol.
texts.en:
Luis is a hard-working young man. He has single and has four children, whose maintenance and education he is responsible for. They are three boys and a girl, and Luis comments that they like playing football. 

For 15 years he has earned his living by buying cows either to sell them on later or to keep them and sell their milk. He will invest the loan in buying an adult dairy cow, which he says is a profitable enterprise. Luis hopes that with the income it provides he will be able to cover the costs of his children's education and help them continue to practise their favourite sport, football.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una joven con 23 años de edad, madre de una niña de cuatro años. Hace unos meses se casó. Es una mujer trabajadora, humilde y esforzada por lograr lo que se propone. Vive en una comunidad rural. Inició su actividad hace varios años debido a que era madre soltera y tuvo la necesidad de generar ingresos para la manutención de ella y su hija. Su negocio es la pequeña industria, en donde confeccionan uniformes para diferentes bananeras que están ubicadas en la zona en donde viven. Trabaja junto con su madre en la actividad. Actualmente Ana estudia, está cursando la licenciatura en Administración de negocios en la Universidad de Costa Rica, también por éste motivo su esfuerzo en generar ingresos para ayudarse a pagar sus estudios, debido a que la Sede en la que estudia está lejos de su comunidad y ella debe de tomar dos buses para poder llegar a estudiar. Cuando sale a la Universidad cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para el cuido de su hija. Para ella lo primordial es superarse academicamente y crecer en su negocio, para el bien de ella y el de su familia, sin importar las distancias que tenga que viajar para llegar al lugar de estudio. Ella busca financiamiento para comprar una máquina industrial y materia prima.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman of 23, mother to a four-year-old girl. She got married a few months ago. She is hardworking and humble and she puts in a lot of effort to make her plans happen. She lives in a rural community. She began doing this work a few years ago since she was a single mother and she needed to make money to support herself and her daughter. Her business is a small operation, where she makes uniforms for different banana workers who are located in the area where they live. Her mother works together with her. 

Ana is currently studying, doing a degree in Business Administration at the University of Costa Rica. It is far from her community and she has to take two buses to be able to get there and study. When she goes to the University she relies on her mother to care for her daughter. For Ana, the vital thing is to get ahead academically and to grow her business, for the good of herself and her family, no matter the distances she has to travel to get to her place of study. She is requesting a loan to buy an industrial machine and raw materials.

loans.use: to buy equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs, food, concentrated feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Assiagbon

texts.fr: Meunier de profession, Assiagbon est un jeune homme de 29ans qui se bat chaque fois pour gagner son pain quotidien. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, il désire implanter un moulin électrique c’est pour cela, il sollicite un second crédit à WAGES. Comme perspectives d‘avenir, il espère multiplier d’autres points avoir des enfants puisqu’il est marié et avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
A miller by profession, Assiagbon is a young 29-year-old man who fights each day to earn a living. 

To better respond to his customers' needs, he wants to install an electric mill. It is for this reason that he is seeking a second loan with WAGES.

For the future, he hopes to expand his business. He would also like to have children, since he is married and has his own house.

loans.use: to pay the estimate for the installation of an electric mill

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou est photographe professionnel et revendeur de matériel photographique. A 29 ans, il envisage de fonder une famille mais souhaite tout d’abord accroitre ses revenus afin d’être certains de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le but d’agrandir ses points de vente, il voudrait obtenir un second crédit à WAGES qui lui permettrait d’augmenter ses stocks de matériel pour mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Kokou is a professional photographer and resells photographic materials. At 29 years old, he hopes to start a family, but first and foremost he wishes to increase his earnings so that he can support such a family.

In order to expand his points of sale, he is seeking a second loan through WAGES, which will allow him to increase his stock and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy photographic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the security of her place of business and to buy materials for the business

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 30ans, Akoko coiffeuse de profession vit avec son mari et leur enfant à Lomé. Après sa formation, elle  ouvre un atelier et emploie 02 personnes pour lui prêter main forte dans l’exécution de son activité. En plus de la coiffure, elle revend des produits de beauté à ses clients. C’est dans cette lignée qu’elle sollicite un second crédit pour renforcer son stock. Elle espère ouvrir un second salon et contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
A young woman of 30 years old, Akoko is a hairdresser by profession. She lives with her husband and their child in Lomé. 

After her training, she opened a salon and employs two people to help with the business.

In addition to hairdressing, she also sells beauty products to her customers. It is for this activity that she is seeking a second loan, so she can increase her stock.

She hopes to open a second salon and support her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Nayinere Group

texts.fr:
Mme RACHELLE représente le groupe NAYINERE. Elle se porte. Sur la photo, elle tient une assiette. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle à 06 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend de la farine maïs et divers condiments depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés environnants. 
Mme veut s’acheter 06sacs de 100kg de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  renforcer son fonds de commerce. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin afin de fidéliser sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Rachelle represents the Nayinere group. She is doing okay. In the photo, she is the one holding the tray of vegetables. Married, she is a mother of four children. The eldest child is 28 years old and her youngest is 16 years old. Four of the children go to school, and she has 6 [additional] people under her care.

Rachelle has been selling corn flour and other various condiments for five years. She procures her goods from surrounding markets. She plans to buy six 100-kilogram sacs of corn flour. 

With the earnings, she wants to increase her business funds.

One day, she would like to open a large shop in order to build customer loyalty.

loans.use: to buy six 100-kilogram sacs of corn

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 38, the mother of three daughters and a son, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. Therefore, Shabana contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request for a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more vegetables to sell. 

Shabana seems very happy after taking this loan, she thanks Kiva and hopes that the Lenders will take an active role in supporting her.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetable to resell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Naseem is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute to help her husband to manage the household.
 
She is needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil and other items for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business such as cloth, thread and needles.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 23-year-old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Sobia is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute to her husband to help manage the household.
 
She is needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, cloth, machine oil and other things for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also be helpful for her and allow her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business such as cloth, thread and needles.

loans.name: Zarqa

texts.en:
Zarqa is 24-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of a son. Her husband owns a beef and mutton shop, he is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Zarqa has been running her own beauty salon for past two years, she also contributes her income to help her husband to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business. Therefore Zarqa has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also help her to earn a maximum of income so she can fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Zarqa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy balanced food for animals and supplies to make food

loans.name: Liliana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Liliana de 44 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad a los cuales con su esfuerzo logro darles la educación básica hasta noveno grado, dos de sus hijos viven con ella pero la ayudan en su negocio, ella tiene un pequeño cafetin desde hace cinco años el cual comenzó cuando se separó de su esposo. Ella decidió salir adelante con sus hijos y comenzó con solamente unos $ 25 dólares en inventario, el cual poco a poco ha ido incrementando y ahora cuenta con un negocio más formal

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para remodelar el techo del cafetín y ampliarlo un poco más, con el dinero del crédito comprara lamina y madera para hacer más amplio el local, porque cuando llueve se moja mucho dentro del negocio, a ella le ayudara mucho el crédito ya que no tendrá que estar pensando cada vez que llueve como hara. A ella le gustaría que sus hijos se superaran y salgan adelante en el negocio ya que les a demostrado que con actitud y un poco de ayuda se puede.
texts.en:
Liliana is 44 years old, studied only as far as the third grade, and is a single mother with three children. They are all now of age, and she was able, through her efforts, to give them a basic education as far as the ninth grade. Two of her children live with her, but they help her with her business. She has had a small snack stand for the past five years, which she opened when she separated from her husband. She decided to move herself and her children forward, and began with only some 25 dollars in inventory, which she has increased bit by bit. Now she has a more formal business.

The loan she is requesting is to remodel the roof of the snack stand and to make it a little bigger. With the money from the loan, she will buy sheet metal and wood to make the stand larger, because when it rains it gets very wet inside. The loan will help her a lot, because she won't have to be wondering what she will do every time it rains. She would like her children to do well for themselves and to move forward in the business, since she has showed them that with a good attitude and a little help, you can.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to enlarge her snack stand

loans.name: Marlyn Escaira

texts.es:
Marlyn de 34 años de edad, es acompañada se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos, es una señora emprendedora que a pesar de no haber estudiado aprendió a firmar sola, por lo tanto ahora sus hijos estudian.

 Ella esta acompañada, su esposo trabaja como vigilante en una cooperativa con cultivo de marañón, ella se levanta muy temprano junto a él para ir recoger semilla y ayudar con un poco de ingresos para el hogar, prácticamente lo ha hecho toda su vida, su esposo también se dedica a la agricultura, ya que la temporada de marañón es corta, ellos viajan caminando hasta el  lugar de trabajo a unos 3 km.

 Ella necesita el dinero para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas y preparar la tierra para el cultivo de maíz;  ya que se acerca la temporada, a ella le ayudara ya que será más fácil con un pequeño financiamiento.
 sueña con que sus hijos sigan estudiando y lleguen a ser profesionales y no tenga que depender como ella de él trabajo menos pagado en el país.
texts.en:
Marlyn is 34 years old, married, and does the housework. She has two children and is an enterprising woman. Even though she hadn't studied she learned to write her signature by herself, so now her children study. 

She is married and her husband works as a guard in a cooperative with cashew apple crops. She gets up very early with him to go to collect seeds and help with a little money for the household. She has done this practically her whole life. Her husband also works in agriculture, since the cashew apple season is short. They walk some three kilometers to work.

She needs the money to buy compost, pesticides and herbicides and to prepare the land for a corn crop, since the season is coming soon, it will help her as things will be easier with a small loan.

She dreams that her children will keep studying and will become professionals, and not have to depend, as she does, on the worst-paid work in the country.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides and herbicides and prepare the land for growing corn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beauty and health products.

loans.name: Mbaapora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mbaapora está en su ciclo número 17 del programa de comité, tiene 21 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo 20 quitan el préstamo y una es ahorrista. Es un grupo que ha logrado la estabilidad gracias al trabajo que todas vienen haciendo y con lo cual ayudan a sus familias.
Leonidas es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, oficio con el cual viene ayudando a su familia. Se ha hecho muy conocida en el barrio por las prendas lindas que hace, y que siempre gusta mucho a sus clientes. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora, que trabaja por sus familias y por sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás, de manera seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mbaapora is in its 17 loan cycle through the program.  It has 21 members but on this occasion only 20 are participating in the loan and one is saving.  The group has achieved stability thanks to the work all of the members are doing to help their families.  

Leonidas is one of the members of the group and she works as a seamstress to help her family.  She has become very well known in the neighborhood because of the beautiful clothing she makes which is very popular among her clientele.  She is a hard worker and very determined to provide for her families and loved ones.  The loan she is requesting is to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, snaps and other items in order to continue her work.  She is grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, buttons, snaps and other items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
She is divorced and a mother of five children. They live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life among which are inadequate finances to start up a  business of her own and to cater for her family needs, sickness and death of love ones, and worse of all, the fire accident that burnt her house to ashes.

With this new loan request, she will expand her business by opening a medicine store, a cosmetics shop and buy more farm seedlings. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good business location, she has regular customers and her farm land is fertile. With this business activity, the community will benefit because she sells her farm products at moderate prices and the distance to buy from the market will reduce, in addition to that the community will benefit from her medicine store because she will help them maintain good health. 

As concerns the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farming business, pay her children's school fees and save some money in order to undertake bigger investment and also provide medication for her family. 

She prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also because the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy medicines, cosmetics and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Esmir Ariel

texts.es: Tiene 28 años de edad, casado, con 2 hijos, el mayor de 6 años cursa su primer grado de primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Su esposa vende ropa nueva por encargo. Desde hace 2 años habita en casa de su suegra. Con el objetivo de tener su propia vivienda y vivir de manera segura, solicita su primer crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para poder construir un anexo de tipo minifalda de concreto y de madera, para utilizarlo como cocina. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de su hijo y familia en general.
texts.en: Esmir Ariel is 28 years old, married and has two children.  He eldest is six years old and in first grade and his little girl is two.  His wife sells new clothing by catalogue.  For two years they have been living with his mother-in-law.  In order to have his own house and live safely, he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a small concrete and wood annex to be used as a kitchen.  His dream is to have a safe home with basic conditions to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Shehla's Group

texts.en:
Shehla is a 25-year-old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is a butcher by profession; he has been running his own meat shop for past ten years. He is the guardian of his family and responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family and manage the household.

Shehla's husband wants to buy meat in bulk quantity from the slaughter house for resale purposes, but due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy the meat for his business. Therefore his wife Shehla has applied for a Kiva group loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to buy meat for his business and resale purposes.

For this financial assistance, Shehla is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk for resale purposes.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 56-year-old woman, and mother of 6 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, he sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes. He is the only person responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Sajida husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for resale so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore Sajida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some fruit for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 38-year-old lady and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own Metro shoes business for past 6 years. Shazia's husband needs to purchase different types of shoes including dress shoes and sandals etc. for his business.

Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase the merchandise. To fulfill the need of her husband Shazia has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy the merchandises for his business. That will be good help for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase shoes her husband's business.

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es:
Las Leonas es un grupo nuevo que se acaba de formar, está en su primer ciclo, y todas ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través de cual ellas irán mejorando sus vidas, por medio de los comportamientos de una mujer exitosa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, quien se dedica a hacer comidas muy ricas que ella misma se encarga de preparar desde muy tempranas horas del día, y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona que lucha por mejorar, y es por eso que se unió al grupo para poder hacerlo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas como verduras, condimentos, panificados y demás, que le será de mucha ayuda a poder crecer. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Las Leonas is a new group and it is in its first loan cycle.  All of the members are also taking part in the poverty elimination program in order to improve their lives by learning the behavior of a successful woman.

One of the members is Olga who makes delicious food.  She starts out very early in the morning to prepare the food, then she goes out to sell it as a street vendor.  She is a person who struggles to get ahead; so that is why she joined the group.  The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies for her food business such as vegetables, condiments, baked goods and other items that will help her expand.  She is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, condiments, baked goods and other food.

loans.name: Rifhat's Group

texts.en:
Rifhat is a 31-year-old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Rifhat is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute to help her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine accessories and other items for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for a Kiva group loan with other three members. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also will help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rifhat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cloth, needles and accessories.

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Mme CELINE est marié et mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Elle vend du savon liquide  depuis plus 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne  en ville. 
Elle veut s’acheter 15cartons de savon et 02kg de soude caustique pour la préparation du savon liquide.
Avec ses bénéfices, Mme veut construire une maison d’habitation et épargner un peu. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Ms. CELINE is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 27 and the youngest 12 years old. Three go to school. 

She has been selling liquid soap for over 20 years, and gets her supplies in town. She wants to buy 15 cartons of soap and two kilos of caustic soda to prepare liquid soap.

With her profits she wants to build a house and and put a little into savings. Her ambition is to open a large store.

loans.use: buy 15 boxes of soap and 2 kilos of caustic soda to prepare liquid soap

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr:
Mme JULIETTE  est marié et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Elle vend des chaussures et des sacs à mains  depuis plus 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé. 
Elle veut s’acheter 100chaussures et 100sacs à mains.
Mme réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une voiture.
texts.en:
Ms. Juliet is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 25 and the youngest is 9 years old. All of them go to school, and she has five people to care for.

She has been selling shoes and handbags for over eight years, and gets her supplies in Lomé. She wants to buy 100 shoes and 100 handbags. 

She wants to reinvest her profits in her business, and aims to buy a car.

loans.use: buy 100 shoes and 100 handbags.

loans.name: Shams

texts.en:
Shams is a 34-year-old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shams is also providing sewing services and earns an income which contributes to helping her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, cloth, machine oil and other items for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shams is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business such as cloth, thread and needles.

loans.name: Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est responsable du groupe SAPONE. SOLANGE se porte bien mais ne fait plus partie du groupe. Mariée, elle mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Tous vont à l’école.
Mme vend des chaussures  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché du secteur10. 
Elle veut s’acheter 05 douzaines de chaussures.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour épargner et aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour chaussure.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haoua is the person responsible for the Sapone group; Solange is doing well but is no longer part of the group.

She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is 2 years old. All go to school.

She has been selling shoes for the past six years. She gets her supplies from the market in sector 10. She wants to buy five dozen shoes.

She would like to put her profits into savings and help with her children's education. Her ambition is to open a shoe store.

loans.use: buy five dozen shoes

loans.name: Fata's Group

texts.fr:
Igoyemé âgée de 53 ans, est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est responsable du groupe Lonlon du quartier Cassablanca à Lomé. Igoyemé a longtemps mené le commerce de céréales en s'approvisionnant dans le village de Gléi localité située à 120 kilomètres du nord de Lomé. Compte tenu du changement de quartier, Igoyemé a changé d'activité en faisant l'achat et vente des friperies.
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 50 unités de friperies de chemise et de jupe.
Les autres membres du groupe exercent aussi le petit commerce du pain, des produits de premières nécessités.
texts.en: Igoyemé is 53 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She is the leader of the Lonlon group from the Cassablanca district in Lomé. Igoyemé had been selling cereals for a long time and got her supplies in the village of Gléi, located 120 kilometers north of Lomé. Having changed district, Igoyemé has started a new business and buys and sells second-hand clothing. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy 50 lots of second-hand shirts and skirts. The other group members are also small retailers of bread and staple goods.

loans.use: to buy 50 lots of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 57 years old and married.  She is a responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a rickshaw for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to pay maintenance costs on his rickshaw, because the rickshaw's current condition is not good and requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to pay for the maintenance costs of his rickshaw. Therefore Kousar has applied for a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan.


With this loan, Kousar's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. Additionally he can provide better transport facilities and earn a profitable income.  Kousar also plans to save some of her husband's income to meet her family's future needs.  Kousar is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Zakya

texts.en:
Zakya is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 15 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. The current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance costs for his taxi. So Zakya has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Zakya's son can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Zakya  also plans to save some of her son's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Zakya is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to make repairs to her son's taxi.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and 4 children. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 3 years. He is only responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Saima is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase clothes in bulk for his business. He can also expand his business and earn a profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 13 décembre 2003 le banc villageois regroupe en son sein des femmes qui partagent l’idéal que toute personne doit être utile à la société et particulièrement à sa famille. Les sous  groupes qui le composent sont très dynamique dans le secteur du petit commerce et font preuves d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce.

Madame Amino  (debout avec une main levée à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  mariée et mère de 05 enfants (04 filles et 01 garçon). C’est une femme très engagée dans les activités du banc villageois. Elle est vendeuse d’article vestimentaire qu’elle achète dans les grands marchés de la capitale pour la revente au détail et par crédit moyennant deux échéances.

Ce nouveau prêt  lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité des tissus légers pour des lots de 06 yards destinés à la revente durant l’été.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer son épargne d’une part et d’autre part participer de manière sensible aux changements de conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" was created on the 13th of December 2003 and groups together women who share the same ideal, namely that everyone should be a productive member of society and should support their families in particular. The sub-groups which make up the "banc villageois" are very active in the retail sector, display a good solidarity and are mutually supportive. They all live in the same village and are small retailers.

Amino (standing second from the left and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of 5 children (4 girls and 1 boy). She is very active in the businesses undertaken by the "banc villageois". She sells clothing which she buys at the big markets in the capital and resells on credit (paid off on average in two installments) to retail customers. This new loan will allow her to buy a large amount of light fabrics in 6-yard lots so that she can resell it during the summer. She plans to use her profits to build her savings and to contribute substantially to making changes in her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of light fabrics in 6-yard lots to sell during the summer.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila is a 23-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop and is the guardian of the family.  He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all of his family members. Anila has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years.  shE also contributes her income, in addition to her husband's income, to manage the house hold. 


Anila needs to buy different types of cosmetics, such as creams, hairbrushes and other accessories for her beauty salon.  However, due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business. So Anila has applied for a Kiva loan in a group with two other members. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers.  It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfil the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Anila is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some more useful items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Beenish

texts.en:
Beenish is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons who are both studying. Her husband has been running his own garments shop for fifteen years and is responsible for feeding his entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Beenish is applying for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. This will help him to expand his business and earn profits.

Beenish is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy garments for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ruth del Socorro  trabaja  en uno de los centros de salud de la Ciudad de León desempeñando el cargo de despachador de insumos médicos  desde hace catorce años, la señora  sale de su casa de habitación 6:30 am, inicia sus labores 7:00 am  finalizando  a las 03:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, es  madre soltera de dos hijos de la cual desempeña la labor de padre y madre a la vez.

La señora Ruth del Socorro se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito  el cual implemento para gastos Médicos como es consulta y medicamentos, así lograr la pronta recuperación de su salud y continuar sus labores cotidianas al igual con el cuido de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth del Socorro works in one of the health centers in the city of León, dispensing medical supplies. She has had this job for 14 years. She leaves the house where she lives at 6:30AM, begins work at 7:00AM, and finishes at 3:00PM. She has this schedule from Monday to Friday. She is a single mother to two children, so she does the work of both father and mother.

Ruth del Socorro came to Ceprodel to request a loan, which she will use for medical expenses like a consultation and medicines, so she can regain her health soon and continue with her daily work, as well as with the care of her small children.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su hermano Simona se dedica a la artesanía. Necesita un credito para comprar tela, hilo y otros materiales para sus trabajos Simona es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar (el marido esta desempleado) por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Simona is married and has two children. She lives in El Alto, in a house made of brick and cement that belongs to her brother. Simona works as an artisan. She needs a loan to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for her work. Simona is the only source of income in the household (her husband is out of work) and so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for her artisan work

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es casado y tiene tres hijos, ademas vive con sus sobrinos. La familia vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento  que es de su propiedad Pedro sobrevive como chofer y necesita un credito para comprar material de construccion  para el terminado de una habitacion que quiere tener lista para ponerla en alquiler y ganar dinero extra Pedro es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Pedro is married with three children, and he lives with his sibling's children also. The family lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that they own themselves. Pedro makes his living as a driver, and needs a loan to buy construction materials to finish a room. He wants to have it ready so he can rent it out and make some extra money. Pedro is the only source of income in his household, and so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish a room in his house.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is an active borrower from BRAC Pakistan.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 40 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a catering services business for thirty years.  He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Shabnam's husband now wants to buy different kinds of crockery, tents and other relevant accessories for his business.   Due to insufficient financial means, however, he cannot afford to buy these items. Therefore Shabnam has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of his family and business.

Shabnam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crockery, tents and other relevant accessories for her husband's catering business.

loans.name: Aksar's Group

texts.en:
Aksar is 40 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and five children. Her husband is a retailer of a jewelry shop by and has been in business for nine years. He is responsible for managing the entire household.

Aksar's husband wants to buy different types of jewelry and other relevant accessories for his business and reselling purposes. But due to insufficient financial means, he is not in a suitable condition to buy all these things. Therefore his wife Aksar has applied for a Kiva Group loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With this loan, Aksar's husband will purchase jewelry and other merchandise to fulfill his business needs.

Aksar is much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of jewelry for her husband's jewelry shop.

loans.name: Naheed Jans' Group

texts.en:
Naheed is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five sons and two daughters who are all studying. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 3 years and is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell, however due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes.

Naheed and Shaziza are applying for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan.  Naheed is the leader and Shazia is a member of this group.  Naheed's portion of the loan will help her husband to purchase clothes in bulk for his business.  This will also expand his business and help him to earn maximum profits. 

Naheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for her husband's business.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 34-year-old woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and has four children. Her husband has been working as a signboard maker for many years.  He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Najma provides sewing services and earns income to contribute to manage the household. 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, material, machine oil and accessories for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these items. So she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the items she requires and also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Najma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, material, machine oil and accessories.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton  es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus padres Milton es costurero y necesita un préstamo para comprar una máquina recta pues su máquina actual esta muy vieja y no tiene arreglo. Milton desea equipar un taller de costura más completo y es la unica fuente de sustento en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda.
texts.en: Milton is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in El Alto, in a brick and cement house that belongs to his parents. Milton is a tailor and needs a loan to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine, as his current one is very old and can't be fixed. Milton wants to equip a more complete sewing workshop, and he is the only one supporting his household, so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a straight stitch sewing machine

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Es un hombre cordial, tiene 31 años de edad, soltero, no tiene hijos, cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en docencia. Desde hace 30 años habita en casa de su tío que es de tambo y de madera, en la cual habitan 10 personas. Con el objetivo de reducir el hacinamiento, de vivir de manera segura e independiente solicita su primer crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar la construcción de su vivienda de madera. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en:
He is a warm person, 31 years old, single, with no children, and he has eight years of teaching experience. For the past 30 years he has lived in his uncle's house, which is on stilts and made of wood, and in which 10 people live. With the objective of reducing this overcrowding, and to live securely and independently, he is requesting his first loan to buy construction materials to begin building his own house of wood. 

His dream is to have a safe home with basic living conditions. He also wants to install a toilet in his house and build a septic tank, since he currently has a latrine in only passable condition.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 28-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. 

Saima has been running her own beauty salon for the  past six years; she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes. 

Therefore Saima has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes, so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Saima is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items.

loans.name: M. Shamshad

texts.en:
M. Shamshad is a 43-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of six children. His whole family is fully dependent upon him, as he has only a single source of income. 

He owns a workshop in which he makes rickshaw bodies by using welding material, iron rods, and nylon sheets. He also provides the services to paint and assemble the bodies of auto rickshaws. He removes the dents in the rickshaw’s body, and paints them for renewal.

He wants to reduce the deficiency of raw materials; he wants to buy a stock of iron rods, raw material for welding, and nylon sheets. He desires to generate maximum income, but does not have any other source of income. 

He wants to invest some capital in the current enterprise so he can earn money for his family.

Therefore, M. Shamshad has requested a Kiva loan, so he can buy raw materials for making rickshaw bodies.

loans.use: To buy a stock of iron rods, raw material for welding, and nylon sheets for making rickshaw bodies.

loans.name: Rakhsana

texts.en:
Rakhsana is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family; he has been running his own cosmetics retail business. One of her son's has been providing transport services by driving goods loading vehicle. 

Rakhsana's husband wants to purchase different kinds of cosmetics items for his retail business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore, Rakhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase the relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Rakhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of cosmetics for her husband's cosmetics retail business.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Celestina es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe que cuida con su esposo. Celestina se dedica a la artesania  y necesita un credito para comprar lana para sus trabajos. Por el momento Celestina es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar y por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Celestina is married and has three children.  She lives in El Alto in an adobe house and cares for her husband.  Celestina works in handicrafts and she needs a loan in order to buy yarn for her work.  At the moment Celestina is the only source of income in her home and for this reason she needs help.

loans.use: To purchase yarn for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer De Paraiso Group

texts.es: Maritza tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos, dos están en la escuela y los otros dos están en el colegio, ella cuenta con una propiedad donde tiene dos vacas que dan leche y una que tiene un ternero con el fin de venderlo y continuar con la crianza de estos animales. Hace muchos años tuvieron la oportunidad de conocer a un veterinario que les enseño el correcto tratamiento que recibe el ganado; actualmente su hijo de 21 años es el más involucrado, con ayuda de doña Maritza aprendió a cuidar estos animales. Ella desea este crédito para comprar un novillo y las medicinas para el debido cuidado. Esta actividad le permite a ella y su familia generar ingresos adicionales para viajar a estudiar y cuando es necesario comprar ropa y zapatos para los niños. Son un ejemplo de familia, deseos de continuar apoyando a doña Maritza en sus proyectos como ganadera y crecer su actividad para logar una mejor vivienda y culminar los estudios de sus hijos. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la atención personalizada y buen trato  con las clientas.
texts.en: Maritza is 41 years old and is the mother of four children.  Two are in primary school and the others are in high school.  She has a property with two cows that give milk and one that has a calf. Her plan is to sell the calf and to continue raising these animals.
