Many years ago she had the opportunity to meet a veterinarian who taught her the correct treatments for livestock.  Currently her son who is 21 years old is the most involved in this work. With the help of Maritza he learned to care for these animals.  She needs this loan in order to buy a heifer and the medicine to care for it.  This work allows Maritza and her family to generate additional income in order to travel and study and when it is necessary to buy clothing and shoes for the kids.  They are an exemplary family, and this loan will help Maritza in her project with livestock and will help her grow her work in order to achieve a better quality of life and help her children finish school.  She chose Kiva partner Fundación Mujer because of their personalized attention and good treatment of clients.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Marlene Yanet

texts.es:
Marlene, invirtió el crédito anterior en prendas de ropa (nuevas y usadas) para surtir el negocio lo necesario para responder a la demanda de sus clientes, las ventas aumentaron y tiene nuevos ingresos con los que cumple con sus compromisos económicos. Su familia se mantiene unida y en mejores condiciones de vida.
Con el afán de continuar trabajando y teniendo los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, chores, camisetas, blusas, vestidos entre otras prendas.
texts.en:
Marlene invested her previous loan in the purchase of clothing (new and used) in order to supply her business, which was necessary to respond to her customer demand.  Her sales increased and she has new income with which she has met all of her financial obligations.  Her family continues to be very close and in the best state of health.  

With the goal of continuing to work and to have the necessary income to get ahead, she has decided to request a new loan in order to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, and dresses, amongst other clothing items.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, and dresses, amongst other clothing items.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past three years, her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Rani's husband needs to pay a fee to maintain his taxi because the current state of his taxi is so bad that it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis than it needs to. Until now, he has been unable to pay for these repairs because of insufficient financial means. Rani has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan to cover these costs. 

With the help of this loan Rani's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs for his taxi. This will allow him to increase his profits as he will be providing a better transport service. In addition, Rani plans to save a portion of her husband's profits to meet the future needs of her family.

Rani is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the costs of maintaining her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Bhagabati Shakti Shg Group

texts.en:
Nirmala is a 52-year-old lady living with her husband and two children. In picture the lady standing with her raised hand is Nirmala. She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffaloes. She sells ten litres of milk per day and earns 8,000 INR per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of four persons as her children are in university. She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it bigger.

Nirmala, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 276,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to expand her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future. All the members of this group are engaged in the dairy business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two cows and renovating the cattle shed.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 38 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children and husband.  Her husband has worked in a public sector organization for many years.  Tahira provides sewing services to earn an income.

Tahira needs needles, thread, cloth, machine oil and other items for her business.  Currently she does not have the money to buy these items.

Tahira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase sewing supplies.  She hopes to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 35 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three children.  Robina provides sewing services and earns income to support her family.

Robina's husband has worked in the public sector for many years.

Robina needs a loan to buy thing like needles, thread, cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business.  Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will enable her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy thing like needles, thread, cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 27 years old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of a daughter and son.  Her husband has run his own tailoring services business for past eight years.

Shakeela's husband wants to purchase merchandises like cloth, ribbons, needles, thread, etc. for his business, but due to financial constraints he is unable to buy them.  

Therefore, Shakeela has applied for Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandises like cloth, ribbons, needles, thread, etc. for husband's business,

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 26 years old and married. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. Recently, his rickshaw has not been working properly and he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, but due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Uzma requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw so he is able to continue his business.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Maa Hatiasuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Rekha is 37 years old and married. In picture the lady standing with her hand raised is Rekha. She lives in a village in the Jajpur district with her husband and her two children. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for ten years, she manages to earn about 5,000 INR per month. This is a group loan for Rekha's group of 13 women called Maa Hatiasuni Self Help Group. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. 

Rekha wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice yield and earn more income to better her living conditions. The members of the Maa Hatiasuni Self Help Group are very ambitious and are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, retail stores, vegetable selling, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maa Sarala Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Sanjukta is 42 years old and lives with her husband, two children and in-laws. She is engaged in selling dried and fresh fish in the market, which is two kilometers away from her village. Her husband catches fish from the lake near their village. The demand for fish in the region is very high as it is consumed by most of the people. Sanjukta makes dried fish by keeping the fish in sunlight until all the water in them evaporates and preserves them for future use (like when fish are not available in the market, in the rainy season). Dried fish is also used as a supplement to fresh fish. 

Sanjukta is requesting a loan to buy a cool storage box for keeping fish, fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery business. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the Maa Sarala Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Sanjukta as their president. The lady standing with her hand raised is Sanjukta. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase a cool storage box, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is taking loan to buy cosmetic products such as facial cream, face powder, lipstick, nail polish etc.

He is a 39 years-old married man who lives with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  He recently started this business; he hopes for the warm support of Kiva lender, because his financial progress depends upon his loan. 

Asif's shop is situated near many parlors.  This is the reason he has lot of demand for beauty products.  But due to his limited supply, he can't sell to some his worthy customers. 

Therefore, Asif has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotions etc.

This is the second loan with kiva; he showed a good repayment behavior.  Asif  feels proud when someone appreciates his efforts regarding his establishment and devotion to his business. 

He thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for reselling.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is a 27 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of one child . Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  From the past many days his rickshaw has not worked properly and now he is not able to generate enough income. 

Afshan and her husband want to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible.  However, due to the lack of money he cannot make the repairs.

Therefore, Afshan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband repair his rickshaw.

Afshan is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: M. Yousuf

texts.en:
M. Yousuf is a 50 year old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  He is the father of four daughters and three sons.  He is a cobbler by profession.

His daughters have reached the age of marriage, but he does not have savings to arrange dowries for them.  He has grown old and remains worried about the future of his daughters. His two sons have jobs and one goes to college. 

M. Yousuf has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy leather, shoe shine polish, buckles, nails, thread and other items to make shoes.  He has made shoes from many years and is one the finest professional shoe maker in the market.  He makes shoes by hand for men and women and his handmade shoes are very famous in his hometown. 

M. Yousuf wants to grow his business so he can increase his savings in order to afford for dowries to his daughters.  He will utilize the full profit from his business to remove his worries. 

M. Yousuf is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making shoes.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is 38 years old and a responsible mother of three children.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has run a shoe business for past six years.  Shumaila's husband needs to purchase different types of shoes and sandals to sell.

But due his insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase the new merchandise.  To fulfill the need of her husband, Shumaila has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. 

With this loan she will help her husband to buy the new merchandise.  That will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will fulfill his family's needs. Shumaila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her husband's shoe shop.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family; he has been running his own auto mechanic business for the past ten years. 

Alia's husband wants to purchase different types of spare parts, tools and other relevant accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Alia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase items for his business so that he can earn a higher income to manage his business and household.

Alia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tools and spare parts for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 13 décembre 2003 le banc villageois regroupe en son sein des femmes qui partagent l’idéal que toute personne doit être utile à la société et particulièrement à sa famille. Les sous  groupes qui le composent sont très dynamique dans le secteur du petit commerce et font preuves d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce.

 Madame Ramatoulaye (debout à la troisième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est mariée, mère de  04 enfants (02 garçons et 02 filles). Elle est vendeuse de légume et divers condiment et bouillons au marché communale. Elle achète sa marchandise auprès de maraichers de la commune et des environs par lot ou par bassine pour la revente au détail. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte assurer son approvisionnement hebdomadaire en légume frais par bassine ou carton selon la nature des légumes. 

Avec les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge en partie les besoins de la famille en nourriture, scolarité et santé et d’autre part à augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on 13th December 2003, and unites women who all believe that everyone should play a role in society and be useful to their family.  The sub-groups are made up of very dynamic retailers who demonstrate the benefits of mutual support and aid.  All the women live in the same neighbourhood.

Ramatoulaye (standing third from the left in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is married and has four children (two girls and two boys).  She sells vegetables, condiments and bouillons at the communal market.  Ramatoulaye buys her supplies from local farmers and then resells it.  She has a lot of experience due to her many years in the business.

Ramatoulaye will use her loan to ensure delivery of her weekly supplies of fresh vegetables.  These are delivered in various quantities depending on the nature of the vegetable.  She plans to use her profits to help provide food, schooling and health care for her family, and also to add to her savings.

loans.use: to ensure delivery of her weekly supplies of fresh vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ghulam Qadir

texts.en:
Ghulam Qadir is a 35-year old man who lives with his parents and sibling in Lahore, Pakistan.  

He makes cables.  Ghulam Qadir purchases raw material from manufacturers and then give the final shape to each cable.  He has run this business for 20 years. He is his family's sole earner and he cherishes his family.  His father has grown old.  He does not have any other source of income.

Due to rapid a increase in household expenses and with inflation, Ghulam Qadir wants to grow his income. 

He wants to provide a higher education to his sibling which seems impossible in the absence of earning more income.

Ghulam Qadir wants to grow his business so he can provide a better living and a higher level of education for his family.  However, he is unable to grow his business without new capital.

Ghulam Qadir has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy raw material to enhance his cable making business.  He hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his business and his family.
 
Ghulam Qadir thanks Kiva's honorable lenders and BRAC Pakistan for support.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making cables.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar is a 32 year old married man who lives near Lahore, Pakistan with his spouse and son. 

He has run a small printing press for many years.  Zafar prints labels to paste over cardboard boxes for various products on demand.  He uses various colors paint, rollers and chemicals.

Zafar belongs to a poor family and is responsible for his children and old parents.  His parents remain sick mostly; he has to spend most of his income to find a cure. 

He wants to grow his business so he can easily generate additional income to meed his financial demands.

Zafar has requested a Kiva loan to buy cardboard, paint and chemical to print more boxes.  In this way; he can easily generate additional income for his family. He hopes that the Kiva lenders will support him.
 
Zafar is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy printing supplies.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 41 year old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of six children and her husband are responsible to fulfill the needs of their family.

Robina has sold clothes for past five years. She needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose.  But due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy more clothes.

Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase clothes so she can earn more income to support her family and business.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Rouby Sow's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né depuis la mise en place du banc villageois. Les membres ont une bonne entente entre eux résultant de longue période de travail de groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même village et ont pour activité principale le petit commerce. Cependant elles font aussi la culture sous pluie.

Madame Rouby, (assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une dame très dynamique malgré son âge avancé. Elle fréquente le marché international de la zone où elle achète sa marchandise en gros et demi gros à savoir l’huile, le riz, le savon, la kola et autres produits pour la revente dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des sacs de riz de 50 Kg, deux à quatre bidon d’huile de 20 litre et le reste pour des condiments et divers bouillons.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille en nourriture, santé et habillement d’une part d’autre part à augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group has existed since the inauguration of the 'banc villageois'.  The members all get on very well due to their long experience of working together as a group.  They all live in the same village and work as retailers, some of them also grow rain-fed crops.

Rouby (sitting second from the left in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She remains very active despite her mature years.  She attends the local international market, where she buys oil, rice, soap, kola nuts and other products on a wholesale or semi-wholesale basis.  She then sells these products at the local weekly markets.

Rouby will use this loan to buy 50 kg sacks of rice, 2-4 20-litre barrels of oil and other food ingredients.  She plans to use her profits to help provide food, clothing and health care for her family, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg sacks of rice, 2-4 20-litre barrels of oil and other food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Zari

texts.en:
Zari is forty-nine years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and he is responsible for meeting the financial needs of family. Zari is also providing sewing services, so she can contribute some income to household.
 
She currently needs several items including needles, thread, pieces of cloth and machine oil for her business but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these products. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above items and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Zari is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cloth, threads, needles and machine oil

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 35-year-old woman and the mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a small cafe; he sells different types of edible items, e.g., samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. He is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Saira's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Saira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of food items for her husband's hotel (cafe) business.

loans.name: Carlos Omar

texts.es: Es un joven de 22 años, soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja atendiendo un cyber, actualmente vive en casa de su abuelito con otros familiares. Con el objetivo de reducir el hacinamiento, de vivir de manera segura e independiente solicita su primer crédito para comprar materiales para construir una pequeña vivienda de madera. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en:
This borrower is 22 years old and single. He has no children. He works at a cybercafe and lives in his grandfather's house with his other relatives. 

With the goal of reducing overcrowding in his home and to live safely and independently, he is applying for his first loan to buy materials to build a small wooden house. His dream is to have a safe house with basic conditions. He wants to outfit his house with a toilet and to build a septic tank, because he currently has a latrine in regular conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a small wood house.

loans.name: M. Sarwar

texts.en:
M. Sarwar is forty-seven-year-old man. He lives with his spouse and one daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a tailoring shop where he provides the services of stitching tarpaulins for covering vehicles and curtains for shops. He is an expert in his profession and people like his stitched curtains and vehicle covers a lot. 

He purchases rexine, cloth and large sheets of strong, flexible, water-resistant or waterproof materials for his shop. He has been running this business for twenty years and has a lot of experience in this business. He is the sole earner for his family. He wants to increase his current tailoring business. For this purpose he needs to purchase more cloth and flexible sheets, so he can stitch more tarpaulin vehicle covers and curtains. M. Sarwar has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so that he can enhance his tailoring business. He hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his business as well as for his family. M. Sarwar thanks Kiva, all honorable lenders and BAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sewing a tarpaulin.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is thirty years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and two sons. Her husband has been running his own business of tailoring services for past twenty years. He is solely responsible for managing the household and fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Rashida's husband wants to purchase different kinds of merchandises, including pieces of cloth, ribbons, needles and thread for his business but due to financial constraints he is unable to buy these items. Rashida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to cover these costs. With the help of this loan amount her husband can easily purchase the above items. Rashida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: To buy some accessories for her husband's tailoring Shop

loans.name: Tamba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né depuis la mise en place du banc villageois. Les membres ont une bonne entente entre eux résultant de longue période de travail de groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même village et ont pour activité principale le petit commerce. Cependant elles font aussi la culture sous pluie.

Madame Tamba, (assise à la quatrième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont 02 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce de produits alimentaires : sucre, thé vert, bouillons culinaire et divers autres produits de consommation courante plus particulièrement la cigarette. Elle s’approvisionne en gros et demi gros au marché de sa commune ou dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la revente au détail dans son village et les hameaux des environs. Elles jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter en gros au marché communal un à deux sacs de sucre à 25 000 F Cfa et cinq cartons de thé vert et le reste pour divers produits alimentaires. Qu’elle revendra au détail.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’apporter son soutien à son mari dans le cadre de la scolarité des  enfants et chercher à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
This group has existed since the inauguration of the 'banc villageois'.  The members all get on very well due to their many years working together.  They live in the same village and all work as retailers.  Some of them also grow rain-fed crops.

Tamba (sitting fourth from the left with her hand raised, in the photo) is the group representative.  She is married and has five children, two boys and three girls.  She sells food products - sugar, green tea, bouillons and cigarettes.  She buys her stock on a wholesale or semi-wholesale basis at the market in her district, or at the weekly markets.  She then sells it on a retail basis in her village and the surrounding hamlets.  She has a lot of experience because of her many years working in this business.

Tamba plans to use her loan to buy wholesale, one or two sacks of sugar for 25,000 francs CFA, five boxes of green tea and various other food products.  Her profits will enable her to help her husband pay for the schooling of their children and improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wholesale, one or two sacks of sugar, five boxes of green tea and various other food products for resale.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es: Desde hace 26 años doña María se ha dedicado a la costura y el comercio, lo que muestra su constancia y empeño en el desarrollo de su actividad. Hace un año le detectaron un problema de salud encapsulado, se detecto a tiempo y fue posible iniciar el tratamiento, conoció a unas señoras en el mismo proceso, que le comentaron sobre la técnica Quilting, empezó asistir a cursos donde aprendió correctamente como confeccionar bolsos, edredones y cosmetiqueras, que ha logrado vender en estos últimos meses a sus amigas que llevan hasta México y Francia. Es una mujer luchadora y muy ordenada, tanto en el manejo de sus cuentas como en su mercadería. Desea este crédito para encontrar la comodidad al confeccionar sus utensilios, construyendo su taller de costura en la cochera de su casa. Con su actividad de comercio inicio gracias al capital propio, con la costura avanzo gracias a los créditos que le brindo Fundación Mujer para comprar más máquinas de coser que le facilitaran el trabajo, lo que le ha permitido introducir la elaboración y venta de pijamas, sabanas, edredones, bolsos y cosmetiqueras. Doña María ha logrado superar esta etapa y se encuentra trabajando como tipo de terapia con el quilting en el cual le ha ido muy bien. Para los ingresos del hogar tiene el apoyo económico de un hijo, su esposo y la actividad productiva que ella realiza. Esto le va a permitir mejorar su condición de trabajo sin necesidad de utilizar los espacios de su casa. Eligió Fundación Mujer ya que lleva varios años solicitando los créditos en esta institución por la facilidad en los trámites y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
María has devoted herself to sewing and commerce for 26 years.  This shows her perseverance and effort in the development of her business activity.  A year ago they found a health problem that was contained.  It was found in time, and it was possible to start treatment.  She met other women undergoing the same process.  They told her about the technique of quilting .  She started to attended courses where she learned how to correctly make bags, quilts, and cosmetic bags.  In these past months she has managed to sell them to her friends who take them as far as Mexico and France.

She is a tenacious woman, and she is very methodical in managing her accounts and with her merchandise.  She wishes to have this loan in order to be comfortable when sewing her products, building her seamstress shop in the garage at her house.  

She started this commercial activity thanks to her own capital.  She advanced with her sewing thanks to the loans provided by the Fundación Mujer.  She bought more sewing machines, which facilitated the work.  This has allowed her to start making and selling pajamas, sheets, quilts, bags, and cosmetic bags.

María has managed to overcome this stage, and she is working with quilting as a type of therapy.  This has gone very well for her.

Her son, her husband, and her business activity help with the household income.  This has allowed her to improve her working conditions without having to use space in the house.  She chose the Fundación Mujer because she has been requesting loans from this institution for years.  She does so because of the easy terms and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to build her seamstress shop and to buy raw material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and livestock.

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem is a 28-year-old, married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of a son. 

He owns a small business, selling ready-made garments at a shop. He purchased ready-made garments from the market at a low price and he sells them at a high price. The women of the town like his clothing selection for dresses and they demand a greater variety to wear at wedding ceremonies. Nadeem also has a big collection of children's garments, as well. To the women, he suggests which dress suits them, which clothes suit their children, and which ones they should wear, according to the occasion. 

Nadeem speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. He does not have any other source of income except for this enterprise. 

Due to a rapid increase in household expenses and with the increase in inflation, Nadeem wants to grow his income, as well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stocks to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Nadeem  requested a loan for his garment shop, so that he can buy more stocks of ready-made garments to sell. He hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his business, as well as for his family. 

Nadeem gives thanks to Kiva, honorable lenders, and Brac Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of ready-made garments to sell.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en:
Samreen is 25 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four. Her husband is a welder by profession, and he has been running his welding shop for the past 12 years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family.

Samreen's husband needs to buy welding tools and other materials, such as iron sheets, welding rods, etc., but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford them.

Therefore, Samreen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit. Samreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some welding materials and tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is a 28-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Uzma has been running her own beauty salon for many years; she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Uzma has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers; it will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Uzma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business purpose.

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.en:
Mubarak is 59 years old and lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He has run a small general store for many years and it works very well. His shop is situated in a populated area with lots of customers interested in buying miscellaneous general store items. He does not want to refuse and disappoint his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and needed daily. In this way he will win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. He wants to offer additional items such as bread, jam,  stationery items, soft drinks and ice cream. But he does not have a refrigerator to keep the ice cream and jam.

Therefore, Mubarak has requested a Kiva loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks and ice cream. 

Mubarak is very glad to take this loan and hopes that he will be able to fulfill each request for any item and not disappoint his customers.  Mubarak is very thankful to the kiva’s field partner’s brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks and ice creams to sell.

loans.name: M. Sultan Elahi

texts.en:
M. Sultan Elahi is 26; he is young and energetic and lives in Sahiwal, Pakistan. He runs a clothing business in his hometown. In fact, his father started the clothing business; after his father. M. Sultan Elahi will be the next breadwinner for the family. His father has great expectations of him. The shop is the only source of income for his family. This is the reason he devotes his all time to it.
 
His shop is in the garment market, where there are a lot of competitors. Due to this, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition is the cause of low sales. He has to maintain the latest designs and delightful colors of clothing to maintain sales.

Now the major problem is that the summer season is about to start, and he does not have sufficient cash to buy clothing for the season, which will hurt his sales and monthly income. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

M. Sultan Elahi hopes he can purchase clothing, according to his desire, in a timely fashion, so he can cope with market competition and grow his income as well. He thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal clothes for resale.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 40-year-old active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She has one daughter. 

Raheela has been selling clothes for the past 10 years and contributes her income, along with her husband's, to the household.

Raheela needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy them. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so she can earn more income to support her family and business.

Raheela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes for resale.

loans.name: M. Mohsin

texts.en:
M. Mohsin is a 36-year old young, energetic person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

His father  started him in a new garments business to generate income for his entire family. M.Moshin and his father earn income  for the family. 

His shop is situated in the garments market and they have  a lot of competition. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a profitable price. This competition causes low sales and more effort. He has to stock the latest designs, prices, and fashionable colors to maintain the rate of sales.

The major problem is that the summers season is about to start and he does not have sufficient money to buy garments for the summer season. He does not want to reduce his sales and monthly income as well by not updating his inventory.

Therefore, M. Mohsin has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy summer jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts, and trousers.
 
M. Mohsin hopes to purchase garments in a timely manner so that he could cope with the competition and could increase his income as well. 

M. Mohsin thanks  Kiva and its field partner over this support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, pants, and belts to resell.

loans.name: Jessenia Corina

texts.es: Es madre soltera de un adolecentes de 9 años de edad que estudia su tercer grado de primaria. Tiene 28 años de edad, es maestra con 9 años de experiencia en docencia. Su papa le heredó su casita de tipo minifalda de concreto y madera, pero necesita mejorarla y para lo cual solicita su primer crédito para comprar pintura y cambiar madera del área del porche, ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Su sueño es acondicionar su casa con verjas y ventanas de vidrio.
texts.en: This borrower is a single mother with one nine-year-old son, who is studying in the third grade of primary school. She is 28 years old and is a teacher with 9 years of teaching experience. She inherited her father's concrete and wood house, but she needs to make improvements to it. Therefore, she is applying for her first loan to buy paint and change out the wood on the porch, because it is in poor condition. Her dream is to outfit her house with railings and glass windows.

loans.use: to buy paint and change out the wood on her porch.

loans.name: M. Sarwar

texts.en:
M. Sarwar is a 51-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of eight children. 

He has run a small boutique for the last ten years to sell garments at very reasonable rates. He purchases material from the market at a low price, sews it and then sells it at a profit from his shop. The ladies of town like his selections. The demand for clothing has increased day by day due to attractive designs and colors.

He wants to increase the variety of clothing in his shop; this is the reason he has requested a loan so that he can buy a variety of material  to fulfill the demand. 

M.Sarwar wishes for the bright future of his children and his dream to provide a better education for them. He is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy material to sew and sell.

loans.name: Hassan Jameel

texts.en:
Hassan Jameel is 28 and lives with his family in Sahiwal, Pakistan. He has been running a small bakery for the last 10 years. His bakery is in a populated area with lots of customers. He wants to offer products that are necessary and consumable in daily usage. He wants to offer more additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc. But the major problem is a shortage of funds.

Therefore, Hassan Jameel requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy more additional bakery items.
He is very glad about this loan and hopeful that he will fulfill each customer's request and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way, he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items. 

Hassan Jameel is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to make more sweets and buy more bakery items for resale.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is 25 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising two sons. They live in Altagram in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own house. Both are uneducated and can sign their names only. Both their sons are too young to go to school.

Mamata's husband is a daily labourer who works for daily wages under the supervision of a building contractor. He is the main earning member for the family, but his income is so nominal that Mamata was compelled to start an animal husbandry business to assist her husband to run the family. 

Mamata has leadership qualities, always solving all of the family problems by herself. She is responsible and communicates well. She started her animal husbandry business seven years back with a purchase of a goat. Now she has one dairy cow and two goats. She sells the milk to her neighbors who are her main customers. In order to create more customers and to give more financial sustainability, she wants to expand her business.

Thus Mamata requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She plans to purchase another dairy cow. One more cow means more milk; thus she will be able to supply more milk and the number of her customers will be increased and she can earn more profit.

Mamata plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing the number of her domestic livestock and giving better education to her sons.  She dreams to upgrade their house to a concrete made house.

She gives her thanks to BJS as well as to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: M. Aamir Shehzad

texts.en:
M. Aamir Shehzad is 36 and lives with his family in Sahiwal, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for one year; earlier he was selling only general store’s items, but recently he started to offer beauty products and food items as well, which has increased his net income. He wants to fully stock his general store by purchasing items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties and some beauty products, but the major problem is the lack of funds.

Therefore, M. Aamir Shehzad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and food items for his general store.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is 25 years old. She is a resident of Raypara in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is married, a housewife and a mother of one son. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her son reads in grade 1. Her husband, Bidyut, who is also uneducated, is associated with cultivation.

Her husband is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. But his agribusiness is not going well. Pratima also helps her husband in his agribusiness while managing the household.
  
Pratima is also engaged in a cosmetics business to help her husband financially. She sells different cosmetics to her neighborhood and nearby villages.

Now she wants to expand her business. She has taken a loan from BJS to purchase inexpensive items and toiletries such as cosmetics, shampoo, soap, hair oil, etc. Her neighbors are her regular customers and she will sell her products to the local community. She hopes to have a good profit from her business and wants to improve it in future for their secured life.

Her dream is to build a concrete made house and she is very much thankful to her lenders BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase varieties of cosmetics for her existing business.

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Shila is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband and one son in the small village of Raypara in the district Jalpaiguri. They live in their own house. Shilla is a housewife and is illiterate. She can sign her name only. Her husband, Dilip, age 42 years, has secondary education. Their only son is a student in grade 10.

Shila is a housewife and her husband runs a tailoring shop in their own house. He has a sewing machine. He stitches small clothing like shirts, frocks, trousers and ladies garments. He sells them to the small shop owners of the local markets.

Now Shila is interested to engage herself in the business to help her husband, because she knows if her husband works alone for the family, they will never be able to meet the growing household expenses and their son's educational expenses. At this time, she is continually working hard with her husband to provide additional income for the family.

Now Shila has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a sewing machine and reels of threads, cloth, buttons, etc. in order to expand their business. She wants to meet the increasing demand of their customers. Her neighbors are the main customers.

She hopes to grow the business and dreams of giving a good quality of education to her son through all her hard work in the business as well as starting a garment shop in the local market.

She gives her thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria Albita

texts.es:
María, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, su esposo tiene 36 años de edad y tienen una hija de 22 años de edad, cuenta con una tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad a los habitantes de la zona en la que vive, el negocio cuenta con 9 años de estar funcionando y nace a raíz de la necesidad de tener recursos económicos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, no tiene un horario establecido, le colaboran su esposo y su hija.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de aceite, huevos, bebidas, azúcar, sal, boquitas, pan, dulces, papel higiénico, frijol,  entre otros insumos con los que sus clientes puedan estar satisfechos, espera mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su hija para que pueda iniciar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and married. Her husband is 36 years old and they have a daughter who is 22. She has a store where she sells essential goods to those who live in the area. The business was started due to the need for financial resources to improve her family's quality of life and has been running for 9 years. It does not have set hours. Her husband and her daughter help her.

She will invest the capital in the purchase of oil, eggs, beverages, sugar, salt, snacks, bread, sweets, toilet paper, beans and other supplies that will satisfy her customers. She hopes to improve her sales and her income. Her dream is to improve her home and support her daughter so that she can start her own business.

loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, beverages, sugar, salt, snacks, bread, sweets, toilet paper, beans and other supplies.

loans.name: Salah Ud Din

texts.en:
Salah Ud Din is the age of 38 and the father of four children, and they live in Lahore, Pakistan. 

He owns a medical store in which he sells different types of medicines. His medical store is near a medical clinic, so most of the customers are referred to him by the doctor of that clinic. In his medical store he offers almost all types of medicines and medical equipment, but some of the medicines are unavailable in his store due to their high cost. Salah Ud Din knows that he could earn maximum profit if he offered these missing medicines, and therefore he has requested a loan to buy more medicines for his medical store.
 
Salah Ud Din is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his medical store and his family's future life. He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that in the future he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.
 
Salah Ud Din is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, and he assures everyone that he will pay all installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy medicines and medical equipment for resale.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 40 years old and has three children. She owns an embroidery business, which is the only source of income for the family. She needs to purchase new variety of embroidery material to sell. However, due to lack of money she finds it difficult. 

Nasseem requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase different kinds of embroidery materials. This will help her to offer more variety to her customers and to continue her work efficiently and professionally.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of embroidery materials

loans.name: Akbar Ali

texts.en:
Akbar Ali is a 47-year-old man. He is a milkman by profession, and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk for 20 years, and now he is an expert and experienced in his profession. He is very expert in getting milk from a buffalo; he gets milk from all his buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them.

He is taking a second loan, and he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. With the help of the last loan, he purchased a buffalo and has been getting benefits from that buffalo. He still wants to establish his business and wants to buy another buffalo so that he could increase his monthly income and savings as well. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone that is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income.     

Therefore, Akbar Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that he will be able to buy a buffalo, and he will be succeeding to increase his monthly income and his herd as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Safder Hussain

texts.en:
Safder Hussain is the age of 29; he is a young and energetic person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is married and the father of a son. He recently started a new business of clothes selling. In fact, his father helped start him the new business of clothes selling, and he is earning sufficient income for his family. Now this clothing shop is the only single source of income for his family; this is the reason he devotes all his concentration and time to the clothing shop. 

His shop is situated under the garments market, and there are lots of competitors available in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers over a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delighting colors of clothes over other shops so that he could maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the summer season is about to start and he does not have a sufficient amount to buy clothing for the summer season. If he fails to replace the winter season clothing, then it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and monthly income as well.

Therefore, Safder Hussain has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be empowered to buy the clothing of the summer season. 

Safder Hussain hopes that he will purchase clothing according to his desire at the right time so that he can cope with the market competition and could grow his income as well. 

Safder Hussain thanks Kiva and its field partner over this support.

loans.use: To buy summer season clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra lives with her husband and three daughters in their own house in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is 22 years old and attended school up to grade 7. One of their daughters is in school and reads in grade 1; the others are still too young. Her husband, Arun, age 28 years, who studied up to grade 7, is engaged in a firewood business.

Sumitra's husband runs his business of selling firewood. He purchases firewood and sells to the villagers, as it is used as fuel in rural areas. Now she and her husband want to expand their business. Sumitra has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase more firewood for her husband's business. She is a very optimistic woman and hopes to get an additional profit from this to maintain her family well.

Her dreams are to provide a better education to her daughters so that they can be established in life. She also wants to move ahead with her business for their secured future.

She gives her hearty thanks to both the lenders ( BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase firewood for business.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Bimala is 30 years old and raising three daughters with her husband. She is married to Narayan, who is 32 years old and is a farmer by profession. Bimala and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only. Their daughters are too young to go to school. They live in their own house in Altagram in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

Bimala's husband grows seasonal vegetables on their own ancestral land and he sells them in the local market to meet the household expenses. But his income is so scanty that he is unable to run his family in a decent manner. To provide an additional source of income, Bimala has been involved in an animal husbandry business for the last five years. Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow and three goats.

In order to increase her income, she needs to develop her business and she needs financial support. Bimala heard that Kiva’s partner BJS gives loans to the rural women to start new businesses. So she has taken a loan to purchase one cow. Then she will be able to sell more milk, which she sells to her neighbours who are her main customers. She wants to invest the earnings from the loan into continued business development and to give proper education to her daughters. Last but not least, she hopes to upgrade their kachha house to a concrete made house.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for selling milk.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Es una mujer luchadora y amable, tiene 25 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos, en edad escolar.  Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, se dedica aserrar madera. Habita en una comunidad llamada Españolina, que se ubica a 25 kilómetros del área urbana de Rosita, cuyo viaje dura aproximadamente una hora. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace un año estableció su pequeña pulpería. Ofreciendo sus productos de lunes a domingo de 6:00am-8:00pm. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Rosita y venderla a precios accesibles en su comunidad: prensapelos, trabas para el cabello, verduras y bastimentos (tomate, cebolla, ajo), especies (achote, salsa inglesa, mostaza), jabón de baño, de lavar ropa, de lavar trastes, cloro, granos básicos y sopas instantáneas. Gracias a las ganancias percibidas le han permitido comprar una refrigeradora, ofertando mortadela, carne molida, pollo, refrescos naturales (vende 200 unidades al día). Su sueño es dedicarse también al engorde de cerdo, para ofrecer en su pequeño negocio chicharrón y carne de cerdo. También anhela con construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Nora is a kind and hardworking 25 year-old woman. She is married with two school-aged children. Her husband is informally involved with wood-sawing work. They live in a community called Españolina, which is located 25 kilometers from the urban area, Rosita, and it takes about an hour to travel there. In order to have her own source of income, she opened her own grocery store one year ago. She offers her products on Monday through Sunday from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. She is asking for her first loan to purchase goods in Rosita and sell them for accessible prices in her community: barrettes, hair clips, vegetables and basic provisions (tomatoes, onions, garlic), spices (annatto, Worcestershire sauce, mustard), bath soap, laundry detergent, dish soap, bleach, grains, and instant soups. Thanks to to her earnings, she has been able to buy a refrigerator, offering mortadella, ground beef, chicken, natural beverages (she sells 200 units per day). Her dream is to also raise pigs to offer pork rinds and meat in her store. She also wishes to build a sturdy home from concrete.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Veronica Carmina

texts.es:
No hay día en que no se escuche el rítmico pedaleo de la máquina de coser de Verónica, que siempre está confeccionando  ropa tanto para mujeres, como para hombres. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Gracias a su madre, a los 11 años de edad aprendió el arte de la costura, el cual ha sido su única fuente de trabajo. Trabaja con disciplina, ánimo y amabilidad. Sus hijos son su fuente de motivación.
Ella solicita el crédito para mejorar el sistema de alcantarillado de aguas negras en su hogar, lo que brindará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Asegura que la salud es un factor importante para el buen desarrollo de sus hijos, por lo tanto deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que ofrece Kiva y MiCrédito. Su meta es seguir trabajando y mejorando en lo que mejor hace, la costura. Al mismo tiempo quiere aumentar su clientela, de manera que logre estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Not a day goes by when one can’t hear the rhythm of the pedal on Verónica’s sewing machine. She is always producing clothes for women and men. Verónica is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Thanks to her mother, she learned the art of sewing at the age of 11. This skill is now her only source of income. Verónica works with discipline, enthusiasm, and cheerfulness. Her children are her source of motivation.

The loan she is requesting will be used to improve the septic system in her house so that her family can have better living conditions. Verónica wants to ensure the health of her children since it is an important factor in their development. She has placed her trust in the loan being offered by Kiva and MiCrédito. Her goal is to continue working and improving at what she does best, which is sewing. At the same time, she wants to increase her clientele so that she can achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to the septic system in her house.

loans.name: Fátima Esmeralda

texts.es:
Fátima de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta 8º grado, esta casada su esposo es albañil y tienen 6 hijos.

Fátima se dedica a la agricultura, siembran 7,000 mts de maíz, dicho terreno esta a 1 km de su casa y viaja a pie, recibe ayuda de su esposo para realizar la siembra.
	            
El crédito sera invertido en la compra de abono, semilla de maíz, pesticidas y herbicidas para cultivar los 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Lo que mas desea Fátima es ayudar a su familia a mejorar las condiciones económicas, que sus hijos estudien y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Fátima is 40 years old and studied through the eighth grade. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. They have six children.

Fátima is a farmer and is planting 7,000 square meters of corn. Her plot of land is located one kilometer from her house, so she must travel by foot. Her husband helps her with the planting.

Fátima’s loan will be invested in the purchase of compost, corn seeds, pesticides, and herbicides so that she can cultivate 7,000 square meters for producing corn. What she wants most is to help her family improve their financial condition. She also wants to see her children study and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy compost, corn seeds, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija mayor de edad, independiente. Su esposo es vigilante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y frijoles. Con el propósito de construir su propia vivienda, solicita su primer crédito para comprar materiales para construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera. Desde hace 15 años habita en una casita de madera y tambo. Su sueño es tener una pulpería. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en: Martina is 41 years old, is married, and has one older child who lives independently. Her husband is a watchman, and she sells used clothes and beans. With the purpose of building her own home, she is asking for her first loan to buy materials to construct a home with a strong foundation using concrete and wood. For 15 years she has lived in a small house made of wood and barrels. Her dream is to have a grocery store of her own. She also would like to set up a toilet and septic tank in her home, which currently has a latrine in fair condition.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a home with a strong foundation using concrete and wood.

loans.name: Iftikhar

texts.en:
Iftikhar is 25 years old and lives in Karachi, Pakistan. By profession he is a scrap dealer in the local market, which he has been doing for many years. Iftikhar needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to so so.

Iftikhar requested a loan loan from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase scrap material for recycling

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem is a 47-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He resides in Karachi, Pakistan and is a father of seven children. By profession, he is a scrap dealer. He has been doing plastic scrap recycling for the past 30 years. He is the only responsible person to manage his entire household.

Nadeem has to purchase waste materials and plastic scrap in bulk. Due to insufficient financial means, he is not in a suitable position to do that. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan he will purchase scrap in bulk to meet his business needs and to continue the recycling procedure. This will help him to earn more profitable income from his business. Nadeem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: To buy scrap and plastic material for recycling

loans.name: Jose  Adan

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad vive junto a su esposa; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. jose tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old and resides with his wife. He is dedicated to agriculture, specifically cultivating corn and beans. He has worked at this for many years and has accumulated very valuable experience that enables him to obtain the best harvests.

Jose's farm land is located in an agricultural zone. Trade is present in all the surrounding zones and he already has a fixed clientèle. These individuals always prefer his produce since it is of good quality, offered at really accessible prices, and with unequaled service.

Jose wishes to invest in agricultural inputs but he needs capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase seeds, manure, insecticides, fertilizers, plaguicides, farm tools, etc.

Jose has good payment references and is certain that he will be able to pay off the debt on time. He is also confident that he will be able to offer his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizers, plaguicides, and other inputs, for his crop.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: Yony vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa, ella se dedica a brindar servicio de tomar fotografías y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar papel fotográfico. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Yony lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in Southern Peru and belongs to the communal bank "Qory Chaska" which is associated with Kiva partner Arariwa.  She works offering photographic services and has been in the field for several years.  Things are going well.  Currently she needs a loan in order to buy photographic paper.  She is thankful for the opportunity and promises to meet her repayment obligations.

loans.use: To purchase photographic paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer and improve his land.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Tiene 31 años de edad, casado, con 2 hijos, el mayor de 6 años cursa su primer grado de primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa. Desde hace 27 años habita en casa de su mamá. Con el objetivo de tener su propia vivienda y vivir de manera segura, solicita su primer crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para poder construir su vivienda de tambo de madera: 350 pies tablar de madera cepillada, clavos, 18 laminas zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de su hijo y familia en general. Quiere establecerle un negocio de venta de ropa a su esposa.
texts.en: Edgardo is 31 years old and is married with 2 children. The oldest is 6 years old and is entering his first year of primary school, and the youngest is 2 years old. His wife takes care of the house and children. For 27 years he has lived in his mother's house. With the goal of having his own home and living securely, he is asking for his first loan to buy construction materials to build his own home from wood and barrels: 350 feet of wood planks, nails, 18 zinc sheets, and labor costs. His dream is to have a safe home with basic conditions for the comfort of his children and family. He also wants to establish a clothing store for his wife.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build his home with wood and barrels.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es: Es una mujer luchadora y cordial, desde hace 8 años trabaja como conserje n una empresa del municipio de Rosita, madre soltera de 3 hijas, 2 estudian su secundaria y la mayor de 20 años estudia su carrera universitaria. Con el objetivo de apoyar en los estudios de su hija mayor, solicita su primer financiamiento para cubrir costos arancelarios, hospedajes de su hija que cursa su primer año de laboratorio clínico en una universidad de Masaya. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente habita en casa de familiares. Quiere comprar una máquina de coser, con el propósito de confeccionar uniformes, togas y tener una fuente de ingresos adicional.
texts.en: Jacoba is a determined and friendly woman who has been working as a janitor in the town of Rosita for 8 years. She is a single mother of 3 girls: 2 are in secondary school, and the oldest is 20 and studies in university. In order to support the her eldest daughter’s education, who is in her first year of clinical laboratory at a university in Masaya, she is requesting her first loan to cover her tuition and housing. Her dream is to build her own home, as she currently lives in her relatives’ home. She wants to buy a sewing machine to make uniforms and gowns to have an additional source of revenue.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's tuition and housing costs.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David de 65 años de edad, es un agricultor que no logro estudiar debido a que sus padres no lo pudieron enviar a estudiar; sino que lo mandaron desde muy pequeño a trabajar. Actualmente, está acompañado y tiene un hijo el cual ya no vive con él, desde hace muchos años su hijo se casó y se fue a vivir muy lejos y con ellos solo vive un nieto el cual, por la distancia a su lugar educativo ya que está estudiado el bachillerato.
David aprendio la agricultura desde muy pequeño cuando sus padres se lo inculcaron, la siembra de maíz esa es su actividad a la cual se dedica desde que tenía 19 años de edad, esto lo logro aprender gracias a sus padres ahora el  cultiva dos hectáreas de tierra la cual alquila cada año en los meses de Abril o Mayo para ir preparando la Tierra, él se levanta muy temprano para ir a ver a la cosecha cuando esta ya está sembrada.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cultivar una hectárea de tierra  más que un amigo de él le prestara para este año y los fondos que él posee no le alcanzan para cultivar esa otra hectárea mas y él sabe perfectamente que solo lo lograra con la ayuda del crédito y con la ganancia de la otra hectárea de tierra que cultivara podrá pagar los estudios de su nieto.
El sueño de David, es que  su nieto logre graduarse del bachillerato sin ningún problema, ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad cuando era joven ahora él se la está dando a su nieto y sabe que lo podrá lograr con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
David, 65 years old, is a farmer that was not able to study due to that his parents were not able to send him to study but instead sent him to work at a very young age. Currently, he is in a relationship and has a child that does not live with him anymore. Many years ago, his son got married and went to live very far away. Only their grandson lives with them because of the distance to his educational place since he is in high school.

David learned farming at a very young age when his parents taught him. The sowing of corn is the activity from which he has made a living from age 19. He was able to learn farming thanks to his parents. Now, he cultivates two hectares of land which he rents each year during the months of April or May to prepare the land. He gets up very early to go to see the crop when it is sown.

The loan that he is requesting is to cultivate one more hectare of land that a friend of his will lend him for the year, and the funds that he possesses are not enough to cultivate this other hectare. He knows perfectly well that he will only be able to do so with the help of the loan. With the profits from the other hectare of land that he will cultivate, he will be able to pay for his grandson’s studies.

David’s dream is that his grandson be able to graduate from high school without any problems since he did not have this opportunity when he was young. Now, he is giving it to his grandson and he knows that he will be able to with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to cultivate a hectare more of land that a friend of his will lend him for the year.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa, ella se dedica a la venta de comida pues tiene una pequeño restaurante y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras, carne y papas. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Antonieta lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in the south of Peru and belongs to the communal bank "Qory Chaska" of the UMF Arariwa. She makes a living selling food. She has a small restaurant and has been working on her business for several years, and it has been going very well. At this moment she requires a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat and potatoes. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to complying with the established quotas.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is 31 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Karachi, Pakistan. He is the father of two children. 

Amir is a general retail shopkeeper by profession. He has been running his own business of retailing for the past 14 years. He is solely responsible for managing the entire household.

Amir wants to purchase a distributorship from Coca Cola company to get a new deep freezer, so that he can provide a variety of cold drinks to the walk-in customers. 

To fulfill this business requirement, he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he will purchase a distributorship from Coca Cola company to fulfill his business requirements, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial support, Amir is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer for his shop.

loans.name: Campesinos De Tzununá 2 Group

texts.es:
Juan (es el tercero de izquierda a derecha que se encuentra en la fotografía) el es un hombre casado de 32 años de edad, quien vive con sus tres hijos de los cuales son; un hombre y dos mujeres, ambos viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Juan comenta que le gusta el trabajo que desempeña en el área de la agricultura ya que lleva varios años de cultivar café cerca de donde vive. Esta actividad es bastante productiva, porque lo puede comercializar en otros lugares y además de ello obtiene ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia.
El ha tomado la decisión de formar un grupo para contribuir al desarrollo de nuevos negocios y así mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de abono orgánico y químico, que servirá para cultivo de café.
El sueño de don Juan es incrementar sus ganancias para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Juan (he is third from the left in the photograph) is a 32-year-old married man who lives in Sololá department with his three children–a boy and two girls.

Juan says he likes the work he does in agriculture, and has been growing coffee near where he lives for several years. This activity is quite productive because he can sell it in other places: and besides, he obtains profits and income from it that help him to contribute to his family's finances. 

He has made the decision to join a group for contributing to the development of new businesses, and this way improve the family finances of the group members. 

He will use the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizer, which he will use on his coffee plantation. Juan's dream is to increase his earnings so that his family has better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizer to use on his coffee plantation.

loans.name: M. Shahbaz

texts.en:
M. Shahbaz is 27 years old and the responsible father of two sons and a daughter. He owns a small tailor shop and has been running this business for many years. He takes orders from boutique keepers and sews ladies clothes to order.
 
His shop is situated near his house in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. One of his brothers and a few appointed tailors help him to sew the clothes. In this way he not only generates a little income for his family but also creates employment. He belongs to the middle standard class, due to his low earnings. He is unable to provide a better standard of living for his siblings, parents and his own family because the major portion of his income is divided among the tailors. He has been facing a tough time due to the low income generated by his business, but he can not do any other business because he is not skilled in any other profession. Therefore he has decided to expand his current enterprise.
 
He does not want to sew the garments to order because the contractors criticize and find faults in his completed shipments. He wants to buy fine clothing, professional sewing machines and an overlock machine to sew garments for selling directly to the retailers.
   
Therefore M. Shahbaz has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy additional professional sewing machines, an overlock machine and clothing.

He is happy to receive the loan and thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing, and sewing & overlock machines for sewing garments.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto es casado tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Roberto sigue trabajando como chofer y necesita credito para pagar un mantenimiento de vehiculo, además de comprar llantas, cambiar el aceite, cambiar los amortiguadores y comprar una bateria
texts.en: Roberto is married and has two children. He lives in La Paz in a brick and cement home that belongs to his family. He continues to work as a driver and needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. He will buy tires, change the oil and the shock absorbers and buy a battery.
