loans.use: to buy tires, an oil change, shock absorbers and a battery to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Alma Marina

texts.es: Alma de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hija, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Alma solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su hija.
texts.en:
Alma is 38 years old and is a single mother who lives with her daughter. She has had a beauty salon business in her residence for several years. She works from 9 am until 7 pm and has a lot of clients as she does very good work. With the income from her work she manages to pay the household expenses.

Alma is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy products for her beauty salon like creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors and other things she needs. She will be able to make more profit which will help her economic stability for her and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Atiq

texts.en: Atiq is a 41-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Karachi, Pakistan. He is living with his spouse and four children. By profession he is sticker-maker of motorbike tanks and side covers. This is the only source of income to manage his complete household. Atiq wants to purchase different types of powder colors for sticker-making purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy this merchandise to fulfill his business needs. Therefore, he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will be helpful for him to buy powder colors to fulfill the needs of his business, so that he can sell quality stickers to motorbike retailers and earn maximum profitable income.  For this financial support, Atiq is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy differents types of powder colors for his business purposes.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de  65 años de edad, esta casado con una mujer que se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 2 hijos varones los cuales ya no viven con él. 


José es una persona que casi la mayor parte de su vida la a dedicado al cultivo del maíz, dado que sus padres también se dedicaban a dicha actividad y fue heredada también tiene otro negocio junto con su esposa. Ahora quiere dedicarse a instalar un pequeño restaurante de venta de pupusas junto a su esposa, ya que la agricultura no le estaba generando ganancias; su esposa tiene una venta de pupusas en la casa y ya tienen 4 años de estar vendiendo pupusas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para ampliar la pupuseria y ponerla en el centro del pueblo ya que un hermano le prestara un local sin cobrarle nada de dinero, además casi no hay muchas ventas de pupusas y comprara otra plancha para hacer mas pupusas y comprar bebidas como sodas, jugos, refrescos entre otras cosas mas que necesita.

El sueño de José es poder ampliar el negocio junto a su esposa, ya que su  nivel de vida económico mejorara, porque tendrá mayores ingresos ya que la agricultura tubo muchas pérdidas, ahora tendrá más ingresos para pagar su crédito y que su vida mejore económicamente.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old, and he is married to a woman who performs the domestic tasks in the home. They have two sons who no longer live with them. José has made a living almost all of his life by cultivating corn. His parents also made a living with this activity, and passed it along to him.

He also has another business with his wife. Now, he wants to work on installing a small restaurant to sell pupusas [thick, stuffed corn tortillas] with his wife, because agriculture is no longer generating income for them. His wife sells pupusas from their house, and she has been selling them for 4 years. 

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to expand their "pupusería" (the shop to make and sell pupusas) and to put it in the center of the town. A brother will loan them the location without charging them any money, and there aren't many pupusas for sale. He will buy another griddle to make more pupusas, and he will buy drinks such as sodas, juices, and soft drinks, among other things that he needs.

José's dream is to be able to expand his business with his wife because their economic standard of living would improve because he would have more income. Since agriculture has had many losses, now he will have more income to pay his loan, and for his life to improve economically.

loans.use: to expand his "pupusería" (shop to make and sell pupusas- thick, stuffed corn tortillas) and to put it in the center of town, to buy another griddle to make more pupusas, and to buy drinks such as sodas, juices, and soft drinks among other things that he needs.

loans.name: Abdul Hameed

texts.en:
Abdul Hameed owns an auto electrical goods shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, and he lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the vehicle spare parts market and it is challenging for him to sell his products among his competitors. This competition strongly affects his daily sales.
 
To grow his business and income, and differentiate himself from his competitors, he has thought of a plan to offer auto rickshaw spare parts because most of the auto rickshaw drivers are doing this professionally. Abdul Hameed hopes that this strategy will work positively and his sales will increase.
 
However he cannot act upon his strategy without some capital. He tried to take out a loan from banks and other organizations but they refused. Therefore he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they provide a facility to empower the poor.
 
Abdul Hameed is 46 and married. He has to look after his young children but he hardly spends any time with them due to his business.
 
He is tension free after receiving this loan because BRAC has shown him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for vehicles for resale.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Es un señor emprendedor y cordial, tiene 42 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, dos mayores de edad y un adolescente de 13 años que estudia su tercer año de secundaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace 2 años estableció su negocio familiar de comideria y refresquería, en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal de Rosita, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 3000 (Tres Mil Córdobas). Su jornada laboral es de Lunes a Domingo de 6:00am-8:00pm. Solicita su primer financiamiento para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, ya que es de madera y se encuentra un poco deteriorada. Su sueño es tener su propio álbum.
texts.en:
The borrower is a friendly and entrepreneurial man. He is 42 years old and married with three children - two that are older and a 13-year-old in third year of secondary school. 

With the intent of having his own source of income, two years ago he started a family eatery, selling food and beverages in a rental space at the municipal market in Rosita for a monthly payment of C$ 3,000 (three thousand Córdobas). His work day is from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm, Monday through Sunday. He is requesting his first financing to improve the infrastructure of his establishment because it is made of wood and damaged a bit.

His dream is to have his own album.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of his business.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 49 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is living with his spouse and five children. 

By profession, Adil is a cloth seller and he has been running his business for many years. He is the only person responsible for managing the household.

Adil needs to buy different kinds of cloth, in bulk, for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial resources, he is unable to buy these things. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Adil will buy the cloth for reselling purposes, so that he can earn more profitable income.

Adil is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cloth, in bulk, for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is a 48 year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is living with his spouse and six children. By profession he is a retailer with a general store.  He has been doing this business for many years. He is the only one responsible to manage the entire household.
Tariq wants to purchase different types of commodities and other consumer items for reselling purposes, but, due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 
For this financial support, Tariq is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of commodities for his general store.

loans.name: David Ernesto

texts.es: David de 30 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con sus padres y sus hermanos, David esta solicitando un credito para poder comparar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer sus siembras que es el que muestra en la fotografia y asi seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
David is 30 years old and earns his living in agriculture. For several years, his main crop has been corn and beans. 

He sells his crops in staple goods agencies near his home. With the income he earns from his sales, he helps with the expenses his family has. 

He lives in his own house with his parents and his siblings. 

David is asking for a loan to be able to buy agricultural inputs which will help him with the planting of his crop, such as compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc, and to improve the land where he wants to plant his seeds, which are shown in the photo.

In this way, he will continue helping with his household’s expenses without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos de 39 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, carlos se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras. Carlos tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Carlos is 39 years old and lives with his family in their own home. He makes a living by growing corn and beans. He has been working in agriculture for many years so he has a lot of experience in the area. He is well-known in the zone and has many customers because his harvests are the best. He sells high quality products at very affordable prices. His service is unequaled; Carlos is very friendly and entrepreneurial with a great desire to move forward.

He has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., and improve his land, which is shown in the photo, so he can continue farming.

Carlos' references say that he has faultless morals, is responsible, and always makes payments. He promises that he will be able to respond to the debt while, at the same time, providing a full life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., and improve his land.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovana pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa ny vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas, chullos, ceramicas, polos y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar chullos y mantas. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Giovana belongs to the "Qory Chaska" communal bank from the Arariwa UMF. She lives in the enchanting city of Cusco and makes a living by selling artisan goods like jackets, hats, ceramics, and polo shirts. She has been working in this business for many years and it is going very well.

This time, she is requesting a loan to purchase hats and blankets. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase hats and blankets.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 43-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Haleema’s husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities like rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But, due to financial constraints, he is not in suitable position to buy all of the above products to resell. Therefore, Haleema has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities, and also help him to earn a maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Haleema is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of consumer products and commodities for her husband's business.

loans.name: Forget

texts.en:
Forget is 20 years old and. She lives in Mudzi district of Zimbabwe. Forget is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. She is involved in the mobilization of communities to study and improve their academic levels.  In addition, Forget rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts, which she has been doing for one year. The income has enabled her to support her family.  

Forget requested a loan, which she will use to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her desire is to improve the standard of living in her family since she is the bread winner. In the long run, she intends to expand the business and build her own shop, which will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 35-year-old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Fozia is also providing sewing services, and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 


She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business.  But, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories, and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services. Fozia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy products for her business like cloth, threads, needles, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Jimena

texts.es:
Sandra es un mujer que ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades que la vida le presenta, pues desde hace un tiempo decidió iniciar con un taller dedicado a la venta de repuestos y lubricantes para motocicletas al ver que en el sector donde vive no existían negocios de este mismo tipo y así fue como un deseo de ser independiente dio frutos.
Ella trabaja incansablemente de domingo a domingo para cubrir la demanda de repuestos que actualmente se presenta.
Sandra siente la necesidad de tecnificar su actividad y por esta razón solicita un préstamo para adquirir un computador en el que pueda llevar su contabilidad mas organizada y dejar de hacerla a mano ya que resulta muy dispendioso.
Su mayor interés es poder hacer que su negocio sea prospero y auto sostenible y porque no, abrir un nuevo taller en otros barrios de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman who has been able to take advantage of the opportunities life has presented her. Since not too long ago, after seeing that the sector she lives in does not have any businesses of this type, she decided to open a workshop that sells spare parts and lubricants for motorcycles. Her desire to be independent has paid off. 

She works tirelessly from Sunday to Sunday to cover the demand for parts that her store currently experiences. 

Sandra feels the need to introduce more technology into her work, and for this reason she is asking for a loan to acquire a computer to help her organize the store's bookkeeping. She would like to stop doing this activity by hand, because it ends up being very wasteful of time. 

Her main interest is to make sure her store is prosperous and self-sustaining, and perhaps open a new workshop in other neighborhoods in the city.

loans.use: to buy a computer for bookkeeping.

loans.name: Juan Maria

texts.es: Es casado, tiene 2 hijos, adolescentes que cursan su secundaria. Trabaja como vigilante y su esposa trabaja como ayudanta en una comideria.  Con el objetivo de tener su propia vivienda, solicita su primer crédito para comprar terreno y materiales de construcción para su vivienda de mini falda de concreto y madera: 70 piedras canteras, cementos, hierro, zinc, clavos, arena fina y gruesa y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en: Juan is married with two teenage children in secondary school. He works as a watchman and his wife works as a waitress in an eatery. With the goal of having his own home, he is asking for his first loan to buy land and construction materials for a home with a strong foundation made from concrete and wood: 70 stones from the quarry, cement, iron, zinc, nails, fine and coarse sand, and to cover the costs of labor. His dream is to have a safe home with the basic conditions. He wants to outfit his house with a toilet and construct a septic tank, as his current house has a latrine in fair condition.

loans.use: to buy land and construction materials for a home with a strong foundation made from concrete and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks and primary materials to prepare food for her store.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es casado tiene 4 hijos vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad. Abel sigue dedicandose al comercio y necesita dinero para comprar enlatados, dulces y refrescos para su tienda de barrio. Abel es ayudado por sus hijos pero ellos tambien tienen gastos por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Abel is married with 4 children and lives in La Paz in his own house made of brick and cement. Abel works in sales and needs money to buy canned goods, candy and sodas for his neighborhood store. Abel is helped by his children, but they also have expenses and need support.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candy and sodas for his neighborhood store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather, stencils, lining, and other materials.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesús

texts.es:
Pedro de 44 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta noveno grado en la escuela  ya que en esos tiempos la situación era muy difícil sus padres no lo pudieron seguir mandando a la escuela. Ahora esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos los cuales están estudiado en  la escuela su pareja  se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Su principal fuente de ingresos es la albañilería dado que tiene casi 20 años de dedicarse a dicha actividad, fue enseñada por un vecino de él, ya que en ver la necesidad y crisis económica que  Pedro vivía en ese momento lo invito a trabajar de esa manera enseñándole como poder construir paredes y desde entonces fue aprendiendo cada vez mas acerca de la construcción. Actualmente, su trabajo le queda a una distancia de unos 4 kilómetros de distancia y empieza a laborar desde las 8:00am hasta las 4:00pm.

 Pedro fue contratado por una persona para que le construya una casa bastante grande, dado que tendrá trabajo casi por un periodo de un año; pero tiene unas cuantas limitantes, es por ello que invertirá su crédito en la compra de unas herramientas como pulidoras, taladros entre otras mas con esto podrá seguir su trabajo sin ningún problema y atrasos en sus actividades.

El sueño que tiene es poder llegar a tener todas las herramientas que necesita para trabajar sin ningún problema, otro anhelo es que sus hijos no dejen de ir a la escuela y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro is 44 years old and studied up through the 9th grade in school. In those times, the situation was very difficult and his parents could no longer continue sending him to school. Now, he is married and has 5 children who are studying in school. His wife works on the household chores.

Their main source of income is through masonry, and he has almost 20 years of experience with this activity. He was taught this activity by his neighbor. With the current economic crisis, his neighbor saw Pedro's need and invited him to learn from him how to build walls. Since then, he has been learning more and more about construction activities. Currently, Pedro's job is located 4 kilometers from home and he starts work from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. 

Pedro was contracted by a person to build a very large house, and he will have this job for one year. But there are a few limitations he faces. This is why he will invest his loan in the purchase of several tools, such as polishers, drills, and others, through which he can continue this job without issue or delay.

His dream is to be able to obtain all the tools he needs to work without interruption. Another desire he has is that his children do not stop attending school. He knows this can be achieved with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy polishing machines, drills, and other tools.

loans.name: Antonia Faustina

texts.es: Antonia de 50 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año. Es una mujer  muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes,  etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old and makes a living growing corn and beans. This is how she makes a living and brings the daily bread to her family. The harvest takes place from year to year. She is a hardworking, honorable, and responsible woman. In spite of the humble conditions in which she lives, she does not tire of working and and providing the best to her family. She is always watching over her family.

She has decided to come to this institution to request a loan because the planting season is approaching and she wants to be prepared with agricultural supplies like manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc., and improve the land, which is shown in the photo.

She hopes to have favorable results since she does not have another source of income. She has faith in God that she will have an abundant harvest which will allow her to continue bringing the daily bread to her household.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hija de 2 años y su madre, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Jorge solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Jorge lives in his own home with his wife, his 2 year-old daughter, and his mother. He has grown corn and beans for several years and that has given him the necessary experience to tend to his crops. When his harvest is ready he stores it in barns, as shown in the photograph, from where he goes out to sell them at different markets that he encounters near his home. With the earnings he obtains from these sales, he covers the costs of household expenses. Jorge is asking for a loan to be able to improve his land where he plants his seeds and buy the necessary supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicide, manure, among other things. This should help him obtain good harvests, and in turn, obtain better earnings to give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, among other things to improve his land.

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat is a 31 year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband owns a barber shop.  He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. 

Her husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for his barber shop, but due to financial constraints, Nazakat is not capable to buy these items for her husband's business purposes. Therefore, Nazakat has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her husband's business so that he can provide better services to his customers.  It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her husband's business and family.
For this financial assistance, Nazakat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some more useful things for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of skirts, jackets, shorts, pants, dresses, and shoes.

loans.name: Nolwandle

texts.en: Nolwandle is a 21-year-old, young businesswoman living in the rural Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a vegetable market where she sells vegetables, tomatoes and pumpkins at a local market. Nolwande is also very committed to her community. She volunteers her time as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students valuable life skills education. With the requested Kiva loan, she will make bulk purchases of vegetables, tomatoes and pumpkins, so that she can increase her sales and profits. Increased profits will enable her to expand her business, build her own vegetable shop, and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 30 year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children.  Her husband is doing a scrap recycling business, and Shazia is the leader for this group.
Shazia 's husband  needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but, due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk.  Therefore, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.
Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase scrap material in bulk.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Edwin es un hombre responsable y trabajador, hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en cual consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para él  lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Ha decidido invertir en su negocio, con el fin de atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar sus niveles de ventas e ingresos. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Edwin lives in his own home with his family. He is a responsible and hardworking man. Many years ago he decided to open a small business, which consists of a small store that, with great effort and dedication, he has succeeded in maintaining for the most part over several years. He counts on many customers, and for him, his customers are what is most important. He always serves them with a smile and much kindness, which is why he has earned the trust of many people in his zone. Also, it is why he always offers what his customers are looking for. He has decided to invest in his store with the end goal of attracting more customers, which will allow him to improve overall sales and income. This is why he is asking for this loan from INTEGRAL, to be able to invest in his little store and stock it with all types of products, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, oil, paper, detergent, and other products that are appealing to his customers. He is confident that in this way he can carry out his dream of improving his life situation.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, oil, paper, detergent, and other items.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de helados pues tiene una pequeña fabrica y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, frutas, leche y cremas. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Karina belongs to the communal bank "Qory Chaska" at the Asociación Arariwa microfinance institution. She earns her living making and selling ice cream. She has had a small ice cream factory for several years. She's dedicated to this business and is doing very well. Her opportunity requires a loan to purchase inputs such as sugar, fruits, milk, and cream. She is thankful for the loan that is granted and agrees to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is a 59-year-old, married man living with his spouse and three children in the area of Afandi Colony, Hyderabad, Pakistan.
He owns a shop in which he sells milk and curd for the nearby community and gets income for his family. He has been purchasing milk from the market and selling it as a retailer from his shop. Nowadays, customers are demanding ice cream, as the summer season is about to start. 
 He has been running this shop selling milk and curd for the last twenty years. He wants to buy a deep freezer because he is in need of freezing milk, curd and ice cream in the freezer.
 He manages his household necessities from his shop, and some of his relatives like to purchase fresh milk from his shop.  He easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers
Therefore, Hakim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to purchase a new deep freezer and sell new items, such as ice cream, from his shop. He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business as well.
He is very thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy deep freezer and open ice cream business in the shop.

loans.name: Calista

texts.en:
Calista is a 26-year-old single woman with one child. She lives in Mudzi district in Zimbabwe. 

She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools in her community. She does counseling sessions with students and helps at the local school during sporting activities. 

She started her poultry business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent. Over the 11 months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity: producing about 60 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents.   

She began her business because she saw that it was very profitable in her community. Calista would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and her poultry sales. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. She is looking forward to creating sustainable employment and to provide for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of goods for her stock

loans.name: Yeimy Katherin

texts.es:
La señorita Katherin le gusta, y quiere seguir estudiando enfermería porque quiere salir adelante y tiene muchas razones, y una de ellas es la siguiente, Para ella la enfermería lo es todo, es el amor al prójimo, es el sentir amor por los demás a pesar de que muchas veces y para muchas personas, no sirven para nada.
El ser enfermera no es solo simplemente aquella persona que se viste de blanco, es una persona que comparte necesidades y sentimientos, que alivia con sonrisas y muestras de afectos.
La enfermería para ella es más que una profesión es un DON por este motivo, ninguna de las cosas negativas que tiene esta profesión, se compara con lo bien que se siente al ayudar y aliviar.
Por eso ella cree que  debe seguir luchando por lo que quiere y lo que quiere es seguir y terminar de estudiar enfermería para que de alguna u otra manera el día de mañana pueda brindar un buen servicio a la comunidad y dado el caso el día de mañana pueda ayudar a los padres ya que la han venido apoyando en el largo camino.
Ella solicita el convenio de kiva para este último pago ya que la mama que es la persona en cargada de realizar el pago de las cuotas en esta oportunidad no le puede colaborar para realizar el pago.
texts.en:
Miss Katherin would like to continue studying nursing because she wants to improve her life situation for many reasons. One of these is the following:

For her, nursing is everything, it is the love of her neighbor, it is the feeling of loving others despite the fact that, many times and for many people, it is not reciprocated. 

Being a nurse is not just that person who dresses in white, it is a person who shares needs and feelings, who relives others with smiles and displays of affection. 

Nursing for her is more than a profession. As a result, none of the negative things associated with this profession can compare to how good it feels to help and provide for others. 

For this, she believes that she should continue fighting for what she loves, and what she loves is to continue and complete her nursing studies one way or another. One day, she will be able to bless her community with this service and eventually help her parents, who have been continually supporting her. 

She is asking for this agreement from Kiva for this last tuition payment, because her mother is responsible for paying these fees and at this time she cannot collaborate to carry out this payment.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is a 25 year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. By profession, he is a retailer of a curtains.  He has been doing his business for many years and this is the only source of income for his family.
Rahim needs to buy curtains in different designs in bulk quantity for reselling purposes, but, due to insufficient financial resources, he is unable to buy these curtains. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he will purchase curtains for reselling purpose so that he can earn more a profitable income from his business.

Rahim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy curtains in different designs for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en:
Esnath is a 21-year-old businesswoman, married, with one child. She lives in the Chingwena area of Mudzi district, in Zimbabwe. She is a CAMA member, actively involved in empowering school leavers to reinvest in the community by carrying out campaigns. 

Esnath operates a small retail shop in her community where she sells a variety of grocery products, such as soap, eggs, sugar, flour, milk, juice, salt, and mealie meal. The store is conveniently located since it is the only one in the vicinity. She started the business since there is a ready market for the grocery items and she wanted to raise income for her family. She volunteers in her community, cleaning the toilets at the local clinic and she is also a learner guide at the local secondary school.

The Kiva loan will enable Esnath to expand her business by increasing her stock and raising her sales. She hopes to create employment in her community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 17-year-old businesswoman who lives in Gokwe South district in Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a poultry project for six months and employs one person to assist her. 

With the requested loan she aims at improving and boosting her project through buying feeders and drink providers. She will expand the fowl run and buy stock feed in bulk. 

She also hopes to expand and create employment in her community and provide school fees for her young sisters. Faith volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local school in her community

loans.use: to buy feeders and drink providers, to expand the fowl run, and to buy stock feed in bulk

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai, aged 23, is a single mother with one child. She resides in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. 

Rumbidzai is volunteering her time as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to enhance the skills for the children in her community. She also volunteers as a health trainer in her community. 

Rumbidzai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bicycles, bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to earn a living.  

With the Kiva loan, Rumbidzai will purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her desire is to grow the business and build her own shop. She started her business for her to sustain her life and to provide good education for her only child.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra lives in Matobo district in Zimbabwe. She is 20 years old and is a single mother of one child. She has been operating a flea market stand for eight months now selling women’s clothing, shoes, and lingerie. 

Sandra is a volunteer within her community as part of the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization. She has been working with Camfed’s Mother Support Groups in a gardening project that was started as a way to increase the school’s feeding program. She is also a community health activist. 

With the Kiva loan Sandra will purchase the items that she sells in bulk so that she can increase sales and profits. With increased profits, she is planning to build her own shop and be able to look after her child. She also hopes to create employment through the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mellania

texts.en:
Mellania is a 21-year-old married woman. She lives in the Mudzi district, in Zimbabwe. 

Mellania is volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. She visits and supports the elderly in her community, helping them to wash and fetch firewood. She is also a member of the Cama district committee. 

In addition, Mellania has been successfully operating as an Agent of Eco-cash for a year, with the help of her husband and she also sells airtime at the growth point. 

With the Kiva loan, Mellania will purchase more accessories (i.e., phones and chargers) to provide enough services to clients. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts to increase her clothing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stationery and groceries in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Tapiwa

texts.en: Tapiwa is a young businesswoman, aged 21. She lives in Matobo District, Zimbabwe where she has been successfully operating a shop selling flour, biscuits, milk, salt and sugar. She is happy with the progress of her business, but is confident it can grow even more. Tapiwa volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a local school in her community where she teaches students life skills education. With the requested Kiva loan, Tapiwa will make bulk purchases of sugar, rice, salt, flour and biscuits so that she can benefit from increased sales and profits. She hopes to expand into a large retail business, create even more employment in her community, and further her studies.

loans.use: to purchase more food items in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a 20 year-old married lady with two children. She resides in Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. Tracy is a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Tracy rents a shop at her local township where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  
With the Kiva loan, she intends to make bulk purchases of clothes, bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to reduce costs and boost the sales.  She started this business as a source of income since her husband is unemployed. She hopes to expand the business and be able to meet all the costs in her family. Her desire is to grow the business and build her own shop. This will stabilize her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a 23-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has one child and lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe, where she specializes in sewing duvets, clothes, uniforms and seat covers. She started the business after she finished school and wanted to take the opportunity to utilize the knowledge she gained from Fashion and Fabrics, a high school class. Tracy also volunteers as a Camfed Learner guide, teaching students life skills education to improve their well-being. 
The Kiva loan will enable Tracy to purchase fabric, an over-locking machine, thread and tracing paper. An improvement in the business will enable her to further her education in interior decorating.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, an over locking machine, thread and tracing paper

loans.name: Fortitude

texts.en:
20-year-old Fortitude runs her own poultry business in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. Aside from being active in her business, Fortitude volunteers in local clinics and schools as a janitor because she believes that a clean environment is healthy and conducive for learning. 
She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. Fortitude would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. With the profits from her business, Foritude will be able to continue her education.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 43-year-old married man, living in the area of Kotri, Hyderabad, Pakistan. He is the father of six children. He has a dairy farm in which he trades livestock. Most of his trading activities are within his home area. He breeds livestock on his dairy farm as well and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they are grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. 
Due to his good reputation and relations with his customers, his dairy farm business is growing rapidly. He has been producing milk from buffaloes and breeding them. His production of milk and breeding schedule have been affected and he is unable to cope with the demand.
He wants to buy a buffalo to keep his income and business steady but he has already invested his savings into miscellaneous expenses of the dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a buffalo to continue to run his business smoothly. 
Therefore he contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan he would be able to buy a new buffalo. 
He hopes that he will pay all the installments on time. With the profit amount, he will buy fodder for his livestock and medication to prevent diseases.
Gulzar is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new buffalo

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is 28 years old, married, and has three daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own barber shop for eight years. Lubna's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise, such as combs, blades, shaving cream, and other barber shop accessories for his business. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these items. 

Lubna requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her husband buy different types of barber shop accessories for his barber shop. With the loan, he will earn more income and be able to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase different types of barber shop accessories for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 28 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la reparación y venta de cocinas desde hace 12 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para realizar su trabajo, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo y los buenos precios, la clienta esta  solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas repuestos de cocina por mayor y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This client is 28 years old and lives in a family member’s home with her husband and son. She has worked in repairing and selling kitchens for 12 years which has given her the experience necessary to do her job well.  Her business is located in her place of residence, and has a lot of customers due to the quality of her work and good prices. The client is requesting a loan to buy more kitchen parts on wholesale so she can continue her work, which is her only source of income, and to have a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen parts on wholesale.

loans.name: Safeeran

texts.en:
Safeeran is a 37-year-old woman and a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running his own business of paper-making for many years. Safeeran's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise for his business purpose. But, due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase this merchandise. 

To fulfill the needs of her husband's business, Safeeran has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for business purposes. It will be good for him to earn more income and this income will help him to fulfill his family's needs.

Safeeran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy essential ingredients for her husband's paper-making business.

loans.name: Mashooque

texts.en:
Mashooque is a 30-year-old married man living in the area of Kotri, Hyderabad, Pakistan. He is the father of a son. He is a livestock trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds livestock in his yard as well and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they are grown up and healthy, which is very lengthy and expensive procedure. 
Recently, two of his healthy buffaloes suddenly died due to disease. He had been producing milk from the buffaloes and breeding them. 
Mashooque wants to buy a buffalo to keep his income and business stable but he has already invested his all savings into miscellaneous expenses of the dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a buffalo to continue business smoothly. 
A field partner met with him and let him know about all the terms and conditions of Kiva loans through BRAC Pakistan. He agreed to the repayment schedule and signed all the necessary documents, including a client waiver. 
The fatal diseases are the major challenge for him. He hopes that he will pay all the installments on time. With the profit amount he will buy fodder for cattle and medication to prevent diseases.
Mashooque is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 42-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruit (e.g., apples, bananas, grapes). He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Razia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling purposes, so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But, due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruit for his business purpose.

Therefore, Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of fruit for her husband's business.

loans.name: Tinashe

texts.en:
Tinashe is a 28-year-old, married woman with two children. She resides in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Tinashe volunteers her time as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. She also volunteers as a health trainer in her community. 

In addition, Tinashe offers door-to-door delivery of old clothes and new clothes, where she sells products such as shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for 1.5 years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Tinashe will purchase more shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, and T-shirts to increase her clothes supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and build her own shop. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. She started her business to sustain her life and to provide a good education for her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, and T-shirts to increase her clothes supplies.

loans.name: Listnet

texts.en: Listnet is a 26-year-old, married woman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. To give back to her community, Listnet is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills education to local students. To support her family financially, she has been operating a growing poultry business for the past year, where she produces about 180 broiler birds every six weeks and sells them to local residents. She started the business because she wanted to be financially independent and saw that poultry production was profitable in her community. Listnet would very much like to increase her sales in order to become a supplier to major supermarkets, and provide a stable income for herself and her family. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle for her kraal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She is a married mother of two, currently living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. For the past year, she learned about horticulture with the assistance of her family. This experience led her to start a business selling tomatoes, onions and leaf vegetables. To better her community, Elizabeth also volunteers her spare time providing guidance and counseling services in local schools as part of Camfed’s My Better World program, which aims to address key issues facing youth. With the requested Kiva loan, Elizabeth will purchase tomato and onion seeds. With the growth of her business, she hopes to improve her family’s well-being and put her two children through school.

loans.use: To purchase more tomato and onion seeds.

loans.name: Qurban Ali

texts.en:
Qurban Ali is a 40-year-old married man, living in the area of Kotri, Hyderabad, Pakistan. He is the father of eight children. He is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard as well and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they are grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. He trades buffaloes as well. He buys buffaloes at a low price and sells them to the people for a profit.
He has been producing milk from the buffaloes and breeding them. His production of milk and the breeding schedule have been affected because he is unable to cope with the demand. 
Qurban Ali wants to buy a buffalo to keep his income and business stable but he has already invested his all savings into miscellaneous expenses of the dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy a buffalo to continue running his business smoothly. Therefore, Qurban Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to purchase a new buffalo for his business. He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business.
He is very impressed with the Kiva loan system and he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 29-year-old married man, living in the area of Kotri, Hyderabad, Pakistan, along with his family. He is the father of three children. He is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard as well and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they are grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. 
Recently, he made a plan to increase his dairy farm business because his production of milk and breeding procedure is not enough to fulfill his needs.  
Gulzar wants to buy a buffalo to keep his income and business stable but he has already invested his all savings into miscellaneous expenses of the dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy a buffalo to continue running his business smoothly. 
A field partner met with him and let him know about all the loan terms and conditions of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. He agreed on a repayment schedule and signed all the necessary documents, including a client waiver. 
Gulzar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he would be able to purchase a new buffalo for his business. He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business.
He is very impressed with the Kiva loan system and he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new buffalo

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is a young woman from Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 25, married and a housewife. Her husband Kamal, aged 29 years, is a farmer. Both studied up to grade eight. They are blessed with one daughter, who is a student of grade five.

To make a living for the family, Krishna's husband has been farming potatoes and other vegetables on their own plot of land. He has been doing this for many years, and he is the only breadwinner for the family. He works arduously to get ahead. He sells the produce from his agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies them with the necessary finances to provide their child, as well as themselves, with clothing, food, medicine, etc., although with many constraints.

Now, they want to expand their business by cultivating eggplant, which is a vegetable in great favor in their locality and is widely used in Indian dishes. Krishna has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase eggplant seeds, fertilizers and agricultural inputs that will help her to have smooth cultivation of the vegetable. 

Her goal is to continue increasing the cultivation of the product, strengthening her daughter's future and securing their future life with the profit earned from this business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 35-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a simple housewife and mother of two children. Her husband is running a jewelry  business and has sole responsibility for feeding his entire family and managing the overall household.

Nasreen's husband needs to buy different types of jewelry. Due to insufficient financial resources, he is not in a position to buy these items to fulfill his needs. Therefore, Nasreen has planned to help her husband by requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can buy what he needs for his business and earn maximum profits by providing better services.
For this financial assistance, Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more goods and new jewelry for her husband's business

loans.name: Ashabala

texts.en:
Ashabala is a 24-year-old married woman. She is illiterate, and just knows how to sign her name. Her poverty has not allowed her to receive an education. Now Ashabala is a mother of two children, and both of them go to school. 

Ashabala takes care of her animal husbandry. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is a farmer. 

Both Ashabala and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children and provide them with a better life. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream come true. 

Now Ashabala lives in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but with the profit, they hope to build a pakka house (made of bricks and cement). 

She gives her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Anayara

texts.en:
Anayara is a 47-year-old married woman, and her husband is 49 years old. Anayara is totally illiterate and can sign her name only. Anayara has no children. They live in a small town of Dhupguri region. 

From the very beginning, Anayara has faced many difficulties to run the family. Though her husband runs a small business, sales were not that much due to lack of variety of items. From her friend, Anayara came to know about the BJS (Kiva’s partner) and that BJS gives loan support. After that, she applied for a loan from BJS. 

With this loan, she has purchased a variety of utensils made of steel, aluminum, etc., and now their business is running very smoothly. She hopes she will be able to increase and extend her business with the profit from the business.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva, as this money will help them a lot.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of utensils made of steel, aluminum, etc. to increase the business.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati is a 51-year-old rural housewife who lives with her husband and three children in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. She and her husband have completed education up to grade eight. Being less educated, she is very much enthusiastic to educate her children, so that they are now still studying in higher classes.

Her husband is a farmer and sells vegetables in their local market. Due to lack of variety in production, he is now unable to meet the local people’s demand, and because of this his income became inconsistent. That is why Bharati has applied for a loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase bottle gourd seeds and fertilizers for farming. 

She first started with this bottle gourd cultivation, but later, with the profit, she will cultivate many kinds of other vegetables in different seasons for more sales. She hopes she can manage her family’s financial expenses with her business profit and can also build a concrete house for her family.

Now Bharati really thanks BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming bottle gourds.

loans.name: Basheer Ahmed

texts.en:
Basheer is a 43-year-old married and energetic man living with his spouse and seven children in the area of Latifabad, Hyderabad, Pakistan. He owns a general store where he sells shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase from him. 

Basheer's store is very well-known in the town and is doing quite well, but unfortunately he lacks sufficient stock to cope with demand. Moreover, his customers want fresh milk and ice cream.

To help meet demand, Basheer wants to start carrying milk and ice cream. He has therefore requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan  to open an additional business of milk and ice cream sales in his general store. He hopes that lenders will support him and that this loan will prove productive for his business as well.

Basheer, who is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system, is thankful to lenders.

loans.use: To open a milk and ice cream business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 24 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros asi como muestra en la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus dos  hijos. El cliente está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
The 24-year old client has been working in agriculture for several years and cultivates beans and corn. When harvest is ready, he keeps it in barns, as shown in the picture, and starts selling. He covers his household expenses with the income he obtains from the sales. He is a responsible, honest and hard-working man who lives with his wife and two children. 

The client is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as fertilizer, seeds, weed-killers, etc., given that the money he earns is not enough to cover these expenses. He expects to increase his income and to enjoy better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, weed-killer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar, la clienta desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite tener una mejor calidad de vida, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en: The client is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has a tortilla business, and she produces them noon and night each day. Her store is located in her home, and she very much wants to improve her business. This would bless her family with stable earnings and would allow them to have a better quality of life. She is asking for a loan in order to buy bulk corn and lime so that she can produce a greater quantity of tortillas. Above all on the weekends demand for her tortillas has been increasing, as many other tortilla shops have closed. Through this opportunity, she can earn higher wages, which will allow her to improve her family's economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime in bulk.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is from a small town, Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and two children. Her children are receiving education from a nearby village school. She and her husband are not educated, but he can sign his name. 

Dipa is rearing cows, and she sells their dairy products to the market. Her husband is associated with agricultural work. Though they both are the earning members of the family, their earning is insufficient for them. 

Dipa decided to grow her business by purchasing more cows and selling more dairy products to the market for making more profit for her family. This business is profitable for her because there is a lot of demand for dairy products in her area.  

Due to lack of money, she couldn’t buy cows and was unable to grow her business, so she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow. With the profit from this business, she wants to build a cattle farm and make her family financially strong. She has been running this business for the last few years, so she is experienced in this field, and that will help her to earn profit easily. 

She is very happy and very much thankful to Kiva and BJS for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to sell dairy products in the market.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Shahida's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation facilities to earn a profitable income. Shahida also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural goods that will help protect her crops.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Khalida is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en: Dilshad is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Dilshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Dilshad is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on her husband's three wheeled rickshaw.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 24-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband has been in the scrap recycling business for many years.

Kiran's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk. Therefore, Kiran has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Kiran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy scrap for recycling purposes.

loans.name: Akhtari

texts.en: Akhtari is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of that he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Akhtari has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Akhtari is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's rickshaw repair.

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
José, un hombre de diligente y emprendedor ha sentido el sabor dulce de la evolución en una actividad comercial.
Desde muy pequeño se crio en el campo al lado de su padre quien fue su mayor ejemplo de superación y responsabilidad, allí aprendió a trabajar la tierra y cultivos.
Al sentir la necesidad de tener ingresos más estables y seguros se desplazo hasta el casco urbano de la ciudad de Medellín para ejecutar sus proyectos y fue así como consiguió una carretilla y empezó a vender verduras y legumbres ambulantemente, caminando y ofreciendo sus productos por toda la ciudad.
Hoy en día tiene un modulo productivo en un sector muy comercial de la ciudad, desde allí atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa ya que afirma que el buen servicio es lo que hace que los clientes se sientan satisfechos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio con distintos tipo de verduras y así poder tener un inventario más amplio de productos, además de tenerlos siempre a la mano para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
El mayor desafío que enfrenta son las épocas de invierno, esto hace que sus ventas disminuyan significativamente y por ende sus ingresos también lo hagan.
texts.en:
José is a diligent and enterprising man who has experienced the sweet taste of commercial growth. Since he was a small boy, he grew up in the country at the side of his father, who was his best example of overcoming adversity and of responsibility. It was there that he learnt how to work the land and grow crops. As he wanted to earn a more stable and certain income, he went to the centre of the city of Medellín to carry out his plans, and this was how he bought a handcart and began to sell vegetables and pulses as a travelling seller, walking around selling his produce throughout the city. Nowadays, he has a productive unit in a very commercial part of the city, from which he serves his customers with a smile because he says it's good service that makes customers feel satisfied.

He is currently asking for a loan to stock his business with different kinds of vegetable so he can have a wider inventory of products. This will also help him have produce to hand for his customers.
The major challenge he faces is the winter season when his sales, and therefore his income, decrease significantly.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables and pulses to sell.

loans.name: Juli Johana

texts.es:
Juli es una laboriosa mujer que sabe aprovechar muy bien los recursos que obtiene. Desde hace muy poco tiempo emprendió con una tienda de abarrotes y comestibles que abrió con el dinero de una liquidación que recibió luego de terminar un contrato con una empresa.
Su mayor desafío es los requerimientos que le exige sanidad para poder tener su negocio en funcionamiento, esto la ha afectado bastante ya que no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar las adecuaciones que le están pidiendo.
Por esta razón acude a un préstamo para realizar estos mantenimientos locativos en su establecimiento como el arreglo de una pared, la colocación de un extintor y realizar trabajos de pintura general a su negocio. Poco apoco podrá irla puliendo y organizando.
En estos momentos su mayor anhelo es poder tener un negocio autosostenible y duradero en el tiempo que le permita obtener los ingresos suficientes para darle una mejor vida a su madre a la cual siente que tiene mucho que agradecerle.
texts.en:
Juli is a hard-working woman who knows how to best use the resources she has. She recently started her own grocery store business thanks to the money she received after finishing her contract with a company. Her biggest challenge is to meet the requirements set by the Health department. This has had a significant impact given that she does not have enough resources to cover the required alterations. 

She is requesting a loan to make these alterations in her store, such as repairing a wall, hanging a extinguisher and doing painting work. Little by little she will make improvements and better organize the business. 

Her biggest dream is to have a sustainable and long-lasting business that will allow her to obtain enough income to provide her mother, to whom she is very grateful, with a better life.

loans.use: to make improvements and alterations in her store.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 59 años de edad, que solo hizo cuarto grado en la escuela. Actualmente, esta casada, su esposo sufrió  hace 10 años un problema de salud y ahora esta postrado en una silla de ruedas y no puede realizar ningún tipo de actividad, ellos procrearon  dos hijos los cuales uno está en EE.UU y la hija menor está acompañada  


Ella posee dos vacas de las cuales obtiene la leche para vender, pero también tiene una granja de pollos que prácticamente es su principal fuente de ingresos, vende pollos de engorde para el consumo humano, esta actividad la esta realizando desde hace tres años aproximadamente; esta idea surgió por su propia iniciativa de querer superar la crisis económica que vivía en esos momentos su hijo que esta en EE.UU le ayuda con los gastos del hogar como alimentación entre otros dado que no tiene fuertes ingresos dado que esta como ilegal y en cualquier momento puede ser deportado al país.
