El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maya para el gallinero dado que donde tiene los pollos están encerrados en tablas de madera como tras corral no es una granja como debería de ser; pero quiere hacer el corral para los pollos y otra parte del crédito la invertirá en comprar mas pollos y alimento para dichos pollos.

Como objetivo tiene ampliar la granja,  tener mas pollos para vender dado que es un negocio que deja buenas ganancias y entre mayores ganancias tenga podrá invertir mas en los pollos, sacara para pagar la cuota de su crédito. Ella es una mujer perseverante y sabe que todo esto lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and only completed the 4th grade in school. Currently, she is married, and her husband has suffered a health problem for 10 years that has left him in a wheelchair and unable to work. They have two children, a son who is in the U.S., and a daughter who is married. 

She has two cows from which she obtains milk to sell, but she also has a flock of chickens that is practically their only source of income. She sells chickens for human consumption, which she has been doing for approximately 3 years. This idea came up on her own initiative in order to rise above the economic crisis in which they are living. Her son who is in the U.S. helps them with household costs, such as food, among others. They do not have a strong source of income, because he is currently living illegally in the U.S. and could be deported from the country at any time. 

She is asking for this loan to buy wire for the chicken coop, since the chickens they currently have are enclosed in wooden crates and this is not the way the coop should be set up. Instead, she wants to make a proper coop for her chickens, in addition to buying more chickens and animal feed. 

Her deam is to grow her farm and have more chickens to sell, and selling chickens is a business that obtains high earnings. With these increased earnings, she will have the opportunity to invest in more chickens and pay off her loan. She is a persevering woman and knows that she can achieve all of this with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy wire for the chicken coop, chickens, and feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Waheed Iqbal

texts.en:
Waheed Iqbal is a 51-year-old, married and energetic man living with his spouse and four children in the area of Latifabad, Hyderabad, Pakistan.

He is a milkman by profession. He sells milk at a shop nearby his community and gets a reasonable income for his family. He has been purchasing milk from the market and selling it as a retailer at his shop. Nowadays, his customers demand ice cream as the summer season is going to start. To cope with the demand of his customers, he wants to start an ice cream business in the shop as well, but he does not have a sufficient amount to open an additional ice cream business. He purchased an ice cream making machine for the business. In this regard he has to cover the cost of the ice cream making machine. Therefore, Waheed Iqbal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to start an additional business of having ice cream in his shop. He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business as well. He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system. He is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to open an ice cream business and cover the cost of the ice cream making machine.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a 30-year-old woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits like apples, bananas, and grapes. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Areej's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profits. Due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore, Areej has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

Areej is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is a 51-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. 

Her husband is an owner of a public call office (PCO) and has been running his PCO for the past 11 years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Sabra's husband has to purchase different kinds of accessories and furniture for business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Sabra has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandise for his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits.

Sabra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of accessories and furniture for her husband's public call office.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 45-year-old active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons and two daughters.

Her husband has been running a scrap recycling business. Irshad's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it, but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk.

Therefore, Irshad has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily recycle and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy scrap for recycling purposes.

loans.name: Oscar Hernán

texts.es:
El señor Óscar se ha desempeñado desde hace más de 20 años como vendedor de pollo y pescado de manera ambulante por los principales sectores de la ciudad de Medellín.
Este oficio lo aprendió gracias a un amigo que decidió enseñarle y darle un apoyo para que pudiera trabajar.
El se desempeña en esta actividad motivado por el amor que le tiene a su hijo y las ganas insaciables de poder pagarle un carrera profesional, pues su mayor anhelo es ver a su hijo como un hombre exitoso y titulado.
Por esta razón acude a la ayuda económica para comprar surtido de pollo y pescado, así podrá obtener utilidades al comprarlos de contado pues obtendrá un mayor descuento.
Al aumentar su inventario, aumentara sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, esto le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Los desafíos más grandes a los que se ha tenido que enfrentar en el desarrollo de su negocio son la lluvia y la violencia que se vive en algunos sectores de la ciudad.
texts.en: Oscar has worked for more than 20 years selling chicken and fish as a street vendor in the main areas of the city of Medellin. He learned this job through a friend who decided to teach him and give him support so that he could work. He works in this job motivated by the love he has for his son and the immense wish he has to be able to pay for his professional career, since his biggest desire is to see his son become a successful and professional man. Therefore he is requesting financial support to buy an assortment of chicken and fish. With this he will be able to obtain profit, because by buying them cash he will get a bigger discount. By increasing his stock he will increase his sales and therefore his income. This will allow him to improve his family's quality of life. The biggest challenges he has had to face to develop his business are the rain and the violence that exists in some areas of the city.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of chicken and fish at wholesale prices for further sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chisels, brushes, sandpaper, measuring tape, and more.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Musarat  provides sewing services and earns income to contribute  to manage the household. 

She needs needles, thread, fabric, and machine oil  for business purposes, but due to insufficient funds, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tailoring accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 35-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband sells spare auto parts and has run his spare parts shop for many years.  He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Shabana's husband has to purchase different kinds of auto spare parts, but due to insufficient funds, he cannot afford to purchase these items.

Therefore, Shabana has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan to purchase these items. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her husband's business.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Tiene 33 años de edad, casado con dos hijos, en edad escolar. Su esposa es ama de casa. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 1000 (Mil Córdobas). Con el objetivo de tener su propia vivienda, hace 7 años con sus ahorros compró un terreno, actualmente solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera: 300 bloques, cemento, hierro, zinc, clavos, madera cepillada y rustica, arena fina y gruesa y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.

Durante la entrevista se encontraba enfermo de conjuntivitis.
texts.en:
He is 33 years old, married, with two school-aged children. His wife is a homemaker. For 10 years, he has rented his home, making monthly payments of $1000 (one thousand Córdobas). With the goal of having his own home, 7 years ago he bought some land with his savings.

Currently, he is requesting his first loan to purchase materials to construct a home with a cement base and wooden walls: 300 cinderblocks, cement, iron, zinc, nails, planed timber, unfinished wood, and fine and coarse sand, as well as to cover labor costs.

His dream is to have a safe home with basic conditions. He also wants to furnish his house with a toilet and construct a septic tank since currently he has a latrine in fair condition.

During the interview he was sick with conjunctivitis.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a home with a concrete base and wood walls.

loans.name: Amanda Cecilia

texts.es: Amanda de 32 años de edad se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren  porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Amanda es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Amanda tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Amanda is 32 years old and sells fruits and vegetables. She has had this business for several years and this has given her much experience in sales, which has allowed her to increase her earnings. The location where she sells is very strategic for this activity and very full of people. She also has many customers that prefer her store because her products are fresh, of good prices and quality, and come with excellent service. Amanda is an entrepreneurial woman and very dedicated to her work. She has the desire to improve her living situation and is always looking for opportunities that will allow her to achieve success. In the last few weeks, demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment, but doesn't have the sufficient capital to support this venture. This is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. Amanda has good credit references, and is grateful for the support. She assures us that she will be able to settle the debt, and at the same time trusts that this will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Omaira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Omaira es una mujer luchadora y muy emprendedora y conoce el significado del trabajo duro y la perseverancia. Tiene 35 años y toda su vida ha tratado de progresar y salir adelante.
Tiene un pequeño negocio en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de alimentos, desde empanadas y buñuelos en las mañanas, hasta comidas rápidas en las horas de la noche. Siempre se ha caracterizado por su sazón y buen servicio al atender a sus clientes.
Tiene mucha trayectoria en el negocio ya lleva gran tiempo ejerciendo esta labor y tiene mucho reconocimiento en el sector.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos que necesita como servilletas y elementos desechables como vasos, platos y cubiertos, esto le permitirá obtener algunas utilidades al comprar estos artículos al por mayor. De este modo podrá seguir ofreciendo sus alimentos a los clientes y asegurará su permanencia en el mercado.
Su mayor anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio y ubicarse en un local, en el cual podría ofrecer un empleo.
texts.en:
Omaria is a hardworking and enterprising woman who knows the value of hard work and perseverance.  She is 35 years old and has worked to progress and get ahead all her life.

She has a small business where she offers different types of food like empanadas and buñuelos in the mornings and fast food in the evenings.  She has always been known for her enthusiasm and good customer service.

She has many years in the business and has been doing this work for a long time and knows the area. 

She is asking for a loan to buy some supplies such as napkins and disposable items like plates, cups, and flatware in bulk.  This way she will be able to offer her food to her customers and be able to stay in the market.

Her greatest dream is to be able to expand her business and set up in a shop where she can offer employment to others.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Fidel

texts.es:
El señor francisco es un hombre de una simpatía impresionante, que es capaz de amenizar cualquier momento del día con sus ocurrencias y buen humor, por eso sus clientes siempre acuden a el por el buen servicio que este les ofrece.
El tiene un pequeño modulo en el cual exhibe y vende sus verduras, frutas y legumbres, es un negocio pequeño pero en el cual se encuentra mucha variedad.
En el negocio le ayuda uno de sus hijos en las horas de la mañana y en la tarde se encuentra solo manejando su establecimiento.
El requiere dinero para comprar más surtido de verduras y legumbres, de este modo podrá tener su tienda abastecida de mayor cantidad de productos y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Por otro lado obtendrá una mayor ganancia al comprarlos al por mayor.
Su deseo es poder tener un mini mercado aprovisionado con una infinidad de productos y ofrecerlos al público.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco is a man with great charm, and is able to liven up any moment of the day with his jokes and good humor, which is why his customers always return to him for the good feelings this brings them. 

He has a small unit in which he displays and sells vegetables, fruits and legumes. It is a small business but with a lot of variety. One of his children helps him run the business in the mornings, and in the afternoons he manages his station alone. 

He needs a loan to buy more a greater variety of vegetables and legumes, so he can have a larger supply of products to offer his customers. Additionally, he will get a greater profit if he buys the products in bulk. His goal is to have a mini market stocked with a vast amount of products to offer to the public.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy speakers, power, lights, etc.

loans.name: Zarqa

texts.en:
Zarqa is a 43-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six daughters. Her husband is responsible to meet the needs of the family. Zarqa provides sewing services by running a self sewing center and earning income to help pay household expenses.
 
She needs  needles, thread, material, and machine oil, but due to insufficient funds, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Zarqa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing accessories for her sewing center business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 51-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband is responsible for meeting the family's needs. Shaheen provides sewing services to contribute to household expenses.
 
She needs needles, thread, material, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient funds, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase accessories and help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of sewing accessories.

loans.name: Kiran's Group

texts.en:
Kiran is a 28-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband works in the private sector and rents three vehicles. He manages the entire house hold expenses.

Kiran's husband wants to maintain the vehicles, but due to some financial constraints, he is unable to afford the vehicle's maintenance. Therefore Kiran has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member so that she can assist her husband with vehicle's maintenance costs.

 Kiran is very thankful to Kiva for this financial support

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 12 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to repair his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. The taxi requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Yasmeen's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Yasmeen also plans to increase their savings with the profits from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi repairs.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 35-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for meeting the needs of all family members. Farhat has run her own beauty salon for five years and contributes to managing household expenses.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items.  Farhat has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers.  It will also help  her to earn maximum income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Farhat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 42-years-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her spouse and four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been an auto mechanic for twenty five years. He is responsible to meet the needs of the entire family.

Shabana's husband wants to purchase different types of tools and other accessories, but due to insufficient funds, he is unable to purchase these items.  Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan to purchase these items so that he can provide better services and earn more income.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy  tools and accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 44-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Saeeda provides sewing services to  manage the household expenses.
 
She needs needles, thread, material, and machine oil, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Saeeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Maicol Marin

texts.es:
Maicol nació en Lima - Perú, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Villa Esperanza en Carabayllo con sus padres que vinieron de Huanuco (sierra del Perú)a la capital en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades. Su madre se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan de manera informal y su padre ayuda en el negocio al no poder trabajar en otra cosa debido a que sufre de ulcera crónica. Maicol maneja una Mototaxi eventualmente, lo que apenas le alcanza para ayudar económicamente en casa, por lo que tendría que dejar sus estudios para trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva.
Maicol desea terminar su carrera y en lo posible seguir especializando para poder laborar en una empresa de prestigio y así poder ayudar económicamente a sus padres, por lo que agradece el apoyo que los prestamistas de Kiva pueden brindarle a el y a todos los jovenes que desean progresar por medio de la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Maicol was born in Lima, Peru, and lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood of Carabayllo with his parents, who moved from Huanuco (in the Peruvian mountains) to the capital in search of better opportunities. His mother has an informal business making and selling bread, and his father helps out with that business since he cannot find other work due to his chronic ulcers. Maicol sometimes drives a motorcycle taxi, which earns him just barely enough to help out economically at home. Without the support of Kiva lenders, he would have to stop studying in order to work. 

Maicol wants to finish his degree and possibly continue to specialize so that he can work at a prestigious company and help his parents economically. He is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide to him and to all the young people who want to get ahead through the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to pay for his technical studies in Mechanical Maintenance

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a hardworking 26-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is 37 years old. Dipali is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. They live in the small town of Dhupguri. They have a small plot of land on which her husband cultivates different crops. 

Dipali has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy fertilizers and the seeds of bottle gourds for cultivation. She wants to enhance the business by cultivating more varieties of vegetables and earn more. They dream of giving a good and bright future to their children with a part of the profit from their business. 

They are thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending their helping hand.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for bottle gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is 40 years old and married with three children. Her husband is 45 years old. Merina and her husband are illiterate and only able to sign their names. Her three children are studying in different grades.

Her husband is a farmer. His income is too low to run the family. Giving an education to all her children and running a household has become too difficult for them. Thus, Merina decided to do start her own business to earn money and contribute to the smooth functioning of the family. In her childhood, she learned stitching and knitting so she decided to use this as her business. She thought of buying a sewing machine to expose her skills and earn money. For this reason, she has applied for a loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a sewing machine. She has already started to take orders for preparing dresses and hopes she will succeed in her life and in her aim. 

She is very dedicated to her business and is really grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to start her tailoring business.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima, aged 45 years, studied up to grade six, but could not continue due to her parents’ financial situation. She is married to Tapan, and her husband produces different kinds of vegetables on their own plot of land. He is 50 years old and is illiterate; he can sign his name only. They live in their own house in the small village, Kalirhat, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

They have two sons who are grown up and are engaged in their father's agribusiness. Purnima is a housewife who looks after her husband and sons and does the household jobs. Her husband is a farmer who has been involved in land cultivation for many years and especially grows potatoes, which is a vegetable widely used in India. Purnima and her husband, along with their sons, sell the products to the different dealers in the area and to the other buyers who come to buy vegetables. 

Now the income from this agribusiness is not sufficient for a family of four members. In order to earn additional profit, they have decided to cultivate cucumbers on their farmland, but lack the capital.

Purnima has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

Purnima's goal for the future is to continue working with her husband's business so that they can earn more profit and thus give the family a better living standard.

She also aspires to upgrade their house to concrete-made. She and her husband are grateful to both the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 34-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for meeting the needs of all family members. Sumaira has run her own beauty salon for five years and contributes her income  to manage the household expenses.
 
She needs to buy cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, is not able to buy these items. Therefore, Sumaira has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the items to provide better services to her customers.  It will also help  her to earn maximum profits to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Sumaira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Forget

texts.en:
Forget is a 32-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nyanga. She is married and has one boy and two girls. 

Forget runs a small farm to grow potatoes in the Nyanga District. 

With the requested loan, Forget intends to buy large quantities of pipes for her irrigation system, purchase more seeds to expand a tomato farm, and employ more people.  Enlarging her farm will help to increase her income, supply food to more people in the community, and care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements and equipment.

loans.name: Jesus De Nazaret Group

texts.es:
SORAIDA. Es una mujer de 37 años, quien vive desde siempre en un pueblo al cual se llega en canoa. Este pueblo fue devastado por la naturaleza y reubicado. Es un pueblo donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y venta de madera. 
Soraida vive con sus dos pequeños hijos y su esposo. En una pequeña casa donada por el gobierno. 
Desde hace más de 4 años. Soraida se dedica a la venta de sabanas y productos de perfumería. Con esto ha sobresalido con su familia ya que su esposo no tiene trabajo.
El presente crédito. Será utilizado en la compra de sabanas y perfumes que están en promoción.Con esto su negocio estará más abastecido de mercadería. Soraida ocupa 2 días para adquirir estas sabanas en Ibarra a 7 horas de su pueblo. El pueblo de Soraida no cuenta con centros de salud. El servicio de agua no es normal. Los estudiantes deben salir a comunidades cercanas para asistir a clases.
Las ventas de Soraida son a crédito por 2 semanas y es ventajoso porque obtiene mejores ingresos.
Para Soraida es la tercera vez que hace estos créditos y le parece genial. Porque le da la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio.

INFORMACION ADICIONAL.
5 personas del grupo recibirán $1800,00 cada uno por ser el tercer crédito. Y 2 personas quienes se integran por primera vez reciben $500.00 cada una. Son habitantes de la misma comunidad y tienen negocios diferentes. 
En la fotografía vemos al líder del grupo levantando su mano.
texts.en:
Soraida is a 37-year-old woman who has always lived in a village that is only reachable by canoe. This village was devastated by natural disasters and had to be relocated. It is a village whose people work in agriculture and selling lumber. Soraida lives with her two young children and her husband in a small house donated by the government. For the last four years, she has been selling sheets and perfume products. With this, her family has been able to get by, since her husband does not have a job. 

This loan will be used to buy perfume and sheets on sale. With this, her business will have more merchandise in stock. It takes Soraida two days to buy sheets in Ibarra, seven hours from her village. Soraida's village doesn't have any health centers, and water doesn't run regularly. Students must go to nearby communities to attend school. Soraida sells her products on two weeks of credit, which is advantageous since it helps her earn more. This is Soraida's third loan, and she thinks it is great because it gives her the opportunity to expand her business. 

Additional information:
Five people in this group will receive $1800 each, since this is their third loan cycle. There are also two group members who are just joining the group, and they will receive $500 each. They all live in the same community and have different businesses. In the photograph, the group leader is raising her hand.

loans.use: to travel to the city to buy merchandise wholesale, to better serve her isolated community

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número 15, es un grupo muy trabajador y conocido en la zona por la unión que siempre demuestran. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una mujer digna de destacar es la Sra. Maria.
Ella se dedica la venta de gallinas y también de queso, es por medio de este trabajo que lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una persona muy sacrificada que con esfuerzo y trabajo está luchando por poder salir adelante. Ella quiere comprar gallinas y queso para la venta, ya que así podrá desarrollarse en el negocio que tiene.
Todas están muy contentas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de capacitarse e ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen Group is on its 15th loan cycle, and is a very hard-working group that is well known in the area for the unity they always show. They are part of Fundación Paraguaya's poverty elimination program, and one woman worthy of highlighting is Sra. Maria. 

She works selling chickens and cheese, and through her work fights for her family so that she can give them everything that she couldn't have. She is a very self-sacrificing person, who through hard work is fighting to get ahead. She wants to buy chickens and cheese to resell, so that she can continue to grow her business. 

All the women are very pleased with this opportunity to receive training and continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cheese to sell

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en:
Nuri is from the small village Altagram in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is a woman of 25 years, married and a mother of one son.  She got education up to grade 8, but could not proceed further due to her parents' poor economic condition.  Her son is below school-going age.

Nuri's husband Anwar, aged 24 years, has been engaged in farming for several years, as he did not get a chance for elementary education. As he has been in agricultural business for such a long time, it has given him the skills and knowledge necessary to attend to his crops. Nuri, though a housewife, helps her husband in his work after completing her household work. Their principle crop is potatoes.  When the harvest is ready, it is sold on the local market and thus Anwar earns money to meet the family expenses.  But his small income cannot give sufficient financial support to the family.  He wants to cultivate chillis, which is a product having good demand, to expand his business, but is unable to do for lack of capital.

So Nuri has taken a loan from BJS to help her husband to expand his farming business.  She plans to purchase chilli seeds, fertilizers and manure to cultivate chillis.  She is hopeful that this business will give a better quality life to her family and allow her to save some money for her children's future.

In future, she wants to purchase a tractor with the profit earned from this business.

She is thankful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase chilli seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is 25 years old and married. Her husband is 43 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can sign only their names. They live in Vivekananda Para, which is in the Dhupguri region. Minati has three children. One of them has completed grade 10 and the other two are still studying in grades 1 and 8, respectively. 

Minati has faced many difficulties in running the family. Her husband is a van puller. The van is rented from a local owner but he cannot earn much profit, so his income is insufficient to cover all the household expenses.

Minati came to know about Kiva’s partner BJS from one of her friends and learned that BJS gives loan support. So she applied for a loan to purchase beetle nuts and leaves to start her own betel shop. She hopes this will increase her family's income. She dreams of shifting to a concrete house with the help of her business profit. 

 She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more beetle nuts and leaves for her betel shop

loans.name: Rolando Alejandro

texts.es:
Rolando es hijo único, sus padres son separados y el vive con su madre en Lima, ella se encarga sola de su crianza y manutención, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de calzado, única fuente de ingreso en el hogar. Rolando esta iniciando su carrera técnica en Electrónica y los problemas económicos en casa ocasionarían que deba de dejar sus estudios para empezar a trabajar a su corta edad de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Rolando desea estudiar y culminar su carrera técnica y ser profesional para poder apoyar a su madre que tanto esfuerzo a hecho por el.
Rolando quiere agradecer a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que le brindan a el y a todos los jóvenes sin recursos para poder estudiar sin problemas y ser mejores personas.
texts.en:
Rolando is an only child; his parents are separated and he lives with his mother in Lima. She is his sole caretaker, and has a small shoe sales business which is their household's only source of income. Rolando is starting a technical degree in Electronics, and the economic problems at home mean that even at his young age, he would have to stop studying in order to start working if it weren't for the support of Kiva lenders. 

Rolando wants to study, finish his technical degree and become a professional so that he can support his mother, who has worked so hard for him. Rolando would like to thank Kiva lenders for the support they are providing to him and to all the young people with few resources to help them study without problems and become better people.

loans.use: to financce technical studies in electronics

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Shila is a 24-year-old young lady who is married to Pankaj, age 36. Together they are raising only one daughter.  Both Shila and her husband attended school up to grade eight and could not continue their studies due to financial problems. They live in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri .

Her husband is engaged in the business of selling wood, which provides little income. In order to provide additional income, Shila is trying her own way of earning. Shila owns and manages an animal husbandry business where she has one cow and one buffalo.  She sells milk to her neighbors. Her income is also very small for a family of three members.

She wants to purchase a Jersey Cow for her farm, as the demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She has a plan to repair the shed for cattle and make it bigger. Thus, she has asked for a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner).

In the future, she wants to increase her farm and sell more milk and milk products to give a quality life to her family and save money for her daughter's future.  She also intends to buy a trolley in the future with the profit.

Her full thanks go to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for business purposes.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati lives in a remote village in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 40 years old and passed grade 8 but could not continue her studies due to her parent's poor economic resources.  She is married to Dulal and together they are raising one son and one daughter. Her daughter reads in grade 11 and her son is engaged in a small business.  They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw).

Parbati's husband has a small grocery shop in their home, which permits him to have an income with which he can help his family with the nourishment and education of her daughter.  He has been running this business for the last 10 years.  He sells groceries like rice, flour, sugar, salt, oil etc. and they have no other source of income.  Their son earns a little, which he spends for his own expenses.  Parbati is a housewife. But due to the very small income from the shop, it is very much difficult for them to meet all the expenses of the family. The main challenge for her husband is inadequate finances to stock the shop.

Parbati wants to help her husband.  So, she has taken a loan from BJS to replenish her husband's grocery shop.  She plans to purchase the necessary items so that they can meet their customers' demands.

She thinks that the extra income will help her to adequately stock her shop and this will improve business profitability and upgrade their financial condition. She aspires to build a concrete-made house for them. 

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase products for her husband's grocery shop.

loans.name: El Progreso Del Pobre Group

texts.es:
A sus 47 años don GUIDO vive con sus padres viven en una comunidad llamada Olmedo. Don Guido se dedica a la pesca. Actividad que la realiza 3 días a la semana desde las 4:00 am toma su embarcación y a 1 hora de distancia inicia su jornada de pesca.
Al regreso. Comercializa sus peces a compradores intermediarios. Quienes luego venden este producto a un costo mayor al 100% de lo que el vendió. Don Guido, está en trámite de un crédito por $1000. Con los que podrá restaurar su red yreparara su embarcación. Don Guido desea en un futuro. Cambiar de embarcación (de madera a fibra) a más de cambiar su viejo motor fuera de borda por uno mejor. Nos comentó de las dificultades que tienen en alta mar. Donde son víctimas de asaltos por piratas quienes les sustraen el producto pescado. Los motores y a veces las mismas embarcaciones. A futuro desea ser comprador intermediario de peces y obtener mayor ganancias.
Su grupo está formado por 8 personas. Y cada una recibirá $1000 para invertir en cada negocio. Todos han tenido un excelente pago anterior y están comprometidos en seguir mejorando sus negocios y ofrecer a sus clientes mejores productos.
texts.en:
Guido is 47 years old and lives with his parents in a community called Olmedo. Don Guido is a fisherman. He works three days a week starting at 4am, when he takes his boat out an hour to start his day of fishing. 

When he returns, he sells his fish to intermediate buyers, who then resell his fish with more than a 100% markup on the price they paid him. Don Guido is requesting a loan of $1,000, which he will use to fix his fishing net and repair his boat. In the future, Don Guido wants to get a new boat (made of fiberglass instead of wood) and change out his old off-board motor for a better one. He told us about the challenges that occur on the high seas, where pirates sometimes assault fisherman to steal their fish, motors and sometimes even their boats. In the future, he hopes to work as an intermediate buyer so that he can earn more. 

His group is made up of eight people, each of whom will receive $1,000 to invest in their respective businesses. They all have excellent repayment history and are committed to continue to improve their businesses and offer better products to their clients.

loans.use: to fix his fishing line and repair his boat, so that one day he can become a fishing merchant

loans.name: Sibongile

texts.en:
Sibongile is a 21-year-old farmer. She is the mother of one child and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating her farm for over two months while serving as a Learner Guide (see below) at the local secondary school.

Sibongile is applying for a 500 USD loan through Camfed to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to boost her sales volume and profit margins. With her additional profits she hopes to expand her farm and improve her and her child’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
Gloria fue gran parte de su vida una mujer dedicada a su hogar y a sus hijos, pero desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de mercancía a través de catalogo. Impulsada por la necesitad de obtener más ingresos para su hogar y colaborar con los gastos de su casa inicio con este negocio.
Ella vende distintos tipos de marcas y referencias de ropa y artículos para el hogar que sus clientes le piden, ya que solo trabaja por medio de pedidos específicos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar artículos que están en promoción en lo catálogos ya que estos le generan una mayor utilidad, así podrá obtener más ingresos para la manutención de su familia.
Ella desea fortalecer su negocio y extenderlo a más integrantes de su familia para que ellos también puedan progresar y así ser la responsable de generar más empleos.
texts.en:
For a long period of her life, Gloria was a woman devoted to her home and children but 25 years ago she began to sell merchandise through catalogs. She began this business driven by the necessity to earn more income for her household and help with the costs of her home. 
She sells different brands and types of clothing and housewares that her customers request. She only works through special orders.
She is requesting a loan to buy items that are on sale in catalogs because she can generate a higher income with these products so that she can earn more income to support her family. 
She wants to strengthen her business and expand it to more members of her family so that they too can thrive. She wants to be responsible for generating more jobs.

loans.use: to purchase items on sale in order to sell them

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is twenty years old, married and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a clothing and grocery shop for over five months and employs one person to assist her. She also serves as a Learner Guide (see below) in a local secondary school.

Prudence is applying for a 500 USD loan through Camfed to buy clothes in bulk, cooking oil, sugar, rice and peanut butter to boost her sales and increase her profit margins. She hopes to expand her shop and provide better for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Félix De Jesús

texts.es:
Félix de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es quien se encarga que todo esté en orden en la casa, es padre de 4 hijos, tres estudian y el mayor ya termino el bachillerato, por la escases de recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando un nivel superior.   

Él es panificador, tiene de dedicarse a la actividad desde que era un niño, sus padres tenían una pequeña panadería en casa, razón por la cual desde la infancia aprendió el oficio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura;  pero luego por problemas de salud decidió dedicarse de lleno a panificador, él es empleado por lo que trabaja todo el día, y recorre unos 5 km diarios para ir donde trabaja, una parte la hace en bus y lo demás a pie, el horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 6 pm. 


El préstamo será invertido en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que la parte del techo está dañada y el invierno ya se avecina, lo que comprara es teja, cuartón, regla, clavos, etc. La necesidad satisfecha será el poder mejorar la vivienda ya que están importantes para el núcleo familiar.

Sus sueños a futuro son, tener un hogar digno donde vivir, que sus hijos y esposa puedan tener un poco de comodidad, el préstamo le ayudara a solucionar la dificultad que tiene de la casa.
texts.en:
Félix is a 50-year old married man who studied up to fifth grade. His partner, who is a housewife, takes care of their home. They have four children: three of them attend school and the oldest already finished high-school and could not keep studying because of limited financial resources. 

He works as a baker and has been involved in this activity since he was a little boy. His parents had a small bakery at home and he learned the profession from them. He used to work in agriculture too, but after having some health problems he decided to work as a baker full-time. He is an employee and works all day long, from 6am to 6pm. He travels 5km daily, doing part of the trip by bus and also walking. 

He will use the loan to make improvements to his house, given that the ceiling is damaged and the winter is getting close. He will buy tiles, beams, a ruler, nails, etc. Thanks to the loan he will be able to cover this need, which is important for his family. 

His dream is to have a decent home where his wife and children can live comfortably. The loan will help him to solve their current problems with the house.

loans.use: to buy tiles, beams, a ruler, nails, etc. to repair part of the ceiling, which is damaged, now that the winter is getting close.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Es un joven luchador y amable de 28 años de edad, soltero, no tiene hijos. Con el objetivo de ser un profesional, solicita su primer financiamiento para cubrir gastos de titulo y aranceles universitarios. Desde hace 5 años inicio sus estudios universitarios de pedagogía en una universidad del Municipio de Rosita. Actualmente habita en casa de sus padres con sus 8 hermanos. Su sueño es estudiar un postgrado en Piscología y tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en: He is a young, determined and friendly 28 year old single man. He does not have any children. In order to become a professional, he is requesting his first loan to cover the fees for his university tuition and degree. He started his university studies in education five years ago at a city university in Rosita. Currently, he lives in his parents' house with his eight siblings. His dream is to pursue postgraduate studies in Psychology and to have his own home.

loans.use: cover the fees for his university tuition and degree

loans.name: Tapasi

texts.en:
Tapasi is a rural woman who is very young and energetic.  She is married and is a mother of two sons.  She lives in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri with her sons and husband.  Her husband Ujjal is a farmer. Both have a secondary education but could not continue further studies due to the financial stringency of their parents. Their sons are students in grade one and six, respectively.

Tapasi's husband works hard from dawn to dusk on his farmland to produce more crops and to earn more profit from his agribusiness. Unfortunately, he cannot give sufficient financial sustenance. He is a man of very good behavior, so his clients want to purchase more crops from him, which he cannot give due to lack of capital.  He also wants to cultivate chilies as it is a very important vegetable that is widely used in his locality.

Tapasi is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase agricultural inputs such as seeds, manure and fertilizers to start cultivation of the crop.
She has various duties to fulfill such as giving a good education to her children, taking care of her crops, and providing financial stability to her family.  She also wants to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house with the profit from her business.

She wants to thank BJS and Kiva for the financial support she has got from them.

loans.use: To purchase chili seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Jaya is 34 years old and lives with her husband Rajeswar, aged 40 years, and three children (one son and two daughters) in the small village Baroghoria in the district Jalpaiguri.  Jaya and her husband both are uneducated; they can sign their names only.  Their children are students in grades 10, 8, 4 respectively.

Jaya is a housewife and her husband works in agriculture, specifically growing wheat. He has been working in this field for many years and he has gained valuable experience that allows him to have better harvests.  He sells his harvest in all of the surrounding areas, and he has many regular customers.  These people prefer his products because of their quality and their affordable prices.  Now he wants to expand his business in order to generate more income as the household expenses are increasing day by day. So, he wants to increase his production, thereby improving his earnings. He also wants to invest in supplies but he does not have the capital.

Jaya is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, for her husband that will allow her to purchase seeds of wheat, manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. this will allow him to continue working and continue helping his family with the household expenses.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for granting her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers, etc. for cultivation.

loans.name: Abiya

texts.en:
Abiya is a 42-year-old woman from the remote village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She lives there in her own house with her husband and two sons.  She is married to Kabir.  One of her sons is a truck driver and the other runs a tea stall. Both Abiya and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. 

Abiya can be characterized as an exemplary wife and mother who strives untiringly to offer her family well being and sustenance.

She has had a grocery shop for more than 10 years in her own house. She is a very gentle and polite lady so she always has good sales.  Now she wants to keep varied grocery items in her shop to satisfy the desires and needs of her customers, which will keep her business profitable and ensure profit.

She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy necessary commodities for her shop such as rice, dal, oil, salt, sugar etc.  She hopes it will enable her to earn additional profit from this new step in her business.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase various grocery items for their existing grocery shop.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a very young, hardworking and energetic woman.  She is 25 years old, married and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). With her husband and children, she lives in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Kalpana studied up to grade six.  Her husband Khokon, 27, who is illiterate, is a farmer.  One of their children goes to school and reads in grade one and the other is too young for school.

Kalpana has been involved in a milk supply business for the last five years.  She sells the milk to her neighbors.  This business adds additional financial help to her family to cover the basic needs. Now she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high and she is not able to supply the growing needs of her customers.

She has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cow and fodder.  She wants to extend her milk supply business and she hopes that this business will help her to support her children's education.  She thinks that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to build a concrete-made house.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Sandra Aracely

texts.es: Sandra de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad a la hora vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Sandra esta solici8atndo un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir con la elaboración de las mismas y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sandra is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She produces and sells tortillas, and her store is located in her home. She has many customers because she offers great prices and service. She covers the household expenses with what she earns in sales. Sandra is asking for this loan to buy corn and lime in bulk in order to continue production. This will help her improve her income and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime in bulk.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John se siente muy afortunado pues después de mucho tiempo se ha enterado de una noticia que le cambio la vida por completo, y es que va a ser padre de una linda niña. Por esta razón es que se ha decidido iniciar con su negocio de 
Producción y venta de yogures, actividad que alterna con un trabajo en una empresa de logística en la cual trabaja en las mañanas y en las tardes y parte de la noche se dedica en pleno a su negocio.
Ya que su mayor motivación es su hija y su esposa ha decidido incrementar sus ingresos para darles todo lo mejor, por eso acude a una ayuda económica para comprar un fogón en el cual preparar sus bebidas y además adquirir los insumos necesarios para su producción.
En estos momentos el centro de su vida es su hija y afirma que luchara de sol a sol para que nunca le falte nada y pueda desarrollarse en un entorno de amor.
texts.en:
John feels very fortunate, as after a long time he has learned news that will change his life completely: he is going to be the father of a beautiful girl. For this reason he decided to start his own business producing and selling yogurts, an activity he alternates with a job at a logistics company where he works in the mornings. He devotes the afternoons and part of the evenings to his business.

His daughter and his wife are his greatest motivation. He has decided to increase his earnings to give them the best in everything. He therefore came in for financial help to buy a stove he will use to prepare his drinks and also to buy the supplies necessary for his production.

His daughter is currently the center of his life and he asserts that he will strive from sunrise to sunset to ensure that she's never lacking anything and is able to grow up in a loving environment.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make his drinks and to buy the necessary supplies.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta de 54 años de edad, no tuvo  la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, pero si tiene una educación impecable para con los demás, su pareja falleció hace 5 años, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, todos trabajan;  por lo que le ayudan a su mamá. También tiene un nieto que vive con ella.


Ella es ama de casa, toda su vida se ha dedicado a los quehaceres del hogar, en los tiempos en que se creció, era primordial el aprender los oficios domésticos, por lo que su mamá le enseño todo lo que iba a necesitar para salir adelante, también cuida cuatro vacas que son de su pertenencia, ella es una mujer luchadora, a pesar que quedo viuda no se desanimó, y siguió luchando por salir adelante.

 Ella se encarga del cuidado del ganado que tiene, por lo que desde que se levanta empieza la jornada de trabajo, a la 1 de la tarde las lleva al rio para que tomen agua, el que le queda a un kilómetro de retirado.
     

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de una ternera, el mejoramiento será el poder trabajar con el ganado y cuando sea la oportunidad de venderlo a buen precio lo hará, la necesidad satisfecha será el poder tener su propio capital de trabajo y no andar prestando a los vecinos.

Los sueños que tiene son seguir trabajando, luchando mientras tenga salud y vida, espera que lo que ha logrado los hijos lo sepan valorar, el préstamo le ayudara a realizar su sueño de seguir trabajando mientras pueda, con las ganancias que le genera el negocio va ir pagando la cuota y ahorrando para futuras compras.
texts.en:
Berta is 54 years old and didn't have the opportunity to go to school. But if she had a full education like the others, she could have kept up. Her husband died 5 years ago, and her children are already mature and work and help out their mother. She also has a grandson that lives with her. 

She is a housewife and has taken care of the household chores her entire life. In the times when she grew up, it was essential to learn the upkeep of a household, which is why her mother taught her everything she would need in order to improve her life. She also cares for 4 cows that she owns. She is a very hardworking woman, and despite having been left a widow, she does not get discouraged and continues fighting to move forward. 

She is charged with the care of her cattle, and the work day begins from the moment she gets up, until 1 in the afternoon, when she leads them over one kilometer away to drink from the river. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of a calf, and the improvement will be the opportunity to work with her livestock and eventually selling them for a good price. Through this, she will be able to have her own income to invest, and will no longer have to borrow from her neighbors. 

Her dreams are to continue working, fighting for a better life, and remaining in good health. She hopes that her children will value what they have accomplished. The loan will help her realize her dream of continuing to work while she still can. With the earnings this business generates, she will be able to repay this loan and save for future purchases.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Luis Horacio

texts.es:
Luis es un emprendedor joven de 19 años que se dio cuenta que la única forma de progresar es siendo independiente y manejar sus propios ingresos, por esta razón ha decidido alternar su trabajo en la administración de la farmacia de su familia con la venta de helados que realiza en la misma.
Hasta ahora apenas está iniciando pero se siente muy motivado con su proyecto.
El solicita dinero para comprar surtido en helados de diferentes tipos, así lograra obtener algunos ingresos extra y pagar sus estudios universitarios, además de su manutención.
Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio en el que pueda ser su propio jefe y manejar sus horarios, pues afirma que así puede tener tiempo de dedicarle a su familia.
Quiere aprovechar la oportunidad que le ofrece su familia pues en la farmacia en la que ofrece sus helados no debe pagar arriendo, así que sus ganancias aumentaran.
texts.en:
Luis is an entrepreneurial 19 year-old who realizes that the only way to progress is to be independent and manage his own wages. For this reason, he has decided to alternate his work in management of his family's pharmacy with the sale of frozen goods, which he can do on his own. So far, he has only just begun, but feels very motivated by this project. 

He is asking for money to purchase an assortment of frozen goods, so that he might obtain extra income and pay for his studies at university and support this project. 

His major wish is to have a store in which he can be his own boss and manage his schedule, so that he can have time to devote to his family. 

Luis wants to take advantage of this opportunity that is being offered to him by his family. He will not have to pay rent to sell the frozen goods in his parent's pharmacy, so this can increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of frozen goods to sell.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es un señor de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, sector conocido en el país por ser la ciudad que une a la sierra y a la costa. Cuenta con un clima muy agradable y se caracteriza también por ser una zona muy comercial y productiva.
Luis Fernando tiene una hijita, quien vive con su madre; él siempre está pendiente de su pequeña, tiene dos años y medio y aun no estudia.
Luis Fernando es un señor muy trabajador, desde hace 2 años y medio cuenta con una carpintería, donde todos los días trabaja y elabora puertas y monturas, él entrega a clientes fijos que cuentan con negocios de ventas de estos productos. Luis Fernando es muy dedicado a su trabajo, lo realiza con mucho amor por esos sus puertas y demás son bien realizados. También se dedica a la topografía, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre y lo realiza cuando sus clientes lo necesitan.
Luis es cliente fiel de Fundación Alternativa, ha trabajado con la institución por su servicio. Ahora nuevamente Luis necesita de un crédito, con el que comprará dos máquinas para el negocio, una sierra de motor grande y otra circular muy necesarias para su trabajo diario.
Luis agradece enormemente a la institución y a Kiva por permitir que la gente crezca en su negocio con estos créditos que los ayudan a superarse.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is a 35 years old man; he lives in the town of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, an area well renowned in the country for being a place where the mountains meet the coast. The weather there is very nice, and the area is also characterized by its deeply business and productive nature.
Luis Fernando has a young daughter, who lives with her mother; he greatly cares for his little child, who is two years old and does not go to school.
Luis Fernando is a hardworking man, and he has been running a carpenter’s shop for 2 and a half years. He works there every day, creating doors and frames he sells to established customers who, in turn, are wholesalers for the same kind of products. Luis Fernando is deeply engaged in his job, working with deep love for what he does, and for this reason, his doors and other products are a success. Having also learned how to be a topographer from his father, he sometimes also engages in this activity, when his clients require it.
Luis is a faithful customer of Fundación Alternativa, having worked with the institution for its services. Now Luis is asking for another loan that he will use to buy machines he requires for his shop: a big chainsaw and a circular saw, tools that he really needs for this daily activity.
Luis is deeply grateful to the institution and to Kiva for making it possible for people to make their activities grow thanks to the loans that help them excel.

loans.use: To buy two saws for his carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Flor  Esther

texts.es:
Flor Esther es mamá de dos hijas, un día inesperado le llamo la atención estudiar Atención Integral A La Primera Infancia porque ella quería trabajar cerca de la casa para estar más pendiente de las niñas, a ella le tocaba trabajar muy lejos de la casa y le lleva mucho tiempo, le toco muy duro estudiar por que trabajaba en el día y estudiaba de noche, ha tenido que dejar mucho tiempo dejando solas las niñas, aunque no fue posible el trabajo cerca de la casa ella sigue intentándolo porque el sueño de ella es poder trabajar más cerca de la casa.
Ella a futuro será capaz de liderar un grupo de estudiantes donde se le reflejaran todos los esfuerzos, además le ha gustado esta carrera porque dice que tiene mucha vocación  para  estimular los niños hacia un futuro mejor e inculcarle buenos valores, porque los niños  serán el futuro. 
Ojala todas las personas como ellas tengan esa vocación para el trato hacia la población infantil que son los más vulnerables del todo el mundo, ella quiere tener una oportunidad para poder ofrecer lo que ella ha aprendido por medio de la educación que ha recibido. 
Ella solicita el convenio de kiva porque quiere cumplir con todas las metas que tiene en la vida, pero al situación económica es un poco desfavorable en este momento así que ella no quiere abandonar esta oportunidad tan grande que tiene.
texts.en:
Flor Esther has two daughters and one day decided to study Early Childhood Integral Education. After having worked very far from home, she wanted to be closer and take care of the girls. She had to work hard because she had a job during the day and studied at night, having to leave her daughters alone many times. Although she has not found a job close to home yet, she keeps fighting for her dream. 

She will be able to lead a group of students in the future, which will prove that her hard work was worth it. Moreover, she has enjoyed the program as she has a strong vocation of leading children towards a better future and good values. She wishes that everyone had that same vocation as children are the most vulnerable of all. She is willing to offer what she has learned. 

She is requesting a loan through Kiva because, although she wants to reach her life goals, her financial situation is unfavorable right now. She does not want to lose this big opportunity.

loans.use: to pay tuition for one semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Sarsawathi Swasahaya Sangh - Mugalkhoda Group

texts.en:
Shalavva, 53, lives in Mugalkhoda village in Raibag, Belgaum. She is a widow and mother of four children. Two of her daughters are married while the youngest daughter has discontinued her studies and takes care of the house. Her son is working as a mason. Shalavva lost her husband due to a severe heart attack five years back. Her son had to drop out of school after 5th grade. He was deprived of his childhood and was forced to engage in economic activity on a full-time basis to share his mother’s responsibilities. 

Shalavva is daily wage worker in the agriculture fields and runs a goat-rearing farm in which she has around 20 years of experience. She usually purchases a one- or two-month-old kid and rears it until it is one year old. She then sells it at the time of village festivals or Bakrid, as there is always a good demand for goats. She earns around INR 9,000 per month. 

Shalavva now wants to expand her farm and buy a few more goats for which she is seeking a loan of INR 5,000. She wants to help her son to start his own construction work. She is also saving some money for her youngest daughter’s marriage.

Shalavva (who is standing with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of Saraswati Swasahaya Sangh Self-Help Group (SHG). “Saraswati” means the goddess for education. The other 12 members also need loans for different purposes like animal husbandry, tailoring, a coconut business and a beef business. They all want to save enough for their children’s education and for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Yellamma Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh -Sankeshiwar Group

texts.en:
The Self-Help Group Yellamma Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh of “MASS” is located in Sankeshiwar village, Belgaum. The group consists of seven hardworking women. The all women are former devadasis, which means servants of God. The practice was prevalent in India wherein women were married to a deity/temple at a very young age. The situation of these devadasis is challenging and illiteracy, unemployment, and poverty are common attributes associated with them. Although the system was abolished in 1988, the condition remains appalling.

These women work as laborers in the agriculture fields. All are requesting loans for different purposes like centering work, animal husbandry, vegetable vending and a petty shop
. 
Mahadevi, 45, (her face is circled in the picture) presides over the group. She is living with her son who is working at TMC water supply. Both her daughters are married and well settled. Mahadevi runs a petty shop in her house and has been in this business for last 20 years. She wants to expand her shop by adding additional items and buying food grain, cold drinks and other grocery products in bulk. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of INR 20,000. She hopes this will attract new consumers.

loans.use: to buy food grains, cold drinks and other grocery products

loans.name: Rashna

texts.en:
Rashna is a 47-year-old energetic and purposeful woman from the remote village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  Her husband Majijul, 57,  is engaged in a small business. They are uneducated and can only sign their names.  It is their bad luck that they did not get a chance for further education due to their parents' poor financial resources. But they dream of providing a higher education to all their children.  Now they are in grades 11, 9, and 8, respectively. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

Rashna’s husband is a small businessman. His income is not sufficient to maintain all the costs of such a big family. Rashna wants to bring more stability to her family.  So she started an animal husbandry business five years back. She has only one milking cow and two goats.  She sells the milk to her neighbors who are her main customers and somehow manages the household expenses. Now she wants to expand her business.

She heard that Kiva’s partner BJS gives loan to rural woman for business and she has taken a loan. She plans to purchase one more cow to increase her milk business.

The loan will help her to improve her standard of living and to provide better education and health to her children.

Her full thanks go to both the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad hails from Bagmari village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. His wife takes care of the house. He is the father of two sons and a daughter. They are a big family; his parents and brother’s family also stay with him. 

Shamshad runs a grocery shop in his village. The shop consists of daily consumable products, such as rice, pulses, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, nuts, ghee, gram, spices, etc. He earns approximately INR 5,000 per month. He also works as an agent for two other companies and earns INR 3,500 per month. They also have a poultry farm, which is managed by his brother. 

Shamshad aims to improve his grocery store, for which he is requesting a loan of INR 15,000 to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to add to his inventory. This is his second loan from the local NGO, “MESP”. He invested the first loan also in the same shop, and made a good profit and repaid the loan successfully.

Shamshad believes that the more items displayed at the store, the better, as it will result in more sales. Since Shamshad is the only earning member in the family, he hopes the additional income from the business will definitely help him sustain his family.  

Shamshad hopes that his business continues to flourish and also that all three children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Sefali

texts.en:
Sefali is a young woman of only 29 years.  She is married, a housewife, and a mother of one son and one daughter. She is still very energetic, hardworking and optimistic.  Her husband Rabindra, age 28, cultivates their own land, which he received from his ancestors.  They live in Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is very much concerned about providing her children with an education. They are in grades nine and five, respectively.

Sefali's husband has always worked in agriculture, which he learned from his father.  He is the only earning member in the family and always strives for the betterment of his family. Sefali, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. They mainly cultivate seasonal vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  But it is very difficult for them to run a family of four members in a decent way with such a small income. They thought of expanding their business and cultivating jute, which is a profitable crop.  They cannot fulfill their dream due to a lack of capital.

Sefali has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase jute seeds and other necessary farm supplies related to cultivation. She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will provide them with more profit to give her family financial stability.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers and  farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products, such as sugar, rice, oils and others.

loans.name: Ghulam Fareed

texts.en:
Ghulam Fareed is 30 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for many years near his house and operating the business very well. In this way, he is feeding his old parents and sibling.

He has been running a general store for five years; he established a general store with the help of some capital. His shop is situated under a populated area, and here, a lot of consumers are available to buy miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable for daily usage. He wants to offer course books and stationery items such as copies, pencils, pens, lead pencils, and erasers. But the major problem is the shortage of funds. 

Therefore, Ghulam Fareed has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy course books and stationery items such as copies, pencils, pens, lead pencils, and erasers, along with sacks of rice, sugar, flour and miscellaneous stationery items. He is very glad after receiving this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

Ghulam Fareed is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy course books and stationery items such as copies, pencils, pens, lead pencils, and erasers.

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en:
Lazarus lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Lazarus is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now, and they are currently growing maize and trees and rearing livestock on their farm. Lazarus is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Lazarus’ first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family’s needs. Lazarus’ hope for the future is to live a comfortable life in his old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella se dedica a la venta de miel y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas miel. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Maria belongs to the communal bank "Qory Chaska," part of UMF Arariwa, and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru. She has been selling honey for several years and is doing very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more honey. Maria is grateful for the loan granted to her and she agrees to repay her dues.

loans.use: to buy honey.

loans.name: Taaj

texts.en:
Taaj, a 43-year-old woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband, who has been working in the press for many years, has the responsibility of meeting the needs of the family. Taaj provides sewing services, earning income that augments her husband's efforts.
