Taaj has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of goods for her business: needles, threads, pieces of cloth, a sewing machine, etc  The loan will help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Taaj is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing accessories for her business.

loans.name: Eglay

texts.en:
Eglay lives in Kakamega. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Eglay is married and has six children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twelve years now and they are currently growing maize and bananas. They also practice dairy and poultry farming and beekeeping. Eglay is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income and provide her with honey for both food and medicine.

This is Eglay's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Eglay's hope for the future is to live a comfortable life and own her own car.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado debido a los gastos económicos que se generaban en su familia no pudo continuar sus estudios, está acompañada su esposo trabaja de policía, tiene un hijo de 9 años y estudia tercer grado, ella y su esposo sostienen los gastos económicos de su vivienda incluyendo el estudio de su hijo.

Rosa se dedica a atender un pequeño negocio de venta de antojitos típicos y una tienda que gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo han logrado sostener, también se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa y a cuidar de su hijo cuando regresa de la escuela. Los antojitos los vende en la cafetería de la escuela de su comunidad todos los días y la tienda está ubicada en su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar papas, zanahorias, carne, maíz, condimentos, aceite, para la elaboración de antojitos y productos de la canasta básica para la tienda, y poder  darle sostenimiento a su hogar y poder cubrir los estudios de su hijo.

Rosa siempre ha querido ampliar su negocio para poder de allí asegurar su futuro, poder darse una mejor vida y darle a su hijo estudios universitarios, para que pueda tener una mejor vida, y gracias al otorgamiento del crédito siente ella que es una gran oportunidad para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 42-year old woman who studied up to fifth grade. Due to her family financial limitations, she could not continue her studies. She lives with her husband, who works as a policeman, and their 9-year old son, who attends third grade. She and her husband contribute to household expenses, including his son's tuition. 

Rosa works in a small business selling traditional food products that she and her husband have been able to sustain. She also does household tasks at home and takes care of their son when he is not at school. She sells her products in the school's cafeteria everyday and the store is located in their house. 

She is requesting a loan to Credicampo and plans to use it to buy potatoes, carrots, meat, corn, condiments and oil to make traditional bites and basic products for the store. She expects to cover household expenses and tuition for his son. Rosa has always wanted to expand the business and guarantee a better future. She would like to provide his son with college education so that he can have a better life and thinks that this loan is a great opportunity for her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, meat, corn, condiments and oil to make traditional bites and basic products for her store.

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es: Gaston vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa, él se dedica a la revelar fotografías y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar papel fotográfico. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gaston lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, in the South of Perú. He is a member of the communal bak of "Qory Chaska" of the UMF Arariwa and works developing photographs. He has worked in this business for several years and things are going well. 

He is requesting a loan to buy photographic paper. He is grateful for the financial support and commits to repay as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy photographic paper.

loans.name: Mayra Mirtala

texts.es:
Mayra de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, por sus condiciones económicas no pudo seguir estudiando  en la universidad, está acompañada su esposo se dedica a trabajar en un ciber,  tienen 2 hijos los cuales tienen las edades de 1 y 2 años y que son las únicas personas que dependen de ellos dos. 
  
Mayra trabaja de secretaria en una alcaldía, comenta que se siente muy bien con su trabajo, desde hace cinco años tiene este empleo, debido a su situación económica decidió trabajar de secretaria, y comenta que para desplazarse a su trabajo tiene que recorrer 1 hora  en bus para estar puntual a las 7:00 hora que entra a su trabajo y sale a las 3:30 p.m, lo cual se le hace difícil para llegar a su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 200 bloques, 10 bolsas de cemento y dos quintales de hierro, la mano de obra se la hace su papá, todo esto le ayudara a reparar su vivienda que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado;  es por esta razón que desea repararla aunque ella en un fututo quiere tener su propia vivienda, para estar mejor con su esposo e hijos, y también para seguir con sus estudios universitarios.

Mayra siempre ha querido tener su propia casa, y también seguir estudiando en la universidad y poder obtener una carrera para ganarse mejor la vida, también quiere darles el mejor estudio a sus hijos, y gracias al otorgamiento del crédito podrá realizar sus planes y poder solicitar más créditos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 20-year old woman who studied up to high-school. Due to the lack of resources, she could not attend college. She lives with her husband, who works in an internet café, and their two children, aged 1 and 2. Mayra works as assistant in a mayor's office. She has had this job for five years and feels good about it. She decided to work as an assistant due to her financial situation and currently needs to travel by bus for an hour every day to arrive at 7am. She works until 3.30pm and then finds it difficult to arrive home. 

She is requesting a loan to Credicampo to buy 200 blocks, 10 bags of cement and 2 quintals (200 kg) of iron. His father will do the necessary repairs at home. Their house has deteriorated over time, which is why she wants to make improvements and provide his husband and children with better life conditions. She also would like to continue with her college studies. 

Mayra has always wanted to have her own house and to attend university. She also wants to give the best study opportunities to her children. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to make plans and request additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy 200 blocks, 10 bags of cement and 2 quintals (200 kg) of iron. His father will do the necessary repairs in their house, which has deteriorated over time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda pop and fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia, a 35-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, is a responsible mother of three daughters. Her husband has been working as a laborer for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members and managing the entire household.

Sobia's husband wants to purchase a new plaster machine for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy it. Therefore Sobia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help with this purchase. 

Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To buy a new plaster machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca de 69 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir sus padres pasaban una dura crisis económica en el tiempo que ella era pequeña, por eso no la pusieron a estudiar en la escuela, ella es viuda, logro procrear 4 hijos con su esposo que ya están mayores y casados dos de ellos están fuera del país trabajando, en su vivienda solo vive con una hija y tres nietos y son las únicas personas que dependen de ella.

Francisca, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, comenta que desde pequeña se dedica a esta actividad gracias a que su madre le enseño este oficio, ella logro crecer a sus cuatro hijos y que hoy en día se siente orgullosa de realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y cuidar de sus nietos.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para consolidar deudas,  gastos en su casa para su diario vivir, y poder comprar una plancha, para  poner su negocio de tortilla y pupusas.

Francisca siempre ha querido tener su propio negocio, para de allí darse los gastos necesarios, poder tener una mejor vida , y gracias al otorgamiento del crédito podrá hacer realidad su negocio y poder incentivarse para poder solicitar otros créditos a futuro.
texts.en:
Francisca is 69 years old. She doesn't know how to read or write. Her parents experienced extreme economic hardship when she was a child, so they didn't put her in school to study. She is a widow, has 4 grown and married children, two of whom work outside of the country. In her home live a daughter and three grandchildren and these are the only people who are dependent upon her. Francisca works as a domestic employee. She says that since she was little she has worked in this field thanks to her mother who taught her this job. She was able to raise her 4 children and today is proud of her work and to take care of her grandchildren.

The loan she seeks will be used to consolidate debts, to pay for daily living expenses, be able to buy an iron, and to invest in her tortilla and puposa business. Francisca has always wanted to have her own business in order to be able to pay her own bills, be able to have a better quality of life, and thanks to the granting of the loan she will make her own business a reality and be able to work toward future loans to grow her business.

loans.use: to consolidate debts, to pay for daily living expenses, be able to buy an iron, and to invest in her tortilla and puposa business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help the coffee crops in this new growing season.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 28-year-old woman and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a small hotel in the local market. He sells different types of foods, cold drinks and tea. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Asma's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables, meat and chicken in bulk quantities as well as other items for his business so that he can provide quality and delicious food to his customers, and improve his sales growth to earn a maximum profitable income. But due to his unfavorable financial position he is unable to purchase these items for his business. Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for her husband's business. Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of vegetables and food stuff for her husband's hotel business.

loans.name: Fátima Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fátima de 23 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado,  está acompañada y madre de tres hijos; su esposo trabaja como pescador artesanal,  y la actividad que ella realiza es la elaboración y venta de tortillas  y a la venta de cosméticos por revistas es  de donde tiene ingresos para ella y su hijos.

Fátima se dedica a la venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en dicha actividad la cual aprendió de su madre; dado a la pobreza de sus padres no pudo estudiar, por lo tanto no pudo optar a otra actividad junto a su madre mientras su padre se dedica a la pesca y agricultura actividad que realizan a pocos metros de su casa, además los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pupusas.                                 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 10 quintales de maíz para guardarlos para su negocio, 5 láminas para mejorar su casa, espera que gracias al crédito podrá tener  mejores ingresos a su familia y poder cancelar el crédito con la ganancia cubrir algunos gastos de su familia 
    
Fátima menciona que sus sueños son tener una vivienda digna y poderle dar la educación que ella no tuvo a su pequeños hijos quiera que Dios le de vida y salud
texts.en:
Fátima is a 23-year old woman who studied up to sixth grade. She lives with her husband and has three children. Her husband works as a fisherman while she makes and sells tortillas and also sells cosmetics by catalog. This is how they obtain income for the family. Fátima has been selling tortillas for 6 years, so she has extensive experience in this activity that she learned from her mother. Due to lack of resources she could not study and did not have other options besides helping her mother. Her father works in fishing and agriculture close to home. Additionally, he sells stuffed tortillas on weekends. 

She is requesting a loan to buy 10 quintals of corn for her business as well as 5 layers to make improvements to her house. She expects to increase the income for her family and to be able to cover household expenses and repay the loan. 

Fátima says that her dream is to have a decent house and to provide her children with the education that she could not have. She also wishes that God will give them good lives and health.

loans.use: to buy 10 quintals of corn for her business, as well as 5 layers to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María, relate que los efectos que tiene al hacer uso de créditos para fortalecer sus actividades económicas son muy positivos, por que compra por mayoreo y su margen de ganancia aumenta, lo que le da el respaldo para cumplir con sus cuotas en las fechas que corresponden, su familia se encuentra saludable brindándole apoya para continuar trabajando.
El capital que requiere María lo utilizara para comprar ropa, maíz, aceite, pollo, condimentos, aderezos, bebidas, papas, tomates, leña, gas propano, para seguir elaborando los tamales y pupusas que tanto demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
María says that the result of the loan of strengthening her economic activities are very positive because she buys at wholesale and increases her profit margins  which gives allows her to fulfill her monthly payments. Her family is healthy and provides support to continue working. 

The capital Maria is requesting will be used to purchase clothing, corn, oil, chicken, condiments, seasonings, beverages, potatoes, tomatoes, firewood, and propane gas to continue making tamales and "pupusas" (traditional Salvadoran dish--thick, hand-made corn tortillas) which is highly requested by her clients.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, corn, oil, chicken, condiments, seasonings, beverages, potatoes, tomatoes, firewood, and propane gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reupholster her motorbike taxi and  purchase 2 tires.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es: Vanesa pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella se dedica a la venta de producto de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, leche, fideos, atunes, azúcar, pan, galletas, refrescos, gaseosas, dulces y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Vanesa belongs to the communal bank "Qory Chaska" in the UMF Arariwa group. She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru. She sells basic groceries such as rice, noodles, tuna, sugar, bread, cookies, soda pop, beverages, candy, etc. She has had this business for a few years and it is going quite well. Today she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of sugar and rice. She is thankful for the granted loan and promises to make her payments on the established payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her eight children. Her husband has been working as a tailor for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family and managing the entire household. Tahira's husband needs different kinds of tailoring accessories e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloths, machine, etc for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase them. Therefore Tahira has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to purchase the above accessories and will also helpful for him to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tailoring accessories for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Yasmin's Group

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 40-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a widow and the mother of six children. One of her sons is a designer and the other son is engaged in sewing services. Both of her sons manage the household. Yasmin's brother has to pay monthly instalments for his new taxi. She wants to help her brother to make these payments. She has therefore applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will provide financial assistance to her brother so that he can pay the instalments for his new taxi.
Yasmin is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: to pay the instalments for her brother's taxi.

loans.name: Ana Adela

texts.es:
Ana de 29 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado,  está casada,  es madre de dos hijos,  su esposo trabaja como fotógrafo, y la actividad que ella realiza es la venta de verduras  y tamales actividad que realiza en la misma comunidad donde vive y es  de donde tiene ingresos para ella y sus hijos.

Dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años,  por lo que tiene mucha experiencia y lo aprendió de sus padres dado al índice de pobreza de sus padres no pudo estudiar, por lo tanto no pudo optar a otra actividad por lo que tuvo que dedicarse a las ventas ambulantes junto a sus padres,  actividad que realizan a pocos metros de su casa además los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de antojitos (nuégados, enchiladas y tostadas)                            

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar, yuca, plátanos, maíz, y surtir la venta de verduras. Espera que gracias al crédito pueda tener  mejores ingresos a su familia y poder cancelar el crédito con la ganancia cubrir algunos gastos de su familia.
    
Ana manifiesta que sus sueños son tener una vivienda digna y poderle dar la educación que ella no tuvo a sus pequeños hijos quiera que Dios le de vida y salud para poderlo lograr.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old, completed through the 6th grade, is married, mother of two children, and her husband works as a photographer. She sells vegetables and tamales, something she has done in the same community where she lives and earns an income for her and her children. She has been selling for 10 years, so she has a lot of experience. She learned this business from her parents, as they were very poor and couldn't send her to school, so she had no other option but to work as a street vendor along with her parents. She works only a few meters from her house. In addition on the weekends she sells snacks ((nuégados, enchiladas and tostadas).

The loan she seeks from CREDICAMPO is to buy yuca, bananas, corn, and vegetables to stock her business. She hopes that thanks to this loan she can have better income for her family and be able to repay the loan with the earnings while covering some of her family's expenses. Ana shares that her dreams are to have a dignified home and be able to provide an education to her children, something she didn't have, and she wants God to give her life and health in order to be successful.

loans.use: to buy yuca, bananas, corn and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila is a 31-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son. Her husband has been working in a private sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his family. Naila also provides sewing services and contributes the income, along with her husband, to manage the household. She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine accessories, etc for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. She has therefore applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Naila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of sewing accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 35 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband has been working as a wood carpenter for twelve years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Gulshan's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other tools for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy them. Therefore Gulshan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of family and business. Gulshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk for her husband's wood factory.

loans.name: Zoreen

texts.en:
Zoreen, a responsible mother of three sons, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. One of her sons, who has been providing taxi services for many years and is  responsible for the needs of the entire family, badly needs maintenance on his vehicle.  Zoreen has therefore applied for a loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for this purpose.

The maintenance will enable Zoreen's son to provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Zoreen also plans to save profit from her son's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Zoreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's taxi repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction materials like blocks, cement, sand, bars, zinc, purlins, transportation and labor costs.

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es:
Sara Patricia es una persona  con valores y virtudes, está  estudiando salud oral es una persona que a luchado por los sueños  y lo único  que desea es terminar los estudios, graduarse y ser una profesional,   para brindar un buen servicio y dar a conocer los conocimientos y para  poder  cumplir con todas las metas propuestas.
Ella quiere terminar los estudios y en 5 años  ser una profesional en  cirugía  en salud oral, para tener  una estabilidad  económica  y poder  ayudar  a la  familia  y brindarle una estabilidad, quiero tener  la casa propia.  
Ella necesita el convenio Para terminar los estudios y porque es un beneficio bueno para lograr los sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sara Patricia is an individual with values and virtue. She is studying oral health and she is fighting to see her dreams come true. Her only desire is to see her studies through to the end, graduate, and have a career so she can provide a quality service and share her knowledge and to be able to meet all the goals set before her.
She wants to finish her studies and in 5 years be an oral surgeon, to have economic stability and to be able to help her family and give them stability as well, she also wants her own home. 
She needs the loan in order to finish her studies and because it is always a beautiful thing to see someone's goals and aspirations come true.

loans.use: pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: José Bertilio

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta 5 grado , está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a la recolección de conchas o  curieles mientras sus hijos están en la escuela, una actividad que realiza desde varios años, por lo que también contribuye a  los gastos del familiar.

José se dedica a la pesca artesanal actividad que realiza desde que tenía doce años, el cual lo aprendido  de sus padres, ya que en la zona es la actividad  a la que se pueden dedicar  y lo hace junto a su esposa y en los ratos libres de sus hijos le ayudan  también .

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un equipo de pesca y mejorar el que ya tiene, gracias al crédito podrá tener un mejor equipo y sentirse más seguro a la hora de la pescar  y además podrá tener más ingresos  para su familia.

El cliente manifiesta que en un futuro planea construir una vivienda digna en un lugar propio y poder preparar académicamente  a sus  hijos. También manifestó que  solo con los créditos  lo lograra y con las ganancias de su negocio y el esfuerzo que él ponga.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and completed through 5th grade in school. He is married and his wife collects shells while their children are in school, work she has done for a few years as it also contributes to meeting the family expenses. José is a traditional fisherman, a job he has had since he was 12 years old. He learned this trade from his parents, as in this area of the country it is a profession one can practice. He works along side his wife and his children help in their free time.

The loan he seeks is to buy fishing equipment and improve the equipment he has. Thanks to the loan he will be able to improve his equipment and fee safer when fishing. In addition he will be able to have more income for his family. José says that in the future he plans to build a home on land of their own and be able to send their children to school. He also says that only with the loans will he be able to do this, with the earnings from his business and the efforts he puts forth.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and improve current equipment

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working in a private sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Farzana also provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, a machine, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva group loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of sewing accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: José Cristobal

texts.es:
José de 63 años de edad, no pudo estudiar dada  la pobreza de sus padres,  ya que desde muy joven se dedicó al jornal y actividades agrícolas,  es viudo padre de dos hijos,  una de ellos estudia;  mientras que  el otro le ayuda a las actividades agrícolas.

José se dedica a la agricultura actividad que realiza desde hace unos 40 años, el cual lo aprendió de sus padres  y también se dedica a la pesca artesanal, viaja en una bicicleta una distancia de 1kilometro hasta donde realiza su trabajo en horario 6:00 am a 11:00 am y lo realiza junto a su hijo

El préstamo que esta solicitando,  es para comprar  semilla, abono,  fungicidas y el pago del alquiler de la tierra, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados  de maíz. Gracias al préstamo podrá  beneficiar su cultivo de maíz donde espera tener una buena producción y mejores ganancias y así poder pagar los estudios de su hija y cubrir los gastos del hogar.
 
José  sueña  salir de la pobreza y poder cultivar más , poder sacar adelante a su hija con el estudio y poder tener un mejor futuro para su pequeña familia, pues espera lograrlo gracias al esfuerzo y a los financiamientos crediticios.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old. He couldn't study because his parents were poor and so he has worked as a day laborer and in agriculture since he was young. He is a widower and the father of two children: one of them goes to school while the other works in agriculture. 

José has been working in agriculture for close to 40 years; he learned from his parents. He also fishes. He travels by bike for 1 kilometer to work where he stays from 6am to 11am and works alongside his son. 


The loan he is asking for will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fungicides and to pay rent on the land so he can cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn. Thanks to the loan, his crop will benefit and he will have a better production as well as higher earnings and to be able to pay for his daughter's schooling and cover household costs. 
 

José dreams of leaving poverty and growing even more corn, to help his daughter with her schooling and to be able to give a better future to his small family. He hopes to do so through hard work and micro-credit loans.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fungicides.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is a very sincere, hardworking and optimistic woman.  She is from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is 25 years old and married to Rahibul, who is a 26-year-old farmer.  They have two school-going children; one is in grade one and the other is in grade six.  Merina has an education up to grade eight, whereas her husband is illiterate.  They live in their own kaccha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).

Merina's husband is a humble and hardworking person who grows different kinds of vegetables.  He began to involve himself in farm work, in the company of his parents, since it was the only option they had to earn a living.

The harvest he collects is sold in the region's market but he cannot earn sufficient income from his present business to pay the family expenses and feed his wife and two children. So, they have decided to cultivate jute on their farmland, which is a profitable crop.

The loan Merina is requesting from Kiva’s partner BJS will help to strengthen her business, since with the loan, she will buy agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers that her husband needs to cultivate the crop and obtain a much more productive harvest to increase profits. She hopes that the profit from this business will give them a guarantee of economic stability for the family and a better education for her children. She also wants to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Silvana Yajaira

texts.es: Sivana vive con sus padres y a sus 21 años a demostrado que  es una chica muy emprendedora ella  se a dedicado desde hace 4 años  a la  agricultura y la crianza de chanchos  los cuales a lo largo de tiempos se han convertido en el sustento principal de sus ingresos, tambien se dedica a dos dias en semana a dictar cleses de manualidades a niños dela escuela, algo que siempre a sobresalido en ella es la buena voluntad y solidaridad que tiene hacia los demás se ha caracterizado por ser una chica muy activa, y de muy buen carácter ,este es el primer credito que ha solicitado  en Fodemi, y lo ha  decidido destinarlos  a comprar chanchos para  incrementar en su pequeño negocio, su anhelo mas grande en la vida es poder costearse sus estudios sobre manualidades dirigidos a niños que es lo que le gusta mucho hacer.
texts.en: Sivana lives with her parents and in her 21 years has proven that she is an enterprising young woman. She has been making a living in agriculture and raising pigs for four years. Over time it has turned into her principal source of income. She also takes time every day to give classes in handcrafts to girls in school, something she is very good at and that shows her good character and solidarity with the community. She is known as a very active young woman of good character and this is the first loan she is asking for through Fodemi. She will use the loan to purchase pigs in order to grow her small business. Her biggest dream is to be able to finance handcrafts classes for children, because this is what she truly enjoys doing.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Ayisati

texts.en:
Ayisati is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Ayisati has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, salt, rice and cooking oil.

To help expand her business, Ayisati has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, soap, salt, rice and cooking oil, and will help Ayisati to generate greater profits and high profits. Ayisati hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house.

Ayisati is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ayisati who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, salt, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ice cream and beverages at wholesale.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es: María es una mujer esforzada, madre soltera con 2 hijos a quienes apoya en su Desarrollo, labora en una empresa de la zona donde habita, con 5 años continuo de labor, esta señora tiene una necesidad inmediata de mejorar su vivienda por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la    Compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlin, cemento, arena y mano de obra, con el que mejoraría su techo y pared las que tiene en mal estado, de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: María is a dedicated single mother of 2 children who she supports. She works in a business in her neighborhood, and has worked there for 5 years. She has an immediate need to improve her home so she visited Ceprodel to seek financing that she will use to buy construction materials such as metal laminate, lumber, cement, sand and labor, with which she will improve her roof and wall that are in disrepair. In this way she will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as metal laminate, lumber, cement, sand and labor.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures. For additional income, she also has a water retailing business.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Criselda hopes to expand her business and have her own stall. She dreams that her children will have a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business.

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
Sumita lives in Promodnagar in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 28 years old and married. She has two children (one son and one daughter); both are students, of grade one and grade three respectively. They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw). Sumita is a housewife and illiterate; she can sign her name only. Her husband, who is a farmer, received only primary education.

Sumita's husband operates a farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. His parents taught him to farm many years ago, but they didn't have resources to help him financially. He grew his business by his own determination and hard work. His wife Sumita, though a housewife, helps to sell the produce in the local market. He is the only breadwinner for the family. Now his greatest challenge is the family needs. He can't earn sufficient money to run his family smoothly.

Sumita is a determined and enterprising woman who wants her husband to improve his business and go ahead. So, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they could cultivate a new product for additional income.  She plans to start cultivation of bitter gourd, and she will utilize the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Her future goal is to grow more plants and have a bigger harvest. She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and necessary farm supplies for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati A Group

texts.en:
Maa Saraswati Self Help Group was formed in the year 2014 by 10 poor active women entrepreneurs. This group is located in a rural village named Khaira in the Balangir district of Odisha, India. This group consists of 10 women members in the below poverty line category and Nurabati is one of them. The lady standing in middle in the photo with her hand raised is Nurabati. She is 32 years and the leader of this SHG. 

Nurabati is running a vegetable vending business. Apart from this, she also procures paddy from the cultivators. Her husband helps her in these trades. Nurabati manages the in-house activities of the business and her husband looks after the supply of vegetables and procures paddy in the weekly markets. From these businesses, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR. According to Nurabati, in the context of the present market situation this income is hand to mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of future development. Although there is a potential market for her business, finances were a hindrance for her. After the intervention of Mahashakti foundation in her village, she saw a ray of hope and motivated other women members to get a loan from Mahashakti Foundation by forming this group. With the present loan, she has plans to purchase more vegetable items and procure more paddy to get extra income. She hopes this will help her to generate more income to materialize her dream of giving a better education to her children and construct a house for her family. The other nine members of the group are also running small enterprises like a general shop, goat rearing, a tailoring center, a Tiffin stall, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and paddy

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past ten years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, bread, sodas, juice and other items.

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, bread, sodas, juice and other items, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to have more business outlets.

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hellen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, posho, beans, bread, sodas, juice and other items.

loans.name: Tamijan

texts.en:
Tamijan is 49 years old.  She is married to Safiar, 54 years old.  Both are raising three children (two sons and one daughter).  One of her sons works as a mason, the other is in college.  Their daughter is a student in grade 12.  Tamijan and her husband both are uneducated and can only sign their names. They live in the remote village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Tamijan's husband is associated with a small business, which does not provide enough income to lead a decent life.  Tamijan is also helping the family by running an animal husbandry business. She has a milking cow and she sells milk for many years.  She initiated her own business and bought a cow to support her family, at the time when her husband was struggling hard to cover the family expenses. With the passage of time, her sales and income increased.  She now has three goats in addition to the cow.  This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her hard work, she is respected in her family.  Now she wants to purchase one more cow for expanding her milk supply business, to strengthen their financial condition.

She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) for this purpose.  She hopes this will help her to get additional income, which will give more stability to her family.  She wants to build a concrete-made house for their family with the profit earned from this business.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Sahiban

texts.en:
Sahiban is a young lady of only 28 years.  She is married, a housewife and uneducated (can only sign her name) and lives with her husband Bablu, aged 27 years.  They are raising their two school-going children (one son and one daughter).  They are in grade 5 and 6 only.  They live in their own house in Baroghoria in the district Jalpaiguri.

Sahiban's husband is associated with the business of cultivation of vegetables in their farmland.   He learned to grow vegetables from a very young age by watching his parents. He gives his best effort to grow good vegetables to satisfy his customers and meet the family expenses.  When harvest time comes, Sahiban helps him. But he can't give sufficient financial sustenance with his small income.  So, they have decided to expand their business and cultivate pumpkins.

Sahiban is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and wants to start pumpkin cultivation. She hopes that this business will help her a lot, because with the earnings, she will be able to manage the household expenses.

Her dreams are to continue helping her husband by improving the business, to support her children in improving academically, and start a grocery shop with the profit from her business.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for giving their support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating pumpkins.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a 28-year-old woman who is from the small village Altagram in a remote region of Jalpaiguri district.  She is married and, together with her husband Mejaharul, aged 38 years, is raising two children (one daughter and one son). One is a student in grade 4 and the other is too young to go to school. Mamata studied up to grade 6 but her husband has an elementary education.

Mamata's husband is a cultivator and grows some green vegetables; the income from this business is not sufficient to meet their family's basic needs. So Mamata also runs an animal husbandry where she has one cow and two goats. She has been selling milk and milk products like butter, paneer (cottage cheese), and curd for the last five years. Her business is good enough to provide a decent life. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses.

Now she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase one more dairy cow.  She wants to increase her business by purchasing one more cow.  She hopes to increase her production capacity to satisfy her customers' demand as well as to generate more income to give financial stability to her family.

Mamata wants to go ahead with her business and purchase more cows and make a cattle herd to strengthen her business for the future security of her family. She is grateful to both the lenders ( BJS and Kiva.)

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for dairy business.

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana is 43 years old, married, a housewife and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). They live in their own small house in the village of Kamatpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives there with her children and husband, Montu, aged 50 years. Both husband and wife are uneducated and can only sign their names. Their children are students. One goes to college, and the other two are in grade 9 and 6.

Her husband is a small farmer who grows seasonal vegetables on their own farmland. They are facing so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate capital to successfully carry out his business activity and inadequate finances to educate their children and provide them with other basic necessities. His income from the agricultural activities is hardly sufficient for maintaining all the expenses of a five-member family. So, they have decided to cultivate jute on their farmland.  They have chosen this crop, as it has very good market demand.

Archana has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her husband. She will utilize the loan amount to buy jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for growing jute in their own field. It is a very demandable crop all over West Bengal. She holds a positive view of succeeding with this business.

With the additional profit from this business, she will be able to fulfill the basic necessities of her family and give higher education to her children. In the future, she dreams to buy a mini-tractor for their farmland with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for growing jute.

loans.name: Labika

texts.en:
Labika is a young and energetic lady from a rural area.  She is 20 years old and married to Narayan, age 26. She has two little children (one son and one daughter).  Labika has a primary education and her husband studied up to grade seven.  They live in their own kachha house (a house made of mud, bamboo and straw) in the small village of West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Labika's husband works as a daily laborer on daily wages under a mason.  He earns so little that it is hardly sufficient to manage the household expenses of their family. Five years ago, Labika began her own business of animal husbandry. She began her business with one cow.  Little by little during these five years, she has developed her business.  Now she has a milking cow and three goats. She sells the cow milk in her locality and feeds her goats for some months and sells the goats to the butchers in the local market.  Thus, she tries to help her husband financially.  Yet they are being deprived of having a good lifestyle.  So Labika is thinking of increasing her cattle to expand her business.

Labika is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a dairy cow for further developing her business.  Then she will be able to sell more milk and earn extra profit, as milk is in high demand in their locality. She plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of domestic cattle to save for her family's financial development and give a better education to her children.

She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with five of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his clinic, which also sells pharmaceuticals. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more pharmaceuticals, and will help Moses generate greater profits and expand his business. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to have more equipment to start a hospital. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Male region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Simon has been working hard to manage his pharmaceutical shop and clinic. 

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Simon generate greater profits and business expansion. Simon hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more equipment and create a hospital. 

Simon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Simon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is widowed with two children. She is a 49-year-old farmer who lives in the Philippines. She grows corn to earn a living. 

She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy 7 sacks of fertilizers.                                                                          

Modesta has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Modesta hopes to harvest more corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 35 years old, married with a happy family and residing at Brgy. Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a persistent and determined businesswoman who believes in life that money can be found in business. As she ventured into the business of buying rice grains and selling milled rice, she proved it. She also has a retail grocery store and supports it with her husband. Meanwhle, she has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2009.

Arceli is availing herself of the loan amount of PHP 30,000 for additional capital to finance buying rice grains and selling milled rice. She positively believes in improving her life, developing her income and progressing as a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to finance buying rice grains and selling milled rice

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald used the previous loan to pay workers for weeding his gardens. He maintains his agricultural business alongside his transportation and dairy farming businesses. He faces challenges of price fluctuation, poor roads, and limited market. However, he hopes to expand his business by buying land. Ronald needs a loan to repair his motorcycle that has broken down due to the bad roads.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 30-year-old housewife.  She is from the remote village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She lives there with her husband Nihar, 45, and only one son in their own kachha house (a house that is made of straw, mud and bamboo).  Both Saraswati and her husband are illiterate but they provided an education for their son and he is grown up now and earns his pocket money by doing private tuition with small children.

Saraswati's husband is engaged in a business making cane baskets.  He purchases canes from the local market and makes baskets with the help of his wife.  Together, they carry their products to the local market for sale.  This product has a great demand because the local people belong to the poor section and are mostly cultivators.  They use this product in various works. Now they want to expand their business but lack the capital.

Thus, Saraswati has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase necessary articles for their business.  They want to make more baskets to satisfy the customers'' demand.  This is the only source of income for the family, so they are trying their hardest to give their best effort to improve their business.  This will help them to earn more profit to run the family well.

Saraswati wants to go ahead with this business in order to give their family a secure future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her business

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Hoima Uganda and is 35 years old. She has a retail shop and earns additional income from sewing and tailoring. She has three children, all of whom attend school.

She dreams of constructing her own house, and requested this credit to buy exercise books, soap, and sugar to sell. Bad debts and limited capital are the main challenges she faces.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 25 years old. He is married and has two children. Mohammed has a secondary education and has a very good reputation both in his retail business and in his interpersonal relationships. 

In his business relationships, he is patient and hardworking. As the main source of income for his family, Mohammed started selling various kinds of goods and food in a small shop. He started this business many years ago with a small capital and a financial support from his father. Thanks to Mohammed's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The income from the business allowed Mohammed to expand his sales turnover.  

In order to develop his business, Mohammed turned to Microfinance Bank (AMB). He is requesting a loan of 500,000 YER to buy more of goods to increase his sales turnover. The earnings from the loan will help Mohammed to expand his business. The profits will also help him to raise and educate his children.

Mohammed hopes to open a wholesale store in addition to his retail store.

loans.use: To buy more of goods to increase his sales turnover

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver lives in Hoima Uganda. She is forty-five years old and sells maize, groundnuts, rice and beans and earns additional income from rentals. She has four school going children. She dreams of increasing her working capital. Competition and seasonal changes are challenges hindering her business. She is acquiring credit to buy maize, beans and groundnuts.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Mahabuli

texts.en:
Mahabuli lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in a rural village Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri.  Mahabuli is only 28 years old, young, energetic and hardworking. Her husband Saiful, aged 41 years, is a farmer by profession.  Both are illiterate but can sign their names only.  They could not get an education as their parents could not support them financially.  Two of their children go to school in grade 5 and 3; the third one is too young.

Mahabuli's husband has been associated with agricultural activities for a long time to give all the basic needs of the family.  He mainly grows potatoes, beans and chillis in his own farmland.  Though Mahabuli is a housewife, she contributes her effort to growing crops, doing cleaning work, harvesting the crop, spreading the manure, etc.  Thanks to their effort and determination, they somehow manage to cover their household expenses.

Now Mahabali is requesting a loan from BJS to start a jute business. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and manure to cultivate this crop. Her plans for the future are to have a large plantation of this crop.  She can then earn more and strengthen the inheritance that she will leave for her children. In addition to this, Mahabuli's priority is the education of her children.

She aspires to start a photo studio in future with the additional profit, which will be earned from this business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for fulfilling her dreams by giving her a loan.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and necessary ingredients for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en: Teodosia is 61 years old, married with two adult children.  She lives in Birayan, Rizal.  For the last 20 years, Teodosia has gardened, earning a monthly income of Php 4,000.  She joined Paglaum in 2008 and will use this loan to purchase bags of fertilizer.  The profit she earns in the business will be reinvested in Paglaum to save for retirement and use for daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Editha Aydee

texts.es:
Editha Aydee tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al transporte de carga y venta de bebidas de todo tipo actividad que realiza desde hace dos años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevo soles para la compra de una carpa más resistente para su moto y una segunda parte para terminar los acabados de su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Editha Aydee is 25 years old, lives with her husband and children in the district of Morropon, a community with a very hot climate, populated with people in agriculture, business and raising livestock, located in the province of the same name, which belongs to the region of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She transports goods and sells drinks of all kinds and has been doing this for two years.  She has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevo soles to buy a more durable tarp for her motorcycle as well as for putting the finishing touches on her home, in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy a durable cover for her vehicle and finish working on her house.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 35 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She has been in the butcher business for the past four years. Ann would like to expand her business and hence has borrowed a loan of KES.100,000 through which she will buy a refrigerator to stock meat and avoid the waste of throwing away stale food.

Ann currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES.70,000. She anticipates that through the expected profits she will buy many slaughter cows and repay for her loan. She successfully repaid all her previous loans. 

Ann hopes and dreams that in future she will be able to expand her business and become a successful woman.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and stock up on meat

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover the maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in supporting the education of her children and the family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and cover the maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to it with gratitude and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Luz hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family is always in good health.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship members in order to share stories of their lives and business.  She also draws strength from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop.

loans.name: Fhevie

texts.en:
This is Fhevie, 36, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Willie, a driver, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Fhevie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Fhevie dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kisinsima Abetereine Group

texts.en:
Noelibne is a dedicated woman who has been in the group for the last two cycles. She is a subsistence farmer who operates in a very rural area in the Western region of Uganda. 

She grows cassava, maize, and beans on a small scale but manages to sell enough of it to earn some income to meet her family needs. She needs this loan to pay tuition for her two children to attend secondary school. She believes she will earn enough to repay the loan using income from the sale of her agricultural products. She is hard-working and thanks the group for standing by her side and for UGAFODE to agree to lend to them. All the clients in the photograph signed the client waiver forms consenting to publishing.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita is only 23 years old.  She is married to Porimol and is a housewife . Together they are rearing two children (one daughter and one son). They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud) in Shalbari in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Sangita studied up to grade 7, whereas her husband, who is a farmer by trade, attended school up to grade 9. Her son goes to school and is in grade 9, whereas her daughter is too young.

Sangita's husband is active in growing farm produce.  He has been in agriculture for over five years. He mainly grows vegetables and seasonal fruit like potatoes, beans, cucumbers, mangoes, etc. He tries his best and has a good will as a good farmer in his locality.  He grows good quality products and sells at a reasonable rate, so he gets good customers.  But his family expenses are growing day by day and it is not possible for him to meet all the demands with his poor income. To satisfy his customers and to give financial stability to his family, he needs to expand his business. He wants to cultivate jute which is a profitable crop.

Sangita has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers in order to have a plentiful and high-quality harvest.  She hopes this will enable her husband to earn more to cover all the family expenses very smoothly.

Sangita dreams of building a concrete-made house with the profit. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds for cultivation of jute.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is from a very remote village in the district Jalpaiguri .  She is a married woman of 36 years, a housewife, mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She has an elementary education and could not go further due to her parents' poor financial condition. Her husband Moloy, aged 44 years, is fully engaged in his farming business.  Their children are receiving an education and are in grades 5 and 7.

Arati's husband has been busy growing different vegetables in different seasons.  He learnt cultivation from his father and owns an ancestral land.  He gives his hard toil to grow vegetables and earn sufficient profit, to give his family financial sustenance, but he can't fulfill it due to his small income.  Arati, though a housewife, helps him in his agricultural work and at the time of harvest. Now they have thought to start cultivation of bitter gourd, which is a profitable crop and has a good demand, in order to earn more.

Arati heard about BJS, that they give loans to needy rural women for business, and she has taken a loan. She plans to utilise the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for the smooth cultivation of the product.  She hopes the additional profit will help her to spend enough on her children's education and the well-being of her family.

With the profit, she wants to purchase a mini-tractor in future  to facilitate their agricultural activities.

She gives her thanks to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides for cultivating bitter gourd.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is only 27 years old, a very hardworking and enthusiastic woman.  She lives in a remote region in the district Jalpaiguri with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). She studied up to grade 7 but did not get an opportunity for further studies.  Her children are students who are in grade 4, 3 and 1.  Her husband Jamiruddin, aged 31 years, works in a stationery shop.  They have a kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo). She has a primary education and her husband is uneducated; can sign his name only.

Her husband's income is hardly enough to maintain the family expenses. Thus Asma is engaged in animal husbandry as the secondary source of income.  She has a dairy cow; she sells the milk to her neighbors who are her main customers. In order to give her family financial stability, she wants to expand her business.  She wants to purchase another cow so that she can sell more milk and satisfy her customers as well as earn more profit.

To fulfill her dream, she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase one more cow. She hopes a good future for her business and which will improve her family's financial situation. She plans to use profits from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock and to save toward building a cattle shed.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer, and seeds to improve his land

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa, él es policía y tiene una empresa que brinda vigilancia a empresas y casas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar la empresa y va comprar uniformes. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in the south of Peru. He is a member of the Qory Chaska Community Bank, a part of the Arariwa organization. Rafael is a policeman and runs a business providing security services to businesses and private homes. He’s been doing this work for several years, and all is going well. 

He now wishes to invest further in the business so needs a loan to buy uniforms. He is grateful for this loan and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: invest in his business and buy uniforms

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 33 years old from Nyandarua. He is married and is supporting one child aged five years old.

Alexander has a medical clinic that he has been running for the past eight years. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy various medicines to add to his stock.

He hopes to improve his business and livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: To buy medicine for his clinic

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas is still doing well in his business. He is requesting another loan of 80,000 KES, which he will use to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, bar soap, washing powder, cooking fat and other items for resale in his shop.

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan as well as expand his business. His dream is to give the best support to his siblings and parents, as well as expand his business to a point where he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as rice, sugar and cooking fat for resale in his shop

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her in the past. She was able to buy the spare parts needed in her computer shop. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for parts and to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop

loans.name: Luz Esperanza

texts.es:
Está en la historia de Luz Esperanza estudiante de 4 semestre de auxiliar de enfermería y actualmente tiene 20 años, tiene una hija 3 años y medio, ella vive con la mama, la hermana y la hija. 
Escogió esta hermosa carrera porque quiere servirle a las personas, ayudar en lo que más pueda y poder salvar vidas con los aportes que ella cuando vio la oportunidad de entrar a estudiar esta carrera vio que el instituto CAMPO ALTO es muy bueno y sobre todo tiene mucha experiencia y conocimiento y para aspirar a que en el futuro pueda llegar a ser una ENFERMERA PROFESIONAL 
Necesita la ayuda de kiva para poder seguir adelante con el sueño y darle un futuro a la hija pues en estos momentos no tiene recursos para pagar el semestre.

Aspira a entrar a trabajar como auxiliar de enfermería y empezar nuevamente a estudiar ENFERMERA PROFESIONAL para poder superarse en la profesión,
ayudar a la mama con los gastos tan grandes que tiene, pagarle a la hija un colegio privado para que tenga un estudio bueno y le da gracias a kiva por tener este crédito que le ayuda mucho.
texts.en:
This is the story of  Luz Esperanza, a fourth semester assistant nursing student. Right now she is 20 years old and she has a 3 and a half year old daughter. She lives with her mother, her sister and her daughter.
 
She picjked this beautiful major because she wants to serve people, help them as much as she can, and be able to save lives with her contribution. When she saw the chance to to study this major, she saw that that the CAMPO ALTO institute is very good. Above all, she has a lot of experience and knowledge and she aspires to being a Registered Nurse in the future. 

She needs Kiva's help to be able to continue with her dream and give her daughter a future because right now she doesn't have the resources to pay for the semester.

She hopes to start working as an assistant nurse and begin studying again to become a Registered Nurse so she can get ahead in her profession, help her mother with the big expenses they have, and pay for her daughter to go to a good private school. She is thankful to Kiva for having the loan, which is helping her a lot.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Jose Simon

texts.es: José es un chico de 31 años el es soltero y  a pesar de los grandes golpes de la vida no a desistido en su lucha por salir adelante, la muerte y falta de sus padres no ha sido un impedimento, esto lo motiva mucho mas  a que él se convierta en un emprendedor y forme su propio negocio y para ello a solicitada una pequeño préstamo para comprar terneros el cual servirá para hacer realidad su sueño, su meta en la vida es de poder incrementar su negocio y para así convertirse en un empresario exitoso, su anhelo mas grande es de poder restaurar su  vivienda.
texts.en:
José is a 31 year old man, single and despite some big blows from life has never given up in his fight to move forward: the death and absence of his parents has not been an impediment, it just motivates him that much more to be an entrepreneur and create his own business.  

For this reason he is requesting a small loan to buy calves which will help make his dream a reality.  His goal in life is to be able to increase his business and to become a successful business man.  His greatest wish is to be able to restore his house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luís de 52 años de edad, estudio  hasta 4 grado,  dado a la pobreza de sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando desde muy joven se dedicó al jornal y actividades agrícolas. Esta acompañado,  su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres  del hogar, son padres de tres hijos,  uno de ellos estudia  mientras los otro dos ya no viven con él y se dedican a sus actividades, y ya no dependen de él.

Luís se dedica a la agricultura actividad que realiza desde hace unos 40 años, el cual lo aprendió de sus padres  y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado ; viaja en una bicicleta a una distancia de 600mts hasta donde realiza su trabajo de 6:00 am a 11:00 am.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abono, fungicidas, semilla, pago del alquiler del terreno y cultivar  14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
texts.en:
52-year old Luís has a grade 4 education. As his parents were poor he couldn’t continue his schooling. Ever since he was a young man he has earned his living as a day laborer or working in the fields. He is married; his wife looks after the household. They have three children, one of whom is a student while the other two no longer live at home and have their own lives and jobs.

Luís has worked in agriculture for some forty years. He learned about farming from his parents. He also raises cattle. He travels a distance of 600m on his bicycle to get to his land where he works from 6am to 11am.

He is seeking a loan to buy manure, fungicides, seeds, and pay the rent on the land where he will grow 14,000m2 of corn.

loans.use: buy manure, fungicides, seeds, and pay the rent on the land where he will grow 14,000m2 of corn

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 35 years old and supports four school-age children. She runs a mixed farming business in Kapsabet town, where she keeps dairy cows and grows tea,  and is served by Vision Fund Kenya Kapsabet Branch.

After borrowing her first loan her business income improved. She is now requesting a loan of 25,000 KES, which she will use to purchase dairy feeds for her cows. With the anticipated profits she will pay her children's school fees and loan repayment, as well as expand her business.

Dorcas' dream is to give the best education to her children as well as expand her business to a point where she will be able to meet  all of her financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds

loans.name: Mayra Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Mayra Patricia una persona responsable con actitudes para estudiar y salir adelante, tiene la oportunidad de estudiar en Campo Alto lo cual le va a servir para crecer personalmente y laboral mente, en el momento tiene un empleo como auxiliar de cocina en un jardín pero por ello quiere estudiar para mejorar el estilo de vida, puesto que es madre soltera de un niño de tres años. 

Quiere tener el subsidio que le ofrece la institución Campo Alto por medio de KIVA por que  la apoya con los estudios para mejorar y para poder ser cumplida con la mensualidad, ella paga el semestre por  cuotas ya que no lo puede cancelar completo en un solo pago por las condiciones económicas  que tiene en este  momento.
texts.en:
This is Mayra Patricia, a responsible person with the desire to study and come out ahead. She has the opportunity to study in Campo Alto which will help her to grow personally and work-wise. She currently has a job as a kitchen assistant in a garden, however she wants to study to improve her lifestyle, given that she is a single mother of a three year old child. 
 
She wants to have the subsidy that the Campo Alto institution is offering her by way of Kiva because of its support with her studies in order to improve and to be able to be fulfilled with the monthly payment. She pays for the semester in quotas since she cannot do it all in just one payment due to the economic conditions that she has in this moment.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of enrolment.

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
