Naum is 30 years old and married to Hillary. They are blessed with two children, ages nine and two years, whom they both support. Naum runs a cereal business in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for the last four years, and from this business she gets a monthly income of 12,000 KES.
 
She has borrowed a loan of 80,000 KES, and she will use this loan to purchase a stock of cereals for resale. 

With the anticipated profits, she will use it to increase her business stock, make some savings, and loan repayment. 
Her dream is to give the best to her family, i.e. meeting the financial needs and giving the best education to her children, expand her business, and open branches in other nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more stock and cereal for resale.

loans.name: Davaakhuu

texts.en: Davaakhuu is one of our trustworthy clients and paid her loan without any delay on each schedule. She has been giving vocational training to local people since 2005. She is requesting a loan of 850 USD to buy furniture such as a sofa, drawers, and table in order to improve her living conditions. Living in comfortable conditions will give her enthusiasm to work hard.

loans.use: to buy a sofa, drawers, and table.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 25 years old from Matandura in Nyandarua South and is married with no children yet.

Harun has a mobile money business locally known as 'Mpesa,' which he has operated for one year. Harun is also a farmer, a business that he runs alongside the Mpesa business. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy a cow. 

Harun hopes to improve his business in the near future and improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, a widow, is 51 years old, and supports a family of five. She is into the milk trade business in Kapsabet town, served by VisionFund Kenya Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last four years. She earns an average monthly income of 16,000 KES.

Hellen plans to use the loan of 65,000 KES to purchase more milk for resale. Her dream is to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To buy milk for resale

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 28,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jenita dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is an old client to the branch. He is a vocational teacher and he has done this for over 4 years. He also operates an agriculture business as his other source of income, located in Rwenyerere, Bugangari, and Rukungiri district.
His main challenge has been limited capital. He needs the loan to buy more land and also renovate his residential house which is apparently in bad shape. He is hopeful the land will help him expand his school.
He appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial assistance rendered to him and is hopeful his dream is going to be achieved.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovating the house.

loans.name: Dina Gertrudris

texts.es: Dina tiene 32 años de edad y reside en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad. Dina se gana la vida como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad y es así como aporta en la economía del hogar. Dina desea construir un cuarto pequeño para proteger la bomba del agua para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible para proteger la bomba de agua.
texts.en:
Dina is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children of 14 and 10. Dina makes her living as the employee of an institution close to her location and it is in this way that she contributes to her domestic economy. Dina wishes to build a small room to protect the water pump, for which she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand and iron. 

She hopes to be able to count on the funding and this way initiate the construction as soon as possible in order to protect the water pump.

loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand and iron in order to build a room for the water pump.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: Graciela es una señora de 60 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos son independientes, comenta que toda su vida se ha dedicado a la ganadería que las cuotas del préstamo las paga de la venta de la leche, añade que con este negocio se ha ayudado para sacar adelante a sus hijos, el esposo de Graciela se dedica a la agricultura y también le apoya en la ganadería, la aspiración de Graciela es lograr comprar un terreno para criar a sus vacas.
texts.en: Graciela, 60, lives with her husband. They have six children, who are all independent. She says that she has worked in cattle ranching all her life. Her loan payments will be paid from selling milk. She adds that this business has helped her move her children forward. Graciela's husband works in agriculture and also helps her with cattle ranching. Graciela's goal is to be able to buy land where she can raise her cows.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to newly assist with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three ovens to increase her revenue and to offer three jobs to women heads of household.

loans.name: Tumendalai

texts.en:
Tumendalai, 48 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been a taxi driver since 2004. His wife is a laboratory technician and works at a hospital. Their elder son is a bartender at a pub, while the younger son goes to high school.

The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years due to strong winds and heavy snowfall. Therefore Tumendalai is requesting a loan of 1400 USD through Credit Mongol to buy building materials such as bricks, planks and fiberglass to renovate their house. After renovation his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating. An added benefit is that fewer pollutants will be released into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
From Naivasha, Kennedy is 22 years old and single. He has a cereals business that he has been running for a number of years.

Kennedy is applying for a 100,000 KES loan, his first, through VisionFund Kenya. He will use the money to buy more cereals like greengrams (mung beans), lentils, and other beans and cereals to add to his stock. Kennedy hopes to be able to enlarge his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy cereals to add to his stock

loans.name: Argemiro

texts.es: Argemiro es de esas personas que inspiran un respeto y admiración gigante entre las personas que conocen su historia, pues tuvo que alimentar, educar e inculcar todos los valores a sus hijos ya que le toco criarlos solo, antiguamente era un vendedor ambulante, pero se le presento la oportunidad de adquirir una tienda que había dejado una de sus hermanas y la ha venido manejando hace tres meses, pero quiere hacerla crecer, tratar de generar más ingresos y ofrecer un servicio más completo  por ende solicita un crédito para la compra de un enfriador y surtido para este, para perdurar en el tiempo, la tienda ha sido una bendición para Argemiro puesto que puede estar pendiente del cuidado de sus hijos y su negocio. Su principal sueño es ampliar su lote con el que espera construir su casa y una tienda amplia así dejarle un hogar propio a su fuente de fuerza e inspiración sus hijos
texts.en: Argemiro is one of those people that inspire immense respect and admiration among the people that know his story, as he had to feed, educate and instill values in his children since he raised them on his own. Previously, he was a street vendor, but an opportunity presented itself to acquire a store that one of his sisters had left that he has managed for three months. He wants to make it grow and try to generate more income and offer a more complete service by requesting a loan to buy a cooler and stock to last over time. The store has been a blessing for Argemiro as he can be watching his children and his business. His main dream is to grow his lot and with that construct his house and a large shop to leave a home as a source of strength and inspiration to his children.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and stock for his store, with the goal of offering other products.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
From Murungaru in Nyandarua South, Peter is 64 years old and married. He has three children aged between 17 and 22 years old.

Peter has had a farm for many years. He is applying for a 40,000 KES loan, his eighth from VisionFund Kenya, to buy seedlings, fertilizer and other farm necessities. He wishes to see more profit from his farm so he can afford to brighten his children's future through education.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Kasaine

texts.en:
Kasaine used the previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on his farm. His farm did better after the loan.

Kasaine has applied for another loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do well.

He hopes to own the largest farm in the Sakutiek area in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: Jose vive con su esposa y su hijo de un año  en una casa que le presta un familiar, Jose se dedica un año a la agricultura y dice que el anterior cultivo lo hizo con el anterior crédito que le dio Fodemi y  le fue excelente, Jose tiene 21 años y dice que anteriormente  trabajaba en una panadería,   pero le ve más rentable cultivar papas y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos, su aspiración es mejorar sus ingresos para ponerse una panadería propia y luego comprar una casa para vivir juntamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and 1-year-old son in a house owned by one of his relatives. Jose has made a living for the last year in agriculture. He says that he was able to reap his previous harvest with his previous loan from Fodemi and it was excellent. Jose is 21 years old and says that he used to work in a bakery, but he thought it would be more profitable to grow potatoes. 

Jose will invest this loan to buy fertilizer for his crops. He aspired to improve his income so that he can open his own bakery and later buy a house for he and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potatoes and continue to support his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wrapping paper and flowers for the business to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells fresh food in Hoima, Uganda. She started that in 2008 to supplement her cash inflow. She desires to see her business grow and have a healthy family despite the challenge of inadequate capital.

Grace is asking for a loan to buy matooke (green plantain), cassava and charcoal to sell.

loans.use: buy matooke, cassava and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa es una señora alegre, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, el mayor asiste a la escuela y dice que es muy estudioso, Rosa se dedica 5 años a su negocio que es una tienda y también trabaja de ayudante en una panadería de lunes a sábado ya que es una mujer soltera y tiene que luchar sola para los gastos de sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para la tienda y le gustaría ampliar y adecuar su negocio para que sea más llamativo para su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa is a happy woman. She has two children ages 3 and 5. Her oldest has started school and she says that he is very studious. Rosa has run her store for the last five years while also working in a bakery from Monday to Saturday. Rosa is single and she has to fight all alone to provide for her children.

She will invest this loan to buy products for her store. She would also like to expand and make some adjustments to her business so that it is more attractive for her customers.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Marselina is a 44-year-old woman and is married to Petrus, 54 years old. They have been blessed with 6 children; Agustina, 25, a worker; Benediktus, 21 and Alexander, 18, both senior high school students; Henderikus, 14, Antonius, 9, and the last one Andrianus, 7, elementary school students.

Marselina has been running a kiosk business for four years. In addition, she is working as a farmer and it has been two years since she was involved in this activity. Marselina cultivates vegetables such as water spinach, spinach and kale. It takes three weeks to harvest and then she sells them in the market. The income from selling the vegetables helps her to cover her household needs and the educational fees of her children. Currently Marselina plans to add more vegetable seedlings. To do so, she has submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a repeat client of the organization who applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000. He runs a business fattening cattle in a trading center and has been doing this for more than 20 years. He does small scale farming to supplement his income. The purpose of the loan is to buy more cattle so that he can sell them and get profits and raise money to maintain his family, pay school fees for his siblings and develop his household.

Charles is an honest and hardworking man but is always limited by capital. His dream is running a large scale cattle fattening business.

With this loan from UGAFODE, Charles is hopeful that the situation will improve gradually.

loans.use: to buy baby bulls

loans.name: Mayna

texts.en:
Mayna is married and has two children (one son and one daughter).  She is only 25 years old and lives in a remote village in Jalpaiguri district with her children and husband Gojen, who is 45 years old. Both Mayna and her husband are uneducated. They were deprived of their studies due to their parents' poor economic resources.  Now she and her husband are providing an education to their children who are in grades five and seven.

Mayna's husband is a cultivator, who has been busy growing a variety of vegetables, mainly potatoes, chillies, beans, and tomatoes.  He has great experience.  He works hard on his land from the early morning hours, yet he is unable to provide sufficient financial sustenance. His children's education is his greatest challenge.  Now they want to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop.  They want to start cultivation, but they have no money

Mayna is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase good jute seeds, manure, pesticides and other necessary farm supplies to start a smooth cultivation of jute. She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will be of much help with their well-being.

Her dreams are to go ahead with her business, educate her children well and buy a motor van with the profit earned.

She will be much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and other necessary farm supplies

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 22-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is motorcycle transportation whereby he remits 70% of his proceeds to the motorcycle owner. He started working in this business hoping to earn a living. Competition and bad roads are his main challenges, however, he plans to buy a motorcycle and is therefore asking for a loan to help him fulfill this goal.

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Nuru 1 Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is in her early forties and has two children who are at school. She is married and has a beauty salon. Fatuma has been in this business for 14 years and is able to make a good monthly profit. She works at her salon from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm every work day.

This is Fatuma's 13th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy salon hair products. Fatuma used her previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to buy more beauty and hair products for her business. Fatuma earned extra income that she used to pay school fees and home food expenses. She is so grateful for Kiva's support, which has helped her upgrade her business. She dreams of becoming a successful business woman in the future.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Nuru 1" that has a total of six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo used his previous loan to buy sodas, water and flour to sell. He has continued with the same business that he started so that he could become self employed. Transport delays due to poor roads are his main business challenge. 

Deo needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, sodas, water and maize flour to sell. He hopes to construct his own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, sodas, water and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicken and fish for her business.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is a 30-year-old hardworking lady with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in selling second hand clothes. She started this business with the intention of generating enough income to look after her family. Her dream is to have a well stocked boutique in town that can attract more customers, despite the challenge of changes in tastes and preferences of the people she serves. Lillian needs a loan to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a 40-year-old woman.  She is married and blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  Her husband Gopal, 43, is a carpenter.  Both Mamata and her husband are illiterate and they can only sign their names. But with great difficulty, they are providing an education to their children who are in grades nine, seven and three.  They live in the small village of Netajipara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Her husband, who is a carpenter, makes wooden furniture like chairs, tables, desks etc. Mamata is engaged in the milk-selling business to give financial assistance to her family. She has three children and she is motivated to provide them with a reasonable life. She has a dairy cow and she sells milk to many of her neighbors.
 
Now Mamata seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She wants to purchase another cow to improve her business to meet her customers’ needs. She hopes it will help to increase her milk production capacity, which will ultimately help to generate more income.

She is grateful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Manika

texts.en:
Manika is a 42-year-old married woman who is hardworking and optimistic. She strives tirelessly to earn an income with her husband to help with the household finances and their children's education.  She is from the small village of Netajipara in the district of Jalpaiguri and lives with her husband Ratan and three children (one son and two daughters) who are in grades nine, seven and six.   But they are uneducated and can only sign their names.

She and her husband are engaged in the business of selling clothing for ladies.  They sell saris (traditional Indian ladies wear), frocks etc.  Her main customers are her relatives, friends, neighbors and acquaintances in their area. Now they want to expand their business by selling gents' garments to get additional profit.

She is asking for this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase jeans, shirts, t-shirts and jackets.  This way, she can satisfy her customers' wants and needs, and improve her sales and income through her labor.

Manika says that her main purpose is to continue working for her family's wellbeing and she will continue working with effort and dedication to accredit her business and guarantee her family's financial stability so she can enjoy a better quality of life with her loved ones. Her dream is to build a concrete-made house for them.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Batmakan

texts.ru: Батмакан 61 год, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Батмакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством. Начав с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Батмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 3 теленка и 15 овец. Батмакан занимается реализацией молока и молочной продукции на местном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Батмакан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Увеличение поголовья скота позволит улучшить материальное состояние Батмакан  и ее семьи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на увеличение площади сарая.
texts.en:
Batmakan is 61 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 35 years, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She bought her first cattle with 5,000 som (KGS) and thanks to her very hard work, she now owns three dairy cows, two horses, three calves and 15 sheep.  Batmakan sells milk and milk products at the local market.  Her monthly income comes close to 12,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some cows.  With more cattle Batmakan will be able to improve her material conditions as well as those of her family.  She is planning to reinvest her earnings from this loan into further increasing her number of domestic animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to increase the size of her barn.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 36-year-old man who is purely in agriculture where he deals in tea farming, supplemented by banana plantations in order to increase his earnings. He set up this business in 1998 and complains of bad weather and wishes to have a very big tea plantation. He is asking for a loan to buy roofing materials like iron sheets for his house.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials like iron sheets for his house.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 31-year-old Ivy from Harare. She is married with two children and both are attending school.  Ivy runs a retail business selling clothes and electronics. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenges she faces are stiff competition from local competitors and fluctuating prices.

Ivy has requested a loan of 500 USD to purchase blankets for resale for the coming winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to boost sales and increase profits. In the future, Ivy plans to open three shops in Current Shopping Centre and Budiriro Bazaar. Ivy says she is grateful for the support that has been extended to her by Kiva and Microking.

loans.use: to buy blankets for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Stella from Harare. She is married with four children and three of them are attending school.  Stella runs a retail business selling hardware material. The business has been in operation for 17 years. She says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition from other players in the market. 

Stella has requested a loan of 300 USD to buy rhinoset and cement for resale in her hardware shop. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase profits so she can send her children to better schools. In the future, Stella plans to bring her business to a higher level. She is grateful to Kiva for affording her an opportunity to expand her businesses through cheap funding.

loans.use: to buy rhinoset and cement

loans.name: Nuru 2 Group

texts.en:
Bertha is in her mid-thirties and has two kids who are in school. She is single and has owned a pub business for three years now. She opens her business from 4:00 pm to midnight and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her 16th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy chairs and connect DSTV to her business. Bertha used her successfully repaid previous loans to repair her pub with new building materials to make it look more attractive. She also managed to make a profit that she used to build a house and cover school fees and home expenses. Bertha is very happy with the financial support and dreams of expanding her business. 

Bertha will share this loan with her loan group "Nuru 2," which consist of six members who will join each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs and connect DSTV to her business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah used her previous loan to buy general merchandise such as soap, salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell. She has continued to run the same general store business while also selling second hand clothes and farming to augment her income. Delayed payments from her customers are her main challenge. Annah is now requesting a loan to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses used the previous loan to buy seeds for planting. He has continued with his business and is facing the same problems of bad weather and poor roads to the market. However, he has a vision of buying plots of land to expand his farming business. 

Moses needs a loan to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Milton Eduaro

texts.es: Son 18 años de lo que Eduardo se dedica a la ganadería y también se dedica al jornal, este señor se caracteriza por ser serio en sus negocio, tiene una conviviente y 3 hijos de 2, 7 y 9 años de los que los 2 mayores se encuentran estudiando, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vacona para ampliar su negocio, comenta que para criar a su ganado él paga de arriendo de la hierba y que si  es rentable, dice que él trabaja por el bienestar de sus hijos y que desea que logren terminar sus metas propuestas en cuanto al estudio.
texts.en: For 18 years Eduardo has dedicated himself to livestock farming and wage-earning jobs.  He is known for his seriousness in business.  He has a common-law wife and three children, ages two, seven and nine years old.  The eldest two attend school.  He will use the loan to buy a cow to expand his business.  He says that in order to raise his cattle he rents land for them to graze on, and it is profitable.  He says he works for his children's well-being and hopes they meet all their goals in the future as far as education is concerned.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Japhari

texts.en:
Japhari is 41 years old, married, and blessed with 3 kids. He hails from Katenga Village, a division of the Rukungiri municipality. He runs a transport business in Rukungiri town. His main challenge has been limited capital. 

Japhari, a repeat client of UGAFODE, has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX.  He will use the loan to buy spare parts for his truck to help him cover longer distances and therefore earn better profits. Japhari hopes his business will move to higher heights. He therefore appreciates the financial assistance from KIVA and UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Oscar Alexis

texts.es:
Oscar ha sido un trabajador para diferentes empresas de arreglo de equipos electrodomésticos y de comunicaciones con las cuales adquirió una gran experiencia hasta tal punto de estar capacitado para reparar cualquier tipo de equipo ya sea electrodoméstico o de comunicaciones, hace 7 años aproximadamente deicidio independizarse y montar su propio negocio con la ayuda de los ahorros y la liquidación que obtuvo en la última empresa donde laboro. De esta manera nació su negocio, un establecimiento familiar, en el cual operan tres personas el padre y dos hijos (ver en foto) y con los cuales ha tenido mejores beneficios económicos, solicita un crédito para la compra de herramienta para realizar reparaciones a los nuevos equipos que están entrando al mercado, Oscar solo espera un pequeño apoyo y demostrar que en muchas ocasiones la mejor empresa es una constituida por familia, un negocio regido por valores de confianza, comprensión y colaboración mutua 

Nota: las personas en la foto de izquierda a derecha (padre de Oscar, Oscar, la hermana)
texts.en:
Oscar has worked in different companies fixing domestic appliances and communications equipment, which has given him vast experience, to the extent that he is capable of repairing any type of equipment, whether an appliance or any communications equipment.  Approximately seven years ago he decided to become independent and set up his own business with his savings and severance pay from the last company where he worked.  He established a family business where three people work: the father and two children (see photo), and which provides better profits.  

He is requesting a loan to buy tools to repair the latest equipment to enter the market.  Oscar only hopes for a small amount of support.  He wants to show that many times the best companies are those formed by families, where the business is run with values such as trust, comprehension and mutual collaboration.

Note:  The people in the photo, from left to right, are Oscar's father, Oscar and his sister.

loans.use: To buy tools to repair modern equipment.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, a resident of Fort Portal, is a business man 31 years of age and operates a motorcycle transport business (boda boda) which he started in 2011 to sustain himself and his family. Abraham says competition is very high, yet passengers are very few and wishes to have many motorcycles in order to expand the business and earn more income.

Abraham is asking for a loan to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Yeraldine

texts.es: Yeraldine es una joven con 21 años de edad, soltera. Vive con sus padres y hermano. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, humilde y con grandes desos de superación personal. Vive en una comunidad rural pero en la zona céntrica. Actualmente está cursando en la universidad la carrera de derecho. Debido a ésto ella inició su actividad de vender ropa para generar ingresos y poder ayudarse a pagar sus estudios. Cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para la venta y cobro de su mercadería. Una de sus metas es terminar su carrera y ayudar a su madre económicamente y a su hermano a seguir estudiando para que sea un profesional como ella. Es primera vez que solicita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio, porque necesita cubrir la demanda de pedidos de sus clientes, asi satisfacerlos y crecer en su actividad, y su crecimiento se va ver reflejado mejorando la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yeraldine, 21, is single and lives with her parents and brother.  She is a hard-working, humble woman who is determined to get ahead.  She lives in a rural community in the central area and is currently studying at the university toward a law degree.  This is why she started selling clothing in order to generate an income and help pay for her education.  Her mother helps with sales and collection of payment.

One of her goals is to get her degree and help her mother economically, and her brother so he continues to study and become a professional like her.  This is the first time she is requesting a loan to strengthen her business so she can meet customer demand with regard to orders.  She wants to satisfy her customers and grow her business in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Cuasquer Huera

texts.es: Gilverto es un señor muy luchador, vive con su esposa y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales la mayor ya es casada y los 4 se encuentran estudiando, Gilverto se dedica 3 años a la ganadería, también se dedica a la agricultura y a veces  labora de chofer, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para incrementarla en su negocio, este señor aspira que en su negocio le siga yendo tan bien como hasta ahora y que sus ingresos le permitan que sus hijos sigan estudiando y culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gilverto is a hard-working man who is married and has five children.  The eldest daughter is married and the other four children are in school.  Gilverto has been working in livestock farming for three years and he also works in agriculture and sometimes as a driver.

He will use the loan to buy a cow to expand his business.  His goal is for his business to continue going the way it has until now and that his income will allow his children to finish their education.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Campesinos De Tzununá 1 Group

texts.es:
Joaquin (es el primero del lado izquierdo que se encuentra en la fotografía) el es un hombre casado de 42 años de edad, quien vive con sus cinco hijos de los cuales son; tres hombre y dos mujeres, ambos viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Joaquin comenta que se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, cultivando café, esta actividad la eligió porque sus padres le enseñaron esta labor desde pequeño. Ahora puede contribuir a la economía de su familia ya que a través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables.
El ha tomado la decisión de formar un grupo para contribuir al desarrollo de nuevos negocios y así mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de abono orgánico y químico, que servirá para cultivo de café.
Uno de los sueños de don Joaquin es construirles una vivienda a sus hijos para que en un futuro tengan donde vivir.
texts.en:
Joaquin (first from the left in the photograph) is 42, married and lives with his five children, three sons and two daughters, in the department of Sololá.

Joaquin works in agriculture, growing coffee, which is a trade his parents taught him when he was young.  Now he contributes to the family economy with a reasonable income and profits.

He has decided to form a group to contribute toward the development of new businesses and improve the family economy of the members.  He will use the loan to buy organic and chemical compost for his coffee crop.

One of Joaquin's goals is to build a house for his children so they will have somewhere to live in the future.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical compost for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is from the rural village of Kathapara in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a 25-year-old young woman, married and a housewife. She is a smart, active woman who always pursues the well-being of her family. She is married to Mafikul, 38 years old, and has three children (two sons and one daughter).  All the children are school-going and are in primary classes. Hasina completed her primary education whereas her husband is uneducated.

Hasina's husband is engaged in farming. This is the only source of income for the family. Hasina helps her husband in his agricultural activities such as sowing and harvesting the crops.  But the income from the business is hardly enough to provide food and other household expenses for the family. Moreover, the educational costs of their children are growing day by day. Hasina and her husband want to develop the business. They want to grow one more crop that is in good demand in the market. The crop is maize, but they don't have enough money to cultivate a new crop.

Thus, Hasina has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other things to start the initial cultivation. She hopes this loan will help her improve their business and with the profit, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family and bear her children's educational expenses.

Hasina thanks her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, a resident of Fort Portal in western Uganda, is 29 years of age and is blessed with four children. He is a builder by profession and it is the main activity that allows him to survive with the family in addition to rental property since 2006. He says dishonest clients who delay payments and others who don’t pay at all lead to losses.

He wishes to construct permanent rooms since the ones he has are semi-permanent. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy building materials like bricks and cement for construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials like bricks and cement for construction.

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Shela is a 25-year-old married woman. For about 5 years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater for more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, a resident of Fort Portal, is celebrating being 34 years of age during which he has been blessed with three children. He deals in cattle-selling, which he started in 2000. 

He wishes to develop and have enough stock in future for his growing clientele but says inadequate capital is the biggest hindrance. Samuel is asking for a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Natalia Elizabeth

texts.es: Natalia tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 11 años, 8 años y 3 años de edad. Natalia trabaja como operaría en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y mantiene la economía de su familia junto a su compañero de vida quien es pequeño comerciante. Natalia  solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de balcones, ventanas y reparación de las chapas de las puertas las cuales se encuentran en mal estado y desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Natalia is 34 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their three children, aged 11, 8 and 3. Natalia works as an operator at a  business close to her community and that is how she supports her home and maintains the family budget with her life's companion, who is a small merchant. She is asking for this loan from  FUSAI to invest in buying balconies and windows and to repair the locks on the doors which are in poor condition. She wants to improve security for her family.

loans.use: to buy balconies and windows and to repair the locks on the doors of the house.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 27-year-old married gentleman with four children living in Fort Portal town. Wilson operates a motorcycle transport business locally known as bodaboda which he started in 2004 to employ himself. He also has a poultry business where he buys and sells chickens; since he already has transport it is easy for him. 

Wilson says he wishes to expand his farm and therefore he is asking for a loan to buy chickens to sell.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called God's Time. The group is composed of three people who live in the same area and who meet once every weeks to repay loans, make savings deposits and receive training. They are into businesses involving soft drinks, phone credit cards, provisions, maize, fish, children and adult's tops. 

The featured borrower is Diana, the one in the middle in the photo. She is married and a mother. Her main work involves selling utensils in the market. She has over two years of experience in this business. She is requesting this loan to buy and sell soft drinks, phone credit cards, provisions. Her day starts at 7 AM and ends at 8 PM. Diana has no expenses in particular, aside from her personal needs. She would like to bolster her merchandise and become a potential supplier in her area.

loans.use: to buy and sell soft drinks, phone credit cards and provisions.

loans.name: Héctor David

texts.es:
Héctor de 51 años de edad, gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su familia,  logro sacar su carrera de profesorado en educación básica. Está casado  y padre de  2 hijos, uno de ellos estudia parvularia, y el otro que esta recién nacido. Él trabaja de 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

Héctor los fines de semana que le queda tiempo los dedica al trabajo agrícola junto a otras personas que paga para que le ayuden. Él aprendió este trabajo ya que su papá a esto se dedicaba y  cuando estaba estudiando los días que le quedaba libre se dedicaba  a la agricultura,  es así como decide dedicarse también a la agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizante, 2 bolsas de semilla, pago del alquiler del terreno para hacer la milpa,  insecticidas y pago de pago de mano de obra para cultivar maíz.

Su sueño es producir el maíz que demanda su familia, para consumir durante un año, y otra parte que le sobra lo vende, para también obtener algunos sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Héctor is 51 years old. Thanks to his and his family's hard work, he was able to become an elementary school teacher. He is married and has two children. One of them studies early childhood education and the other is a newborn. He works from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. 

On weekends, when Héctor has time, he does agriculture with others whom he pays to help him. He learned this work from his father, since that is what he did. When he was in school, on his days off he would do farm work. That is how he decided to work in agriculture as well. 

The loan he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy 6 bags of fertilizer, 2 bags of seeds, to pay for renting the land to grow the corn, to buy insecticide and to pay for the labor to plant the corn.  His dream is to produce the corn his family needs for the year and sell what he has left over so that he can make some income from it.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer, 2 bags of seeds, to pay rent on the land to grow the corn, to buy insecticide and to pay for the labor to plant the corn.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer inquieta y siempre en busca de nuevas alternativas de progreso, junto a su esposo comparte los gastos del hogar y sostienen a su hijo de 16 años.
Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de helados en su casa los cuales vende en semana, los fines de semana ofrece sus helados en las afueras de la iglesia de su barrio, adicional a esto trabaja por días en una casa de familia haciendo aseo y preparando alimentos.
Es el ejemplo de una mujer trabajadora que no se deja vencer por el cansancio con el único objetivo de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
Ella actualmente solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido y así tener un inventario de helados más variado, esto le permitirá vender mayor cantidad de producto y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es tener casa propia y una tienda en su propia casa, por eso lucha incansablemente para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a restless woman who is always seeking new ways to progress. She and her husband share the household expenses and support their 16 year old son. She has a small ice cream business in her house where she sells during the week, On the weekends she sells her ice cream outside the church in her neighborhood. In addition, she works some days at a private home preparing meals and cleaning. 

She is an example of a hardworking woman who does not let herself be defeated by tiredness. Her only goal is to give her son a better quality of life. Right now, she is asking for financial support to buy merchandise so she can have more of an assortment of ice cream inventory. This will allow her to sell more product and increase her income.

Her biggest dream is to have her own home and a store in her house. That is why she is fighting tirelessly to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and have more varied ice cream inventory.

loans.name: Arguello

texts.es: Es un señor emprendedor y amable, tiene 70 años de edad, casado, con 1 hija de 30 años, que ha formado su familia. Su esposa es ama de casa. Vive en una comunidad llamada Wasaki que se ubica a 13 kilómetros del área urbana de Rosita, el viaje dura aproximadamente una hora. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de tres décadas en la elaboración de muebles, centro de entretenimiento de Bambú. Desde hace aproximadamente 9 años no mejora su casita de madera y tambo. Con el propósito de tener su que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales cambiar la madera de su vivienda: 8 vigas de madera, 600 pies tablar de madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es comprar herramientas para mejorar la calidad de los muebles que elabora, ponerle una pulpería a su esposa. También anhela con tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en: He is an enterprising and kind man. He is 70 years old, married and has one 30 year old daughter, who has her own family. His wife is a housewife. He lives in a community called Wasaki, which is located 13 kilometers from the urban area of Rosita. The trip takes about an hour. He has more than three decades' experience making furniture, bamboo entertainment centers. For approximately 9 years, he has not improved his house made of wood. In order for his family to live in a safer and more dignified way, he is asking for his first loan to buy materials to change the wood in his home: 8 wooden beams, 600 board feet of planed wood and nails, as well as to cover the labor costs. His dream is to buy tools to improve the quality of the furniture he makes and open a store for his wife. He also longs for a secure house with the basic conditions for general family comfort. He also wants to put a toilet in his house and build a septic tank, because right now he has a latrine in regular condition.

loans.use: to buy materials to change the wood in his house: 8 wooden beams, 600 feet of  vigas de madera, 600 board feet of planed wood, and nails, as well as to cover the labor costs.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a married woman. She has eight children. She has been running a school for many years to pay for her household expenditures. She has gained a good number of students and is respected in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all of her great efforts.  

In order to accommodate more students in her school, Mumtaz has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase some school benches and chairs, and a new blackboard. She expects more admissions as her school becomes well-known in her town. She desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her school.

loans.use: to purchase some school benches and chairs, and a new blackboard.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: At the age of 53, Kalsoom is a married woman who has two children.  She deals in a business selling soft drinks with the support of her son who is also shown in the photo. Kalsoom counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. For the improvement of her business, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase stock of different soft drinks in large quantities. Kalsoom expects a boost in her earnings through increased sales. Kalsoom is in her second loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase stock of different soft drinks in large quantities.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a Ugandan hardworking man who is married. Age 27, he lives in Kagadi. He has three children, ages 6, 3 and 1. Only one of his children attends school. He has been dealing in alcohol production and farming to earn money. He hopes to make more money despite many road accidents. Nicholas is requesting a loan to buy more jerrycans of alcohol for selling.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of alcohol for selling.

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Vicion Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVA VICION
La señora Marlena de 37 años, Casada,  desde hace  2 años posee una Tienda ubicada en La Alameda Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña  Marlena es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere  comprar más mercadería para surtir y agrandar su negocio de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Marlena is part of the communal bank Duo New Vision. She is 37 years old, married, and for the past two years has been the owner of a store located on the Main Avenue of Chimaltenango.  Based on her hard work she has been able to establish and improve her home, and through her business she has maintained her family and helped them move forward.  

Marlena's dream is to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family through a micro-credit that she is requesting through Kiva's partner FAPE.  With the loan she wants to buy more merchandise in order to supply and grow her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase food products for a grocery store.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen, 40, is a married woman. She deals in cloth to support the needs of her family members. She purchases different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Shaheen is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en: Fazeelat is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has 8 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000  PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains, flour and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains, flour and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her home.

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es:
Porfirio de 22 años de edad, soltero sin hijo, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recurso económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Porfirio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 22 years old, single and has no children. He is originally from Leon, in the north of the region. Porfirio is very hard-working, responsible and has a desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, Porfirio was unable to study at university and from a young age had to work in order to help with household costs.

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to prosper, Porfirio has a business selling pigs. He runs the business out of his home. Porfirio works at his business some eight hours per day. This loan will be used to invest in working capital and stock up his business by buying live pigs so that, in the not-too-distant future, he can earn a higher income. Porfirio is grateful for the help given by Kiva investors to poor countries, such as Nicaragua, and to poor people to help them have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up his business by buying live pigs.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.es: Jeniffer de 22 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge de 5 años. Desde hace 6 años,  aprendió el proceso de elaboración de alimentos y hace 3 emprendió su propio negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas. . Su idea de negocio nació cuando tomando en cuenta su experiencia y conocimiento en esta tarea, tuvo el dinero necesario para comprar sus equipos y empezar a producir, como hasta la fecha lo hace. En su negocio vende hamburguesas, peros calientes, y otras comidas rápidas en un punto comercial a su consumidor final. Sus vecinos son su principal clientela y por eso ofrece  a ellos la posibilidad de comprarle a crédito y de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará sillas, mesas y surtirá el negocio con insumos como panes, carnes salsas, especialmente para las fechas festivas que se acercan en especial el día de las madres, temporada en la cual se impactan positivamente las ventas.  Jeniffer trabaja 7 horas diarias y tiene como meta fortalecer su negocio con infraestructura física, para poder crecer y lograr  generar ingresos para cumplir con el propósito de educar a su hija de 5 años de edad y finalmente tener su propia casa, tal y como lo visiona.
texts.en:
Jeniffer is 22 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has now been in a relationship for five years. Six years ago Jeniffer learned to prepare different meals and three years ago she started her own fast food business. Jeniffer's idea to start her own business came from her experience and knowledge in this area. She had the necessary money to buy equipment and start producing meals. She continues with this work now. Jeniffer sells hamburgers, hot dogs and other fast foods. Her main customers are neighbours and she allows them to pay in cash or buy on credit. 

Jeniffer is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, which she will use to buy chairs and tables and to stock up her business with supplies such as bread, meat and sauces. She wants to be stocked up for the upcoming holidays, particularly Mother's Day, as it is then that sales increase. Jeniffer works seven hours per day. Her goal is to improve infrastructure at her business, in order to grow and earn a higher income. With a higher income she can give her five-year-old daughter an education and own her own house.

loans.use: to buy chair, tables and supplies such as bread, meat and sauce.

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una mujer caracterizada por  su innovación a la hora de ofrecer un producto, y no es pro que haya creado un objeto o un servicio diferente, es porque en su pueblo existe dicho servicio pero no en la forma en que ella lo ofrece, verán la señora Rosa brinda al pueblo un servicio de lavado de vehículos pero con la particular de que ella se desplaza hasta donde este el vehículo y le realiza el respectivo servicio. Solicita un ayuda crediticia para comprar una hidro-lavadora y con el resto de dinero comprar una nueva moto ya que la que usa está bastante deteriorada, con esta nueva herramienta espera generar un mayor número de clientes puesto que será de mejor calidad el lavado, y más rápido.
Quizás un motivo para apoyar a Rosa es que viene de un pueblo donde las oportunidades laborales son muy reducidas y cualquier medio para generar ingreso es bien aceptado y más aún para ella que su sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia un deseo de tantas personas pero por sus restricciones económicas no pueden adquirir.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman who is very innovative when selling her products. She does not sell a brand new product, or offer a different service to those available in her town. However, her way of selling her service is different. Rosa's service is washing vehicles but, unlike others, she herself goes to the vehicles, rather than people bringing their cars to her. Rosa is applying for a loan in order to buy a machine for washing vehicles; she will use the rest of the money to buy a new motorcycle as the one she currently has has deteriorated. Rosa hopes that this new tool will help her to gain more customers as the car wash will be of higher quality, and quicker.

Perhaps one reason to support Rosa is that she comes from a town where there are very few job opportunities. Whatever way somebody has of earning an income is a good thing. Rosa's dream is to be able to buy her own house. This is a dream for many people but, for financial reasons, it cannot be realised.

loans.use: to buy a machine for washing vehicles; she will use the rest of the money to buy a new motorcycle as the one she currently has has deteriorated.

loans.name: Rasanara

texts.en:
Rasanara is 39, married and blessed with two sons. She lives with her sons and husband in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is an uneducated (only can sign her name) woman but very much concerned with her children's education and trying her hardest to provide them education. They are in grades 7 and 5.

Rasanara's husband, Monnak, age 45 years, runs a small grocery shop in their own house. He sells grocery items like rice, wheat, sugar, salt, oil, etc. Their main customers are his neighbors. Now Rasanara wants to grow their grocery shop by purchasing varieties if items and satisfying her customers’ needs.

Thus Rasanara has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase varieties of grocery items like spices, biscuits, oil, flour, etc.
 
Their business income will help to cover her family's everyday household needs and the educational expenses of her children. Rasanara dreams that her business will grow more.

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart for her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for their grocery shop.

loans.name: Anamika

texts.en:
Anamika is 34 years old and married. She attended school up to grade 9.  Her husband, Ashis, is 43 years old and he also studied up to grade 9. They live in the small town of Dhupguri which is in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a mother of one son.  

Anamika works very hard to support her family.  Her husband sells beetle nuts (a kind of mouth freshener used in rural areas).  In their spare time both Anamika and her husband make clay idols of gods and goddesses.   

Anamika has been engaged in this business for about ten years. She and her husband give hard labour to this business. Anamika's husband has good experience in the field.  But this is a seasonal business and they earn very little from it; hardly enough for maintaining their family's household. If they can invest more, it will earn a good profit.

Anamika heard from her neighbours that BJS ( Kiva's partner) gives loans to rural women for business. So she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase necessary materials for their business such as clay, colors, brushes, cloths, etc.

Anamika is an enterprising woman and she hopes to be able to increase her business and as well as her earnings so that she can fulfill their customers’ needs and improve their living conditions.   

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for their existing business of making clay idols of gods and goddesses.

loans.name: Ranjana

texts.en:
Ranjana, 46, is married and a housewife. She could not get her elementary education due to her parents' poor financial resources. She is a mother of one son. Her husband is a farmer. Their son is receiving higher education. They live in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

For the past 10 years, Ranjana's husband has been growing different vegetables to sell after the harvest in his community. During the harvest, all of the family members get involved. His goal is to improve his agribusiness to strengthen his family's financial stability. He also wants to expand his plantations so that he can give her son a decent inheritance.

Ranjana has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to expand their agribusiness. They have decided to grow bitter gourd, which is a very useful crop and in great demand. So they think it will be a lucrative business, and they will earn additional profit from this business to lead a decent life.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase bitter gourd seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Afija

texts.en:
Afija is a 40-year-old married woman of Maynaguri. She lives in a Kaccha house (made of mud and straw) with her husband and two children. She is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to lead a smooth and peaceful life, but she is very much aware of providing education to her children. Both of her children are receiving education. 

Afija has her own animal husbandry business where she works all day and looks after the animals. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Both Afija and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children.

She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. This loan will give Afija an opportunity to make their dream true of expanding her animal husbandry business. Now, Afija and her husband are successfully running their business and have taken on the market for selling milk products and also vegetables.

They both are grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 24-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. Her husband is 31 years old. Asma has received education up to class VIII (grade 8) and her husband is illiterate, able to sign his name only. Asma lives in the small town of Maynaguri. Her child is too small to go to school.

Asma is a housewife and her husband is a farmer who sells his own cultivated products in the local village market. Her husband is the only income earner and his income is not enough to maintain a decent lifestyle. For this reason, Asma decided to start jute cultivation so that she can make different jute items like bags and home decoration items and sell those decorative craft items to the wholesale market. Asma has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers and necessary ingredients to grow jute.

She hopes this business will enable her to develop her family income and upgrade their financial status. Asma also dreams of giving a good future to her child and having a Pakka house (made of bricks and cement) of her own with the profit from her business.
Asma is obliged and grateful to Kiva and BJS for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and necessary ingredients to grow jutes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old and from Naivasha. He is married and is supporting two children who are in school.

Paul has an electronics business, which he has been running for many years. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy more TVs, DVDs, radios, etc. to add to his stock. He hopes to expand his electronic shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy TVs, DVDs, and radios for his electronics business

loans.name: Dúo La Brigada Group

texts.es: Dúo la Brigada La señora Blanca Estela es la encargada de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de pastelitos de toda clase y sabores desde hace 9 años, también dos veces a la semana se dedica a reparar calzado para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene varios pedidos de pastelitos para algunas señoras que entregar y no le alcanza el dinero, por eso necesita hacer un préstamo y no quedarles mal a sus clientes que le han hecho los pedidos de pastelitos.  Con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo también es vendedora en la colonia donde vive y su sueño ser una madre ejemplar en ventas para que sus hijos también sean unos grandes vendedores en el mañana.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Esteia is the leader of this small group of two called La Brigada. She has been selling cakes of all kinds and flavours for nine years. As well, she repairs footwear for men, women and children.

Blanca Esteia has orders for deliveries of cakes from several ladies but cannot afford to make them. For this reason she needs a loan to buy ingredients so she doesn’t disappoint her customers. 

Her children and husband help her run the business in the community where she lives. Her dream is to be a good mother with a successful business so that her children will also have a good business to run in the future.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make cakes to sell

loans.name: Philiph

texts.en:
Philiph is 25 years old, married, and the father of a one-year-old girl whom he supports. Philiph runs a retail shop and BodaBoda (bicycle transport) business in Kapsabet town in Nandi County. He has been in this business for the last four years. From this business he gets a monthly income of KES 60,000. 

Philiph has borrowed a loan of KES 70,000. With this loan, he will purchase wheat flour, baking powder, yeast, sugar, salt, maize flour, tea leaves, and rice, among other food items he will need to use in his shop. With the anticipated profits he will expand his business, put away some savings, and repay his loan. 

Philiph's dreams are to give the best to his family by meeting their financial needs and to provide the best education to his child.  He also wants to expand his business to a more modern and classy mini-supermarket, as well as open branches in other nearby towns.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and other household goods for resale.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 34 years old, married, and has four children. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Shabana requested her sixth loan from Kashf Foundation for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to expand her business and to provide a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) works as a hawker. He sells different items like socks, men’s wear, etc. on his motorbike to the people of his community. In this way he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses. 

In order to meet their everyday expenditures, more income is required so Saima contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. Her husband will utilize this loan to purchase more items such as socks, waists, and elastics. Saima is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Their dreams are to maximize their profits from this business and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as socks, waists, and elastics.

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en:
Sarafeen is a married lady and has been running a small general store at the corner of her house for many years to help manage her household expenditures. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

In order to fully stock her store, Sarafeen requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet her customers' increasing demand. Sarafeen wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children. Rukhsana, along with her husband, has been in the business of making artificial jewelery for many years. She is trying hard to increase her earnings. 

In order to meet her orders on time and boost her sales, Rukhsana has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend her earnings on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel  de 47 años  de edad es casado,  vive con sus  dos hijos y su esposa  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de leña seca y también a la actividad de albañilería, El y su Familia viven en la comunidad de la chileza,  San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don Juan en su negocio el vende, leña seca a las tortilleras dueños de restaurantes y ladrilleras, en su vehículo el sale todos los días  de la semana y también vende agua en cisterna ya que hay varios lugares del sector que  no cuentan con agua potable.
Don Juna está solicitando el préstamo para arreglar una fosa séptica  que tiene en su casa para uso de su sanitario, con el apoyo de este crédito el mejorara su calidad de vida de el y su familia. 
Don Juna su deseo es tener un buen negocio de leña y ganado porque también vende leche y cuajada.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, age 47, is married.  He lives with his two children and his wife in his home.  For three years he has worked selling firewood and also as a construction worker.  He and his family live in the community of Chileza, San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.

In his business, Don Juan sells firewood to tortilla makers, restaurant owners, and brick makers.  He heads out every day of the week in his vehicle and also sells water from a cistern, because in several areas of the community there isn’t potable water.  

Don Juan is asking for this loan to fix a septic tank that he has in his home for the use of his bathroom.  With the help of this loan he will improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

Don Juan’s desire is to have a good business of firewood, as well as cattle, because he also sells milk and cheese curd.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2014

loans.use: to fix a septic tank that he has in his house for the use of his house's bathroom

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been operating a business manufacturing boxes for the past four years. Khadija has tremendous skill in doing it. Initially she made boxes for her friends and relatives, but now she has become famous in her community, catering to a large number of customers. She makes enough to provide for her family.

In order to expand her business, Khadija contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good quality hard boards and card boards in large quantities, as well as some glues, to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family. Khadija is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase good quality hard boards and card boards in large quantities, as well as some glues, for her box-making business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
At the age of 26, Rehana is a married woman who has two children. Six years ago she started a business selling cloth in her community. She always has a great collection of printed cloth to offer to her customers. She earns a good amount of income to manage her household expenditures.

Now Rehana has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy bundles of good quality fabric in different colors. It will help her to increase her sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality fabric in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Delmy Suyapa

texts.es: Delmy, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Delmy se gana la vida vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo como, cremas, champú, desodorantes, lociones, ropa, etc. Ella trabajo por varios años en una maquila y hace un año se dedica a vender cosméticos en forma ambulante. Solicita 20,000 lempiras para surtir de productos de catálogos como champú, cremas, desodorantes, lociones, y ropa. también ocupara una parte para cancelar un saldo de una pequeña deuda y piensa cambiar unas laminas al techo de su casa. Con este préstamo va aprovechar las promociones de cosméticos. Su plan es seguir creciendo en su negocio y que sus hijos logren estudiar.
texts.en:
32-year old Delmy is married, has three children, and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She earns her living selling cosmetics from a catalog: creams, shampoo, deodorants, lotions, clothing etc. 

Delmy worked for several years in a factory, and then a year ago started to sell cosmetics in the streets. She is seeking a loan of 20,000 lempiras to buy stock from a catalog, items such as shampoo, creams, deodorants, lotions, and clothing which are on sale at the moment.  She also wants to use some of the loan money to pay off a small debt and to buy metal sheets for the roof of her house. 

Delmy’s plan for the future is to continue growing her business. She also wants her children to stay in school.

loans.use: buy cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 44 years old from Naivasha; he is married and is supporting two children who are in school.

Francis has a welding business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his six loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy some equipment for his welding business.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy welding equipment.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a good number of customers and makes a good income which supplements  the family's income. 

Previously, with Kiva's help, she was able to expand her business. She is in her 8th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 29-years-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife, two sons, and two daughters in a very simple house. 

Sulaiman works as an employee in the public sector wehere he earns a low income. He is also a student in a local university studying for a  masters degree in business administration. He would like to use the masters degree to find a better job in the future. 

Sulaiman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.  Sulaiman will be able to do his homework and write the reports more easily. 

Sulaiman appears in the photo with is new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies.

loans.name: Marseel

texts.en:
Marseel is a 20-year-old single man from Khanyounis. He lives with his family in a very old house. Marseel's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Marseel is a student in a local university where he studies Information Technology. He would like to take a BA degree and find a better job in the future. 

Marseel  took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Marseel will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.
